Text

[Pocket Upton]92-pocket had come down late and panting , in spite of [his]92-pocket daily exemption from first school , and the postcard on [his]92-pocket plate had taken away [his]92-pocket remaining modicum of breath . [He]92-pocket could have wept over it in [open hall]176-open hall , and would probably have done so in the subsequent seclusion of [[his]92-pocket own study]177-his own study , had not an obvious way out of [his]92-pocket difficulty been bothering [him]92-pocket by that time almost as much as the difficulty itself . For it was not a very honest way , and [the unfortunate Pocket]92-pocket had been called “ [a conscientious ass ”]2285-a conscientious ass ”[92-pocket] by [some of the nicest fellows in [[his]92-pocket house]179-his house]178-some of the nicest fellows in his house . Perhaps [he]92-pocket deserved the epithet for going even as straight as [he]92-pocket did to [[his]92-pocket house - master]180-his house - master , who was discovered correcting proses with a blue pencil and a briar pipe . “ Please , [sir]2286-sir , [Mr. Coverley]93-mr. coverley ca n't have [me]181-the boy , [sir]2286-sir . [He]93-mr. coverley 's got a case of chicken - pox , [sir]2286-sir . ”[181-the boy] [The boy]181-the boy produced the actual intimation in a few strokes of an honoured but laconic pen . [The man]182-the man poised [his]182-the man pencil and puffed [his]182-the man pipe . “ Then [you]181-the boy must come back to - night , and [I]182-the man 'm just as glad . It 's all nonsense [your]181-the boy staying the night whenever [you]181-the boy go up to see [that doctor of yours]2289-that doctor of yours . ”[182-the man] “ [He]93-mr. coverley makes a great point of it , [sir]2286-sir . At the moment [he]92-pocket was perhaps neither so acutely conscientious nor such an ass as [[his]92-pocket critics]183-his critics considered [him]92-pocket . “ What else do [you]94-mr. spearman propose ? ”[94-mr. spearman] inquired [Mr. Spearman]94-mr. spearman . “ Well , [sir]2286-sir , [I]94-mr. spearman have [plenty of other friends in [town]2294-town]2293-plenty of other friends in town , [sir]2286-sir . But there was no guile in any [Upton]97-mr. upton ; in that one respect [the third and last of [them]186-them]185-the third and last of them resembled [the great twin brethren of whom [he]94-mr. spearman had been prematurely voted a “ pocket edition ”[97-mr. upton] on [his]94-mr. spearman arrival in [the school]188-the school]187-the great twin brethren of whom he had been prematurely voted a “ pocket edition ” on his arrival in the school . This was obvious even to [Mr. Spearman]94-mr. spearman , who was [an average man]193-an average man . [He]94-mr. spearman had never disguised [his]94-mr. spearman own disappointment in [the youngest Upton]194-the youngest upton , but had often made [him]94-mr. spearman the butt of outspoken and disastrous comparisons . [He]94-mr. spearman made a note of the two names and addresses . “ [You]92-pocket 're quite sure [they]2310-they 'll put [you]92-pocket up , are [you]92-pocket ? ”[94-mr. spearman] “ Absolutely certain , [sir]2286-sir . ”[94-mr. spearman] “ But [you]92-pocket 'll come straight back if [they]2310-they ca n't ? ”[94-mr. spearman] “ Rather , [sir]2286-sir ! ”[94-mr. spearman] “ Then run away , and do n't miss [[your]92-pocket train]2313-your train . ”[92-pocket] [Pocket]92-pocket interpreted the first part of the injunction so literally as to arrive very breathless in [[his]92-pocket study]197-his study . [That diminutive cell]198-that diminutive cell was garnished with more ambitious pictures than the generality of [its]198-that diminutive cell order ; but the best of them was framed in the ivy round the lattice window , and its foreground was [the nasturtiums in the flower - box]199-the nasturtiums in the flower - box . [Pocket]92-pocket glanced down into [the quad]200-the quad , where [the fellows]201-the fellows were preparing construes for [second school]202-second school in sunlit groups on [garden seats]203-garden seats . At that moment the bell began . And by the time [Pocket]92-pocket had changed [his]92-pocket black tie for a green one with red spots , in which [he]92-pocket had come back after the Easter holidays , the bell had stopped and [the quad]200-the quad was empty ; before it filled again [he]92-pocket would be up in [town]2294-town and on [his]92-pocket way to [Welbeck Street]4-welbeck street in a hansom . The very journey was a joy . It was such sport to be flying through a world of buttercups and daisies in [a train]206-a train again , so refreshing to feel as good as [anybody else in the third smoker]207-anybody else in the third smoker ; for even [the grown men in the corner seats]208-the grown men in the corner seats did not dream of calling [the youth]209-the youth [an “ old ass]2314-an “ old ass , ”[210-a young one] much less [a young one]210-a young one , to [his]92-pocket face . [[His]92-pocket friends]211-his friends and [contemporaries]212-contemporaries at [school]213-school were in the habit of employing the ameliorating adjective , but there were still [a few fellows in [[Pocket]92-pocket 's house]215-pocket 's house who made an insulting point of the other]214-a few fellows in pocket 's house who made an insulting point of the other . All , however , seemed agreed as to the noun ; and it was pleasant to cast off [friend]216-friend and [foe]217-foe for a change , to sit comfortably unknown and unsuspected of one 's foibles in [the train]218-the train . It made [Pocket]92-pocket feel a bit of [a man]219-a man ; but then [he]92-pocket really was almost seventeen , and in [the Middle Fifth]220-the middle fifth , and allowed to smoke asthma cigarettes in bed . [He]92-pocket took one out of a cardboard box in [his]92-pocket bag , and thought it might do [him]92-pocket good to smoke it now . But [an adult tobacco - smoker]221-an adult tobacco - smoker looked so curiously at the little thin cross between cigar and cigarette , that it was transferred to a pocket unlit , and [the coward]222-the coward hid [himself]222-the coward behind [his]222-the coward paper , in which there were several items of immediate interest to [him]222-the coward . Would the match hold out at [Lord]223-lord 's ? If not , which was the best of the Wednesday matinees ? [Pocket]92-pocket had received a pound from [home]224-home for [his]92-pocket expenses , so that these questions took an adventitious precedence over even such attractive topics as an execution and a murder that bade fair to lead to one . But the horrors had [their]225-their turn , and having supped on the newspaper supply , [he]92-pocket continued the feast in [Henry Dunbar]98-henry dunbar , the novel [he]92-pocket had brought with [him]92-pocket in [his]92-pocket bag . There was something like a murder ! It was so exciting as to detach [Pocket Upton]92-pocket from the flying buttercups and daisies , from the reek of [the smoking carriage]226-the smoking carriage , the real crimes in the paper , and all thoughts of [London]3-london until [he]92-pocket found [himself]92-pocket there too soon . [The asthma specialist]227-the asthma specialist was one of [those enterprising practitioners whose professional standing is never quite on a par with [their]228-those enterprising practitioners whose professional standing is never quite on a par with their material success material success]228-those enterprising practitioners whose professional standing is never quite on a par with their material success . The injurious discrepancy may have spoilt [his]92-pocket temper , or it may be that [his]92-pocket temper was at the root of the prejudice against [him]92-pocket . [He]92-pocket was never very amiable with [Pocket Upton]92-pocket , [a casual patient]229-a casual patient in every sense ; but this morning [Dr. Bompas]99-dr. bompas had some call to complain . “ [You]92-pocket mean to tell [me]99-dr. bompas , ”[99-dr. bompas] [he]99-dr. bompas expostulated , “ that [you]92-pocket 've gone back to the cigarettes in spite of what [I]99-dr. bompas said last time ? If [you]92-pocket were n't [a stupid schoolboy]2315-a stupid schoolboy [I]99-dr. bompas should throw up [your]92-pocket case ! ”[99-dr. bompas] [Pocket]92-pocket did not wish to have [his]92-pocket case thrown up ; it would mean no more days and nights in [town]2294-town . So [he]92-pocket accepted [his]99-dr. bompas rebuke without visible resentment . “ It 's the only way [I]92-pocket can stop an attack , ”[92-pocket] [he]92-pocket mumbled . “ Nonsense ! ”[231-the specialist] snapped [the specialist]231-the specialist . “ [You]92-pocket can make [yourself]92-pocket coffee in the night , as [you]92-pocket 've done before . ”[231-the specialist] “ [I]99-dr. bompas ca n't at [school]213-school . [You]181-the boy will get this prescription made up in two bottles ; take the first before [you]181-the boy go to bed to - night , and the second if [you]181-the boy wake with an attack before five in the morning . [I]99-dr. bompas want [you]181-the boy to go to bed early , tell [them]2322-friends not to call [you]181-the boy in the morning , and come back to [me]99-dr. bompas the moment [you]181-the boy 've had [your]181-the boy breakfast . ”[99-dr. bompas] [They]245-they parted amicably after all , and [Pocket]92-pocket went off only wondering whether [he]92-pocket ought to have said positively that [he]92-pocket was staying with [friends]2322-friends when [he]92-pocket might be going back to [school]213-school . But [Dr. Bompas]99-dr. bompas had been so short with [him]92-pocket at first as to discourage unnecessary explanations ; besides , there could be no question of [his]92-pocket going back that night . And the difficulty of the morning , which [he]92-pocket had quite forgotten in [the train]218-the train , was not allowed to mar a moment of [his]92-pocket day in [town]2294-town . The time - table of [that boy]250-that boy 's day must speak for itself . It was already one o'clock , and [he]92-pocket was naturally hungry , especially after the way [his]92-pocket breakfast had been spoilt by [Coverley]93-mr. coverley 's card . At 1.15 [he]92-pocket was munching a sausage roll and sipping chocolate at [[a pastry - cook]251-a pastry - cook 's in [Oxford Street]5-oxford street]252-a pastry - cook 's in oxford street . The sausage roll , like the cup of chocolate , was soon followed by another ; and a big Bath bun completed a debauch of which [Dr. Bompas]99-dr. bompas would undoubtedly have disapproved . At 1.45 , from the top of [an Atlas omnibus]253-an atlas omnibus in [Baker Street]6-baker street , [he]92-pocket espied a placard with “ Collapse of Middlesex ”[92-pocket] in appalling capitals . And at [the station]254-the station [he]92-pocket got down to learn the worst before going on to [[Lord]255-lord 's]256-lord 's for nothing . The worst was so hopelessly bad that [Pocket]92-pocket wished [himself]92-pocket nearer [the theatres]257-the theatres , and then it was that [the terra - cotta pile of [Madame Tussaud]100-madame tussaud 's]258-the terra - cotta pile of madame tussaud 's thrust itself seductively upon [his]92-pocket vision . [He]92-pocket had not been [there]2306-there for years . [He]92-pocket had often wanted to go again , and go alone . [He]92-pocket remembered being taken by [[his]92-pocket sister]260-his sister when [a little boy]261-a little boy at [Coverley 's]93-mr. coverley , but [she]260-his sister had refused to go into [the Chamber of Horrors]262-the chamber of horrors , and [he]92-pocket had been relieved at the time but sorry ever afterwards , because so many of [the boys of those days]263-the boys of those days had seen everything and seemed none the worse for the adventure . It was one of the things [he]92-pocket had always wanted not so much to do as to have done . The very name of [the Chamber of Horrors]262-the chamber of horrors had frozen [his]92-pocket infant blood when [he]92-pocket first heard it on the lips of [a criminological governess]265-a criminological governess . On the brink of seventeen there was something of [the budding criminologist about [Pocket Upton]92-pocket [himself]92-pocket]266-the budding criminologist about pocket upton himself ; had not a real murder and [Henry Dunbar]98-henry dunbar formed [his]92-pocket staple reading in [the train]218-the train ? And yet [the boy]181-the boy had other sensibilities which made [him]181-the boy hesitate outside [the building]269-the building , and enter eventually with quite [a nutter under the waistcoat]270-a nutter under the waistcoat . A band in fantastic livery was playing away in [the marble hall]271-the marble hall ; but [Pocket]92-pocket had no ear for [their]272-their music , though [he]92-pocket was fond enough of [a band]273-a band . And though history was one of [his]92-pocket few strong points at [school]213-school , the glittering galaxy of [kings]275-kings and [queens]276-queens appealed to [him]92-pocket no more than [the great writers at [their]277-the great writers at their little desks little desks]277-the great writers at their little desks and [the great cricketers]278-the great cricketers in [their]278-the great cricketers unconvincing flannels . [They]279-they were waxworks one and all . But when the extra sixpence had been paid at [the inner turnstile]280-the inner turnstile , and [he]92-pocket had passed down a dungeon stair into [the dim vaults below]281-the dim vaults below , [his]92-pocket imagination was at work upon the dreadful faces in [the docks]282-the docks before [he]92-pocket had brought [his]92-pocket catalogue to bear on one of [them]282-the docks . Here were wretches whose vile deeds had long been familiar to [the schoolboy]283-the schoolboy through a work on [[his]283-the schoolboy father]284-his father 's shelves called Annals of [Our]285-our Time . [He]92-pocket recalled bad nights when certain of those annals had kept [him]92-pocket awake long after [his]92-pocket attack ; and here were the actual monsters , not scowling and ferocious as [he]92-pocket had always pictured them , but far more horribly demure and plump . Here were [immortal malefactors like [the Mannings]101-the mannings]286-immortal malefactors like the mannings ; here were [Rush]102-rush and Greenacre cheek by jowl , looking as though [they]279-they had stepped out of [Dickens]8-dickens in [their]279-they obsolete raiment , looking anything but what [they]279-they had been . [Some]287-some wore the very clothes [their]287-some quick bodies had filled ; here and there were authentic tools of death , rusty pistols , phials of poison with the seals still bright , and a smug face smirking over all in self - conscious infamy . There was not enough of the waxwork about [these creatures]288-these creatures ; in the poor light , and [their]288-these creatures own clothes , and the veritable dock in which many of [them]288-these creatures had heard [their]288-these creatures doom , [they]288-these creatures looked hideously human and alive . [One]289-one , [a little old man]290-a little old man , sat not in [the dock]291-the dock but on the drop itself , the noose dangling in front of [him]290-a little old man ; and [the schoolboy]283-the schoolboy felt sorry for [him]290-a little old man , for [his]290-a little old man silver bristles , for the broad arrows on [his]290-a little old man poor legs , until [he]283-the schoolboy found out who it was . Then [he]283-the schoolboy shuddered . It was [Charles Peace]103-charles peace . [He]283-the schoolboy had first heard of [Charles Peace]103-charles peace from [the nice governess aforesaid]293-the nice governess aforesaid ; and here under [his]283-the schoolboy nose were [the old ruffian]294-the old ruffian 's revolver , and the strap that strapped it to [his]283-the schoolboy wrist , with the very spectacles [he]283-the schoolboy had wiped and worn . [The hobbledehoy]295-the hobbledehoy was almost as timorously entranced as [he]295-the hobbledehoy had been in infancy by untimely tale of crime . [He]295-the hobbledehoy stood gloating over the gruesome relics , over ropes which had hanged [men whose trials [he]295-the hobbledehoy had read for [himself]295-the hobbledehoy in later days]296-men whose trials he had read for himself in later days , and yet wondering with it all whether [he]295-the hobbledehoy would ever get these things out of [his]295-the hobbledehoy mind again . [They]297-they filled it to overflowing . [He]295-the hobbledehoy might have had the horrid place to [himself]295-the hobbledehoy . Yet [he]295-the hobbledehoy had entered [it]298-it with much amusement at the heels of [a whole family in deep mourning]299-a whole family in deep mourning , [a [bereaved family]301-bereaved family drowning [their]301-bereaved family sorrow in a sea of gore]300-a bereaved family drowning their sorrow in a sea of gore , [[their]301-bereaved family pilot]302-their pilot through the catalogue [a conscientious orphan with a monotonous voice and a genius for mis - pronunciation]303-a conscientious orphan with a monotonous voice and a genius for mis - pronunciation . [Pocket]92-pocket had soon ceased to see or hear [him]295-the hobbledehoy or [any other being not made of wax]304-any other being not made of wax . [Pocket]92-pocket was not sorry to be back in the adulterated sunshine and the comparatively fresh air of [the Marylebone Road]307-the marylebone road . [He]92-pocket was ashamed to find that it was after four o'clock . [Guy]104-guy and [Vivian Knaggs]105-vivian would be [home]224-home from [Westminster]1-westminster in another hour . Still it was no use getting there before [them]309-them , and [he]92-pocket might as well walk as not ; it was pleasant to rub shoulders with flesh and blood once more , and to look in faces not made of wax in [the devil]310-the devil 's image . [His]92-pocket way , which [he]92-pocket knew of old , would naturally have led [him]92-pocket past [Miss Harbottle]96-miss harbottle 's door ; but , as [she]96-miss harbottle was only to be [his]92-pocket second string for the night , [he]92-pocket preferred not to be seen by [that old lady]311-that old lady yet . Such was the tiny spring of an important action ; it led [the wanderer]312-the wanderer into [Circus Road]9-circus road and a quite unforeseen temptation . In [the Circus Road]313-the circus road there happens to be [a highly respectable pawnbroker 's shop]314-a highly respectable pawnbroker 's shop ; in [the pawnbroker]315-the pawnbroker 's window the chances are that [you]316-you might still find a motley collection of umbrellas , mandolines , [family Bibles]317-family bibles , ornaments and clocks , strings of watches , trays of purses , opera - glasses , biscuit - boxes , photograph frames and cheap jewellery , all of which could not tempt [you]316-you less than [they]309-them did [Pocket Upton the other June]92-pocket . There were only two things in the window that interested [him]92-pocket at all , and they were not both temptations . One was an old rosewood camera , and [Pocket]92-pocket was interested in cameras old and new ; but the thing that tempted [him]92-pocket was a little revolver at five - and - six , with what looked like a box of cartridges beside it , apparently thrown in for the price . A revolver to take back to [school]213-school ! A revolver to fire in picked places on the slow walks with a slow companion which were all the exercise [this unfortunate fellow]319-this unfortunate fellow could take ! A revolver and cartridges complete , so that [one]289-one could try it now , in no time , with [Guy]104-guy and [Vivian]105-vivian at the end of [[their]321-their garden in [St. John 's Wood Park]2-st. john 's wood park]322-their garden in st. john 's wood park ! And all very likely for five bob if one bargained a bit ! [Pocket]92-pocket took out [his]92-pocket purse and saw what a hole the expenditure of any such sum would make . But what was that if it filled a gap in [his]92-pocket life ? Of coure it would have been breaking a school rule , but [he]92-pocket was prepared to take the consequences if found out ; it need not involve [his]92-pocket notion of dishonour . Still , it must be recorded that [the young or old as]323-the young or old as was conscientious enough to hesitate before making [his]92-pocket fatal plunge into [the pawnbroker 's shop]324-the pawnbroker 's shop . [They]2297-the boys seemed very glad to see [him]92-pocket , however , and the stiffness was wearing off even before [Pocket]92-pocket produced [his]92-pocket revolver in [the basement room where [the two Westminsters]340-the two westminsters prepared [their]340-the two westminsters lessons and had [their]340-the two westminsters evening meal]339-the basement room where the two westminsters prepared their lessons and had their evening meal . There was a great scene about it . [Pocket]92-pocket was very contrite , indeed , drew [his]92-pocket weapon 's teeth with a promptitude that might have been [his]92-pocket death , and offered it and them to be placed under lock and key until [he]92-pocket left . [Old Miss Harbottle]96-miss harbottle , [[his]92-pocket mother 's great friend]363-his mother 's great friend , would have none of [him]92-pocket either ! [He]92-pocket stopped on the way to [Baker Street]6-baker street to make sure . [The garden gate]364-the garden gate was one that only opened by a catch and a cable manipulated indoors . [Pocket]92-pocket confronted a crevice of quilted dressing - gown and grey curls ; but [[[his]92-pocket mother]365-his mother 's friend 's mastiff]366-his mother 's friend 's mastiff was making night so hideous within , and trying so hard to get at [[his]366-his mother 's friend 's mastiff mother 's son]367-his mother 's son , that it was some time before [he]366-his mother 's friend 's mastiff could exchange an intelligible word with [[the brute]368-the brute 's mistress]369-the brute 's mistress . But [the big hotels]381-the big hotels were all full to overflowing ; and at [the only little one]382-the only little one [he]372-the rejected visitor tried [the boy]181-the boy lost [his]181-the boy temper like [a man]219-a man on being requested to deposit six shillings before proceeding to [[his]181-the boy room]385-his room . [Pocket]92-pocket had not got it to deposit , and the galling reflection caused [him]92-pocket to construe the demand as a deliberate reflection upon [his]92-pocket outward respectability — as if [he]92-pocket could not have borrowed the money from [Dr. Bompas]99-dr. bompas in the morning ! “ [I]92-pocket 'll see [you]92-pocket blowed , ”[92-pocket] was [his]92-pocket muttered reply , and [he]372-the rejected visitor caught up [his]372-the rejected visitor bag in a passion . “ All right , [little man]2331-little man ! [I]386-the dapper cashier should n't be rude about it , ”[386-the dapper cashier] said [the dapper cashier]386-the dapper cashier . “ If [I]386-the dapper cashier could n't pay [my]386-the dapper cashier shot [I]386-the dapper cashier should sleep in [the Park]2332-the park , on a nice fine night like this . ”[386-the dapper cashier] “ [I]92-pocket shall ! ”[92-pocket] shouted [Pocket]92-pocket through [his]92-pocket teeth , as though that would prevent the brute of [a cashier]387-a cashier from sleeping soundly in [his]92-pocket bed . And it was [his]92-pocket own idle and childish threat that set [him]92-pocket presently wondering what else [he]92-pocket was to do . [He]92-pocket had the spirit of adventure , as [we]388-we have seen . [He]92-pocket had the timorous , or let [us]388-we say , the imaginative temperament , which lends to adventure its very salt . [He]92-pocket wished to have done dangerous or heroic things , if not to have to do them . [He]92-pocket had so little to boast about ; [[his]92-pocket brothers]189-his brothers , and [so many other fellows of [his]92-pocket own age]390-so many other fellows of his own age , had so much . It would make a great yarn some day , how [he]92-pocket had come up from [school]213-school to see [a doctor]392-a doctor — and slept in [the Park]2332-the park ! Meanwhile [he]92-pocket had only a vague idea of [his]92-pocket way [there]2306-there ; [he]92-pocket knew hardly anything of [London]3-london except [St. John 's Wood]16-st. john 's wood and [[his]92-pocket present landmark of [the Nelson column]396-the nelson column]395-his present landmark of the nelson column and the Landseer lions . [He]92-pocket knew [them]397-them from having stayed some time ( under [another doctor]398-another doctor ) as [a child]399-a child at [Shaw 's Hotel]12-shaw 's hotel . But , [I]0-i say ! What would [Bompas]99-dr. bompas say to [his]99-dr. bompas sleeping out , and what sort of night could [he]99-dr. bompas expect in the open air ? [He]92-pocket had an overcoat . It had been in [his]92-pocket way all day ; it would come in more than handy for the night . And it suddenly struck [Pocket]92-pocket , with all the force of a forgotten novelty , that [he]92-pocket had a revolver and cartridges as well . That decided [him]92-pocket . Not that [he]92-pocket seriously thought [himself]92-pocket [the kind of person to use a revolver with resolution or effect]400-the kind of person to use a revolver with resolution or effect ; but it made [him]92-pocket feel doughty and even truculent to find the means of heroic defence all ready to [his]92-pocket hand . [He]92-pocket began to plume [himself]92-pocket on [his]92-pocket providential purchase . [He]92-pocket would sell [his]92-pocket young life dearly if [he]92-pocket fell among [[London]3-london thieves]401-london thieves ; in [his]92-pocket death [he]92-pocket would not be unhonoured at [school]213-school or at [home]224-home . Obituary phrases of a laudatory type sprang like tears to a mind still healthy enough to dash them away again , as though they had been real tears ; but it was with all the nervous exaltation of [the unsuspected desperado]404-the unsuspected desperado that [he]92-pocket inquired [his]92-pocket way of [a colossal constable at the corner of [Pall Mall]17-pall mall and [the Haymarket]406-the haymarket]405-a colossal constable at the corner of pall mall and the haymarket . [The man]182-the man wanted to know if [he]92-pocket meant [Hyde Park Corner]18-hyde park corner . “ Yes , ”[92-pocket] said [Pocket]92-pocket , hastily , because [his]92-pocket heart was in [his]92-pocket mouth and [the policeman]408-the policeman looked as though [he]408-the policeman had seen it there . And [he]92-pocket overshot the mark in [the motor omnibus]409-the motor omnibus through being ashamed to ask again , only alighting at [Albert Gate]19-albert gate ; but here there was quite a little stream of [decent people]410-decent people to follow without further tremors into [the indubitable Park]411-the indubitable park . [He]92-pocket followed [them]412-them across [the drive]413-the drive and across [Rotten Row]20-rotten row , gaining confidence as [he]92-pocket went . In a minute it was all delightful ; [his]92-pocket eyes were turned outward by all there was to see ; and now [his]92-pocket chief fear was lest [some one or other of [the several passers]415-the several passers]414-some one or other of the several passers should stand in [his]92-pocket path and ask what [he]92-pocket was doing [there]2306-there . [He]92-pocket was still afraid of speaking or being spoken to , but no longer unreasonably so . [Detection]111-detection as [an escaped schoolboy]417-an escaped schoolboy was [his]92-pocket one great dread ; [he]92-pocket felt [he]92-pocket was doing something for which [he]92-pocket might be expelled . But [nobody]377-nobody took any notice of [him]92-pocket ; this gradually encouraged [him]92-pocket to take more notice of [other people]419-other people , when [he]92-pocket found , not altogether to [his]92-pocket surprise , that [the majority of those passing through the Park at that late hour]420-the majority of those passing through the park at that late hour were hardly of [[his]92-pocket own class]421-his own class . So much the more infinitesimal were the chances of [his]92-pocket being recognised or even suspected for what [he]92-pocket was . There were [young men in straw hats]422-young men in straw hats , there were [red - coated soldiers]423-red - coated soldiers , and there were [girls]424-girls . [They]425-they all filled [the schoolboy]283-the schoolboy with [their]425-they fascinating possibilities . [They]425-they were Life . [The boy]181-the boy 's heart beat at what [he]181-the boy heard and saw . [The couples]428-the couples were hilarious and unrefined . [One wench]429-one wench , almost under [his]181-the boy nose , gave [[her]429-one wench soldier]430-her soldier a slap with such a remark as [Pocket]92-pocket had never heard from [a woman]431-a woman 's lips before . [He]181-the boy turned away , tingling , and leant upon the parapet of [a bridge [he]181-the boy had been in the act of crossing]432-a bridge he had been in the act of crossing , and thought of [school]213-school and [home]224-home and [Mr. Coverley]93-mr. coverley . It was not really [a bridge]435-a bridge at all . It was only [the eastern extremity of [the Serpentine]21-the serpentine]436-the eastern extremity of the serpentine ; but as [the boy]181-the boy leant over the stone balustrade , and gazed upon the artificial flood , broadening out indefinitely in the darkness , it might have been [the noblest river in [the world]439-the world]438-the noblest river in the world . [Its]438-the noblest river in the world banks were muffled in a feather boa of trees , bedizened by a chain of many lights ; the lights of [a real bridge]440-a real bridge made a diadem in the distance ; and between these sped the lamps of [invisible vehicles]441-invisible vehicles , like fretful fireflies . And [the still water]442-the still water gave back every glimmer with its own brilliance , unchallenged and undimmed by moon or star , for not a trace of either was in the sky ; and yet it was the most wonderful sky [the boy]181-the boy had ever seen — a black sky tinged with sullen rose , or a red sky seen through smoked glasses , [he]181-the boy hardly knew which [he]181-the boy would have called it . But [he]181-the boy did know that warm and angry glow for the reflection of [London]3-london 's light and life ; [he]181-the boy could not forget [he]181-the boy was in [London]3-london for a moment . [[Her]3-london mighty machinery with its million wheels]444-her mighty machinery with its million wheels throbbed perpetually in [his]181-the boy ears ; and yet between the beats would come the quack of a wild duck near at hand , the splash of a leaping fish , the plaintive whistle of water - fowl : altogether such a chorus of incongruities as was not lost upon [[our]445-our very impressionable young vagabond]446-our very impressionable young vagabond . The booming strokes of eleven recalled [him]181-the boy to a sense of time and [his]181-the boy immediate needs . [His]181-the boy great adventure was still before [him]181-the boy ; [he]181-the boy pushed on , bag in hand , to select its scene . [Another road]447-another road [he]181-the boy crossed , alive with the lamps of cyclists , and came presently upon a wide space intersected with broad footpaths from which [he]181-the boy shrank ; it was altogether too public here ; [he]181-the boy was approaching an exposed corner in an angle of [lighted streets]448-lighted streets , with [the Marble Arch]449-the marble arch at [its]449-the marble arch apex , as a signboard made quite clear . [He]181-the boy had come right across [the Park]2332-the park ; back over the grass , keeping rather more to the right , in the direction of those trees , was the best thing now . It was here that [he]181-the boy found the grass distinctly damp ; this really was enough to deter [an asthmatic]451-an asthmatic , already beginning to feel asthmatical . [Pocket Upton]92-pocket , however , belonged to [the large class of people]452-the large class of people , weak and strong alike , who are more than [loth to abandon a course of action once taken]453-loth to abandon a course of action once taken . It would have required a very severe attack to baulk [him]181-the boy of [his]181-the boy night out and its subsequent description to electrified ears . But when bad steering had brought [him]181-the boy up at the bandstand , [the deserted chairs]454-the deserted chairs seemed an ordained compromise between prudence and audacity , and [he]181-the boy had climbed into [the fenced enclosure]455-the fenced enclosure when [another enormous policeman]456-another enormous policeman rose up horribly in [its]455-the fenced enclosure midst . “ What are [you]92-pocket doing [here]2333-here ? ”[457-this policeman] inquired [this policeman]457-this policeman , striding upon [Pocket]92-pocket with inexorable tread . “ No harm , [I]457-this policeman hope , ”[457-this policeman] replied [[our]458-our hero]459-our hero humbly , but with unusual readiness . “ Nor no good either , [I]408-the policeman 'll be bound ! ”[408-the policeman] said [the policeman]408-the policeman , standing over [him]92-pocket . “ [I]92-pocket was only going to sit down , ”[92-pocket] protested [Pocket]92-pocket , having satisfied [his]92-pocket conscience that in the first place that was all [he]92-pocket really had been going to do . “ There are plenty of places to sit down , ”[408-the policeman] rejoined [the policeman]408-the policeman . “ [You]92-pocket 're not allowed in [here]2333-here . And unless [you]92-pocket look sharp about it [you]92-pocket wo n't have time to sit down at all . ”[408-the policeman] “ Why not ? ”[408-the policeman] “ [The Park]2332-the park closes at twelve . ”[408-the policeman] “ Closes ? ”[408-the policeman] “ At twelve o'clock , and it 's half - past eleven now . ”[408-the policeman] [The boy]181-the boy 's heart sank into [his]181-the boy wet boots . Here was an end of all [his]181-the boy dashing plans . [He]181-the boy was certain [he]181-the boy had heard or read of [people]463-people sleeping in [the Park]2332-the park ; [he]181-the boy had looked upon [it]2332-the park as [a vast dormitory of [the houseless]466-the houseless]465-a vast dormitory of the houseless ; that was the only reason [he]181-the boy was [there]2306-there . [The offensive clerk in [the hotel]469-the hotel]468-the offensive clerk in the hotel had evidently entertained the same belief . [This idiot of a policeman]470-this idiot of a policeman must be wrong . But [he]181-the boy seemed quite clear about it . “ Did [you]408-the policeman think [we]2336-we were open all night ? ”[181-the boy] [he]181-the boy inquired with a grin . “ [I]92-pocket did , ”[92-pocket] said [Pocket]92-pocket ; and [he]92-pocket was inspired to add , “ [I]92-pocket even thought a lot of [loafers]2337-loafers used to sleep here all night ! ”[92-pocket] [The policeman]408-the policeman chuckled aloud . “ [They]2338-they may if [they]2338-they get up the trees ; that 's about [their]2338-they only chance , ”[408-the policeman] said [he]408-the policeman . “ [You]408-the policeman search [the whole place]2339-the whole place so thoroughly ? ”[408-the policeman] “ [We]2340-we keeps [our]2340-we eyes open , ”[408-the policeman] said [the policeman]408-the policeman significantly , and [Pocket]92-pocket asked no more questions ; [he]92-pocket scaled the forbidden fence and made off with the alacrity of one who meant to go out before [he]92-pocket was put out . Such was [his]92-pocket then sincere and sound intention . But where next to turn , to what seat on [the Embankment]473-the embankment , or what arch in [the slums]474-the slums , in [his]92-pocket ignorance of [London]3-london [he]92-pocket had no idea . Meanwhile , to increase the irony of [his]92-pocket dilemma , now that [he]92-pocket was bent on quitting [the Park]2332-the park [he]92-pocket found [himself]92-pocket striking deeper and deeper into [its]2332-the park heart . [He]92-pocket skirted [a building]476-a building , left [it]476-a building behind and out of sight , and drifted before the wind of destiny between an upright iron fence on one hand and [a restricted open space upon the other]477-a restricted open space upon the other . [He]92-pocket could no longer see a single light ; but the ground rose abruptly across the fence , and was thick with shrubs . [Men]478-men might have been lying behind those shrubs , and [Pocket]92-pocket could not possibly have seen [them]478-men from the path . Did [the policeman]408-the policeman mean to tell [him]92-pocket that [he]92-pocket or [[his]92-pocket comrades]480-his comrades were going to climb every fence and look behind every bush in [Hyde Park]23-hyde park ? [Pocket]92-pocket came to anchor with a new flutter at [his]92-pocket heart . This upright fence was not meant for scaling ; it was like a lot of area palings , as obvious and intentional an obstacle . And [the whole place]2339-the whole place closed at twelve , did it ? The flutter became a serious agitation as [Pocket]92-pocket saw [himself]92-pocket breaking the laws of [the land]482-the land as well as those of [school]213-school , saw [himself]92-pocket not only expelled but put in [prison]484-prison ! Well , so much the better for [his]92-pocket story so long as those penalties were not incurred ; even if they were , so much [the greater hero]485-the greater hero [he]92-pocket ! No wonder [[his]92-pocket best friends]486-his best friends called [him]92-pocket disparaging names ; [he]92-pocket was living up to the hardest of [them]486-his best friends now , and [he]92-pocket with asthma on [him]92-pocket as it was ! But the will was on [him]92-pocket too , the obstinate and reckless will , and the way lay handy in the shape of a row of Park chairs which [Pocket]92-pocket had just passed against the iron palings . [He]92-pocket went back to them , mounted on the first chair , wedged [his]92-pocket bag between two of the spikes , set foot on the back of the chair , and somehow found [himself]92-pocket on the other side without rent or scratch . Then [he]92-pocket listened ; but not a step could [he]92-pocket hear . So then the cunning dog put [his]92-pocket handkerchief through the palings and wiped the grit from the chair on which [he]92-pocket had stood . And [they]487-they called [him]92-pocket [a conscientious ass at [school]213-school]488-a conscientious ass at school ! But then none of these desperate deeds were against [his]92-pocket conscience , and they had all been thrust on [Pocket Upton]92-pocket by circumstances over which [he]92-pocket had lost control when [the last train]490-the last train went without [him]92-pocket from [St. Pancras]11-st. pancras . [They]487-they did not prevent [him]92-pocket from kneeling down behind the biggest bush that [I]0-i [he]92-pocket could find , before curling up underneath it ; neither did [his]92-pocket prayers prevent [him]92-pocket from thinking — even on [his]92-pocket knees — of [his]92-pocket revolver , nor yet — by the force of untimely association — of the other revolvers in [the Chamber of Horrors]262-the chamber of horrors . [He]92-pocket saw [those waxen wretches huddled together in ghastly groups]492-those waxen wretches huddled together in ghastly groups , but the thought of them haunted [him]92-pocket less than it might have done in a feather bed ; [he]92-pocket had [his]92-pocket own perils and adventures to consider now . One thing , however , did come of the remembrance ; [he]92-pocket detached the leather strap [he]92-pocket wore as a watch - guard . And used it to strap a pin - fire revolver , loaded in every chamber , to [his]92-pocket wrist instead . That was the last but one of [the silly boy]493-the silly boy 's proceedings under the bush ; the last of all was to drain the number - one draught prescribed by [Bompas]99-dr. bompas in the morning , and to fling away the phial . The stuff was sweet and sticky in the mouth , and [Pocket]92-pocket felt a singular and most grateful warmth at [his]92-pocket extremities as [he]92-pocket curled up in [his]92-pocket overcoat . It was precisely then that [he]92-pocket heard a measured tread approaching , and held [his]92-pocket breath until it had passed without a pause . Yet the danger was still audible when [the boy]181-the boy dropped off , thinking no more about it , but of [Mr. Coverley]93-mr. coverley and [Charles Peace]103-charles peace and [[his]181-the boy own people]495-his own people down in [Leicestershire]25-leicestershire . It so happened that [[his]181-the boy people in [Leicestershire]25-leicestershire]496-his people in leicestershire were thinking of [him]181-the boy . [They]496-his people in leicestershire had been talking about [him]181-the boy at the very time of [the boy]181-the boy 's inconceivable meanderings in [Hyde Park]23-hyde park . And [two of [them]496-his people in leicestershire]498-two of them were at it still . On [a terrace outside lighted windows]499-a terrace outside lighted windows [a powerful young fellow , in a butterfly collar and a corded smoking jacket]500-a powerful young fellow , in a butterfly collar and a corded smoking jacket , was walking up and down with [a tall girl not unlike [him]181-the boy]501-a tall girl not unlike him in the face ; but [their]502-their faces were only to be seen in glimpses as [they]502-their passed [the drawing - room]329-the drawing - room windows , and at not less regular intervals when a red light in the sky , the source of which was concealed by the garden foliage , became positively brilliant . The air was sweet with the scent of honeysuckle and musk - roses and mown grass ; midges fretted in and out of the open windows . But for the lurid lighting of the sky , with its Cyclopean suggestion of some mammoth forge , [you]504-you were in [the heart of [England]27-england]505-the heart of england undefiled . “ It 's no use [our]502-their talking about [Tony]110-tony , ”[506-the tall girl] [the tall girl]506-the tall girl said . “ [I]506-the tall girl think [you]507-the blunt young man 're frightfully down on [him]110-tony ; [we]502-their shall never agree . ”[506-the tall girl] “ Not as long as [you]112-lettice make a fool of [the fellow]2341-the fellow , ”[507-the blunt young man] said [the blunt young man]507-the blunt young man . “ [Tony]110-tony 's [no fool]2342-no fool , ”[112-lettice] remarked [Lettice Upton]112-lettice , irrelevantly enough . “ [You]113-horace know what [I]113-horace mean , ”[113-horace] snapped [[her]112-lettice brother]508-her brother [Horace]113-horace . “ [He]110-tony 's being absolutely spoilt , and [you]112-lettice 're at the bottom of it . ”[113-horace] “ [I]506-the tall girl did n't give [him]110-tony asthma ! ”[506-the tall girl] “ Do n't be childish , [Letty]114-letty . ”[113-horace] “ But that 's what 's spoiling [his]110-tony life . ”[113-horace] “ [I]506-the tall girl was n't talking about [his]110-tony life . But by a lucky accident [Horace]113-horace had turned the wrath that had been gathering against [himself]113-horace into quite another quarter . “ [I]284-his father agree with [you]113-horace there ! ”[284-his father] cried [[his]113-horace father]284-his father vehemently . “ [I]284-his father do n't believe in [the man]182-the man [myself]284-his father ; but [he]182-the man was recommended by [the surgeon who has done so much for [[your]113-horace poor mother]2379-your poor mother]2378-the surgeon who has done so much for your poor mother , so what could one do but give [him]182-the man a trial ? [The lad]2380-the lad was n't having a fair chance at [school]213-school . This looked like one . [He]182-the man 'd be too old to go to [another school]2388-another school , and too young for [the University]29-the university : no use at the works , and only another worry to [us]2387-we all . ”[284-his father] [Mr. Upton]97-mr. upton spoke from the full heart of [an already worried man]537-an already worried man , not with intentional unkindness , but yet with that unimaginative want of sympathy which is often the instinctive attitude of the sound towards [the unsound]538-the unsound . [He]97-mr. upton hated sickness , and seemed at present surrounded by it . [[His]97-mr. upton wife]539-his wife had taken ill the year before , had undergone a grave operation in the winter , and was still a great anxiety to [him]97-mr. upton . But that was another and a far more serious matter ; [he]97-mr. upton had patience and sympathy enough with [[his]97-mr. upton wife]539-his wife . The case of [the boy]181-the boy was very different . [The father]570-the father had gone to bed at midnight , after an extra allowance of whisky - and - water to take the extra worry off [his]570-the father mind ; it did so for a few hours only to stretch [him]570-the father tragically awake in the early morning . The birds were singing down in [Leicestershire]25-leicestershire as in [Hyde Park]23-hyde park . [He]576-the wakeful man opened [his]576-the wakeful man eyes on a dazzle of broad daylight and sparkling grass . The air was strangely keen for the amount of sunshine , the sunshine curiously rarefied , and the grass swept grey where it did not sparkle . [Pocket]92-pocket 's first sensation was an empty stomach , and [his]92-pocket next a heavy head into which the puzzle of [his]92-pocket position entered by laborious steps . [He]92-pocket was not in bed . [He]92-pocket was not at [school]213-school . [He]92-pocket was not even under the shrub [he]92-pocket now remembered in a mental flash which lit up all [his]92-pocket adventures overnight . [He]92-pocket was wandering ankle deep in the dew , towards a belt of poplars like birch - rods on the skyline , and a row of spiked palings right in front of [his]92-pocket nose . [He]92-pocket had walked in [his]92-pocket sleep for the first time for years , and [some one]580-some one had fired a shot to wake [him]92-pocket . Slow as these automatic discoveries had seemed , they had been in reality so swift that the report was still ringing in [his]92-pocket ears when [he]581-he who must have made it sprang hideously into being across the palings . A hand darted through them and caught [Pocket]92-pocket 's wrist as in a vice . And [he]576-the wakeful man looked up over the spikes into a gnarled face tinged with fear and fury , and working spasmodically at the suppression of some incomprehensible emotion . “ Do [you]92-pocket know what [you]92-pocket did ? ”[182-the man] [the man]182-the man demanded in the end . The question seemed an odd one , but a very slight foreign accent , not to be reproduced phonetically , corresponded with the peculiarity of tense , reminding [Pocket]92-pocket of [the music - masters at [[his]92-pocket school]584-his school]583-the music - masters at his school . [I]118-baumgartner ca n't do without it either , though what is [your]92-pocket misfortune is [my]118-baumgartner own fault . So [you]92-pocket are also [a photographer]2414-a photographer ! ”[118-baumgartner] [he]118-baumgartner added , as the fumes of a mixture containing latakia spiced the morning air . “ [I]92-pocket am only [a beginner]2415-a beginner , ”[92-pocket] responded [Pocket]92-pocket , “ but [a very keen one]2416-a very keen one . ”[92-pocket] “ [You]92-pocket do n't merely press the button and let [them]2417-them do the rest ? ”[241-the doctor] suggested [the doctor]241-the doctor , smiling less coldly under the influence of [his]241-the doctor pipe . “ Rather not ! [I]241-the doctor develop , print , tone , and all the rest of it ; that 's half the fun . ”[241-the doctor] “ Plates or films ? ”[118-baumgartner] inquired [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner , with an approving nod . “ Only plates , [I]118-baumgartner 'm afraid ; [you]92-pocket see , the apparatus is an old one of [[my]118-baumgartner father]2418-my father 's . ”[118-baumgartner] And [honest Pocket]92-pocket was beginning to blush for it , when [the other]587-the other made a gesture more eloquent and far more foreign than [his]587-the other speech . “ It 's none the worse for that , ”[118-baumgartner] said [he]118-baumgartner . “ So far [we]2419-we have much in common , for [I]118-baumgartner always use plates [myself]118-baumgartner . But what [we]2419-we put upon [our]2419-we plates , there 's the difference , eh ? ”[118-baumgartner] “ [I]92-pocket should imagine so , ”[92-pocket] said [Pocket]92-pocket , smiling . [Dr. Baumgartner]118-baumgartner was smiling too , and still less coldly than before , but yet darkly to [himself]118-baumgartner , and at [the boy]181-the boy rather than with [him]181-the boy . “ [You]181-the boy take portraits of [[your]181-the boy friends]2420-your friends , perhaps ? ”[118-baumgartner] “ Yes ; often . ”[118-baumgartner] “ In the body , [I]92-pocket presume ? ”[92-pocket] [Pocket]92-pocket looked nonplussed . “ [You]181-the boy only take them in the flesh ? ”[92-pocket] “ Of course . ”[118-baumgartner] “ Exactly ! [I]241-the doctor take the spirit , ”[241-the doctor] said [the doctor]241-the doctor ; “ that 's the difference . ”[241-the doctor] [Pocket]92-pocket watched the now wonderfully genial countenance of [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner follow the brutal features of the meerschaum Turk through a melting cloud of smoke . [The boy]181-the boy had been taken aback . But [his]181-the boy bewilderment was of briefer duration than might have been the case with [a less ardent photographer]660-a less ardent photographer ; for [he]181-the boy took a technical interest in [his]181-the boy hobby , and read the photographic year - books , nearly as ravenously as [Wisden]119-wisden 's Almanacke . “ [I]181-the boy see , ”[181-the boy] [he]181-the boy said , lukewarmly . “ [You]181-the boy go in for psychic photography . ”[181-the boy] “ Psychic , ”[118-baumgartner] said [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner ; for [the public schoolboy]661-the public schoolboy , [one regrets to report]662-one regrets to report , had pronounced the word to rhyme with sly - chick . [The doctor]241-the doctor added , with more disdain : “ And [you]181-the boy do n't believe in it ? ”[241-the doctor] “ [I]181-the boy did n't say so . ”[181-the boy] “ But [you]181-the boy looked and sounded it ! ”[241-the doctor] “ [I]181-the boy do n't set [myself]181-the boy up as [a believer]2421-a believer or unbeliever , ”[181-the boy] said [the boy]181-the boy , always at [his]181-the boy ease on a subject that attracted [him]181-the boy . “ But [I]181-the boy do say [I]181-the boy do n't believe in the sort of thing [I]181-the boy read somewhere last holidays . It was in a review of a book on that sort of photography . [The chap]2422-the chap seemed to have said [you]181-the boy could get a negative of a spirit without exposing the plate at all ; hide away [your]181-the boy plate , never mind [your]181-the boy lens , only conjure up [your]181-the boy spirit and see what happens . [I]181-the boy 'll swear nothing ever happened like that ! There may be ghosts , [you]181-the boy may see [them]2423-them , and so may the camera , but not without focusing and exposing like [you]181-the boy 've got to do with ordinary flesh and blood ! ”[181-the boy] [The youth]209-the youth had gone further and flown higher than [he]181-the boy meant , under the stimulus of an encouragement impossible to have foreseen . And [the doctor]241-the doctor had come to [his]241-the doctor feet , waving eloquently with [his]241-the doctor pipe ; [his]241-the doctor grey face beamed warmly ; [his]241-the doctor eyes were lances tipped with fire . “ Well said , [[my]241-the doctor young fellow]2397-my young fellow ! ”[241-the doctor] cried [he]241-the doctor . “ [I]241-the doctor agree with every syllable [you]2397-my young fellow have spoken . ”[241-the doctor] “ It 's a question of photography , not of spiritualism , ”[92-pocket] concluded [Pocket]92-pocket , rounding off [his]92-pocket argument in high excitement . “ [I]181-the boy agree , [I]181-the boy agree ! But there 's much more in it than that ; [you]2397-my young fellow must see the rest as well , since [you]2397-my young fellow see so far so clearly . ”[181-the boy] [The boy]181-the boy blushed with pleasure , determined to see as far as [anybody]550-anybody . “ [You]181-the boy admit there may be such things as ghosts , as [you]181-the boy call them ? ”[181-the boy] [he]181-the boy was asked as by [an equal]669-an equal . “ Certainly , [sir]2286-sir . ”[181-the boy] “ Visible shapes , in the likeness of [man]2426-man ? [Promotion]120-promotion had come to [him]92-pocket by giant leaps . [He]92-pocket felt five years older in fewer minutes . “ Then , ”[241-the doctor] cried [the doctor]241-the doctor , with further flattery in [his]241-the doctor air of triumph , “ then [you]2397-my young fellow admit everything ! [You]2397-my young fellow may not see these images , but [I]241-the doctor may . [I]241-the doctor may not see them , but [my]241-the doctor lens may ! Think how much that glass eye throws already upon the retina of a sensitised film that [our]2427-we living lenses fail to throw upon [ours]2427-we ; think of all that escapes the eye but the camera catches . Take two crystal vases , fill one with one acid and the other with another ; one comes out like water as [we]2427-we see it ; the other , though not less limpid in [our]2427-we sight , like ink . The eye sees through it , but not the lens . [The eye]2428-the eye sees emptiness as though the acid itself were pure crystal ; the lens flings an inky image on the plate . The trouble is that , while [you]2397-my young fellow can procure that acid at [the nearest chemist]2429-the nearest chemist 's , no money and no power on [earth]2430-earth can summon or procure at will the spirit which once was [man]2426-man . ”[241-the doctor] [His]92-pocket voice was vibrant and earnest as it had been when [Pocket]92-pocket heard it first an hour earlier in [the Park]2332-the park . It was even as passionate , but this was the passion of enthusiastic endeavour . If [the man]182-the man had a heart at all , it was in this wild question without a doubt . [Even the schoolboy]674-even the schoolboy perceived this dimly . There was something else which had become clearer to [him]92-pocket with each of these later remarks . Striking as they seemed to [him]92-pocket , they were not wholly unfamiliar . The ring of novelty was wanting to [his]92-pocket ear . Suddenly [he]92-pocket exclaimed , “ [I]92-pocket knew [I]92-pocket knew [your]92-pocket name ! ”[92-pocket] “ [You]92-pocket do know it , do [you]92-pocket ? ”[118-baumgartner] [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner spoke ungraciously , as though the announcement was discounted by the interruption it entailed . “ It was in connection with the very book [I]118-baumgartner mentioned . [I]92-pocket mentioned the two moments at which [I]92-pocket hold that [a man]219-a man 's soul may be caught apart , may be cut off from [his]219-a man body by no other medium than a good sound lens in a light - tight camera . [You]92-pocket can not have forgotten them if [you]92-pocket read [my]92-pocket letter . ”[92-pocket] “ One , ”[181-the boy] said [the boy]181-the boy , “ was the moment of death . ”[181-the boy] “ The moment of dissolution , ”[241-the doctor] [the doctor]241-the doctor corrected [him]181-the boy . “ But there is a far commoner moment than that , one that occurs constantly to [us]2434-us all , whereas dissolution comes but once . ”[241-the doctor] [Pocket]92-pocket believed [he]92-pocket remembered the other instance too , but was not sure about it , the fact being that the whole momentous letter had struck [him]92-pocket as too fantastic for serious consideration . That , however , [he]92-pocket could not and dared not say ; and [he]92-pocket was not the less frightened of making a mistake with those inspired eyes burning fanatically into [his]92-pocket . “ The other moment , ”[241-the doctor] [the doctor]241-the doctor said at last , with a pitying smile , “ is when the soul returns to [[its]2435-its prison]2436-its prison after one of those flights which [men]478-men call dreams . [You]92-pocket know that theory of the dream ? ”[241-the doctor] [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner asked abruptly . The answer was a nod as hasty , but [the doctor]241-the doctor seemed unconvinced , for [he]241-the doctor went on didactically : “ [You]92-pocket visit [far countries]2438-far countries in [your]92-pocket dreams ; [your]92-pocket soul is [the traveller]2439-the traveller . [You]92-pocket speak to [the absent or the dead]2440-the absent or the dead ; it is [your]92-pocket soul again ; and [we]2441-we dismiss the miracle as a dream ! [I]241-the doctor fix the moment as that of the soul 's return because its departure on these errands is imperceptible , but with its return [we]2441-we awake . The theory is that in the moment of waking the whole experience happens like the flash of an electric spark . ”[241-the doctor] [The boy]181-the boy murmured very earnestly that [he]181-the boy saw ; but [he]181-the boy was more troubled than enlightened , and what [he]181-the boy did see was that [he]181-the boy had picked up [a very eccentric acquaintance]680-a very eccentric acquaintance indeed . [He]181-the boy was not a little scared by [the man]182-the man 's hard face and molten eyes ; but there was a fascination also that could not be lost upon an impressionable temperament , besides that force of will or character which had dominated [the young mind]682-the young mind from the first . [He]181-the boy began to wish the interview at an end — to be able to talk about it as the extraordinary sequel of an extraordinary adventure — yet [he]181-the boy would not have cut it short at this point if [he]181-the boy could . “ [I]241-the doctor grant [you]181-the boy , ”[241-the doctor] continued [the doctor]241-the doctor , “ that the final flight of soul from body is infinitely the more precious from [my]241-the doctor point of view . But how is one to be in a position to intercept that ? When beloved spirits pass it would be cold - blooded desecration ; and public opinion has still to be educated up to psychical vivisection ! [I]241-the doctor have [myself]241-the doctor tried in vain to initiate such education . [The doctor]241-the doctor before leaving had discarded a black alpaca jacket , light as a pocket handkerchief , which had fallen so softly as to recall by contrast the noise made by the revolver in the pocket of the cloak . [The lad]2380-the lad was promptly seized with a strong desire to recover [his]2380-the lad property ; [he]2380-the lad was within an ace of doing so , the cloak containing it being actually in [his]2380-the lad hands and only dropped as [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner returned to announce that all was ready . Sharp to the left , at the end of [the passage]639-the passage , was a door which would simply have been a second way into [the drawing - room]329-the drawing - room had the double doors within been is use ; these being shut , [the space]695-the space behind made a separate chamber which again reminded [the schoolboy]283-the schoolboy of [[his]283-the schoolboy study]197-his study , [that smallest of [small rooms]699-small rooms]698-that smallest of small rooms . [This one]700-this one was as narrow , only twice the length . One end was monopolised by the door that admitted [them]701-them , the other by a window from floor to ceiling . And this window was in two great sheets of ruby glass , so that [Pocket]92-pocket looked down red - hot iron steps into [a crimson garden]702-a crimson garden , and therefrom to [[his]118-baumgartner companion]611-his companion dyed from head to foot like [Mephistopheles]121-mephistopheles . “ This is something like [a dark - room]2448-a dark - room ! ”[2380-the lad] exclaimed [the lad]2380-the lad as the door was shut and locked behind [him]2380-the lad . The folding doors were permanently barred by shelves and lockers ; opposite was a long porcelain trough , pink as [the doctor]241-the doctor 's shirt - sleeves in the strong red light ; racks of negatives and stoppered bottles glimmered over brass taps stained to an angry copper . Everything was perfection from [a photographer]2414-a photographer 's standpoint ; [the boy]181-the boy felt instantaneously spoilt for [[his]181-the boy darkened study]708-his darkened study and [his]181-the boy jugs of water . All [he]181-the boy had ever sighed for in the prosecution of [his]181-the boy hobby was here in [this little paradise of order and equipment]709-this little paradise of order and equipment . The actual work , [he]181-the boy felt , would be a secondary consideration in [such a workshop]710-such a workshop ; the mere manipulation of such stoppered bottles as [[his]181-the boy host]711-his host was handling now , the choice of graduated phials , the wealth of trays and dishes , would have been joy enough for [him]181-the boy . [He]181-the boy watched [the favoured operator with a watering mouth]712-the favoured operator with a watering mouth . A crimson blind had been lowered to reduce the light ; [the doctor]241-the doctor had turned up [his]241-the doctor shirt - cuffs ; [his]241-the doctor wrists were muscular and furry , as it now seemed with a fiery fur , yet they trembled with excitement as [he]241-the doctor produced [his]241-the doctor plate . And [Pocket]92-pocket remembered how extravagant an image was expected on that plain pink surface . [He]92-pocket did not know whether to expect it or not [himself]92-pocket . It was difficult to believe in that sort of thing , difficult to disbelieve in [this sort of man , who entertained no shadow of doubt [himself]92-pocket , whose excitement and suspense were as infectious as everything else about [him]92-pocket]714-this sort of man , who entertained no shadow of doubt himself , whose excitement and suspense were as infectious as everything else about him . [Pocket]92-pocket had come into [the dark - room]715-the dark - room wheezing almost as much as ever ; [he]92-pocket was not to be heard breathing as the plate was rocked to and fro as in raspberry - juice , and gradually the sky showed sharp and black . But the sky it was that [puzzled Pocket]92-pocket first . It was broken by perpendicular objects like white torpedoes . [He]92-pocket was photographer enough to know what these were almost at once ; [they]716-they were those poplars in [the park]2332-the park . But how could [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner have photographed [Pocket]92-pocket with those poplars behind [him]92-pocket when [they]716-they had been behind [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner all the time ? [But the tense crimson face]722-but the tense crimson face paid no attention ; in the ruby light it was glistening as though with beads of blood . “ There ! there ! there ! ”[722-but the tense crimson face] croaked a voice , husky and yet staccato . [Pocket]92-pocket could scarcely believe it was the voice of [[his]92-pocket host]711-his host — the one gentle thing about [him]92-pocket . “ [You]711-his host saw the figure ? But now [we]2449-we shall have to wait . ”[722-but the tense crimson face] The plate had blackened all over , as though the uncanny thing had choked out its life . It was meticulously held under a tap , between fingers that most distinctly trembled now . Then [he]92-pocket plunged it in the hyposulphite , and pulled up the blind . The sun shone again through the tall window , blood - red as before ; grass and sky were as richly incarnadined . [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner babbled while [he]118-baumgartner waited for the fixing - bath to clear the plate . [Pocket]92-pocket thought [him]118-baumgartner careless with it , thought the tap on too full ; it was held up an instant to the naked sun , and then dashed to a hundred fragments in the porcelain trough . [The goblin inquisitor of [Hyde Park]23-hyde park]735-the goblin inquisitor of hyde park had vanished with [his]735-the goblin inquisitor of hyde park hat and cloak . [I]241-the doctor 'm no good at real games . ”[241-the doctor] The statement was too true , but not the preference . “ That must be awkward for [you]92-pocket , at [an English public school]2456-an english public school , ”[241-the doctor] was [the doctor]241-the doctor 's comment . [Pocket]92-pocket heaved an ingenuous sigh . It was hateful . [He]92-pocket blamed the asthma as far as modesty would permit . [He]92-pocket was modest enough in [his]92-pocket breakfast - table talk , yet nervously egotistical , and apt to involve [himself]92-pocket in lengthy explanations . [He]92-pocket had two types of listener — the dry and the demure — to all [he]92-pocket said . “ And [they]2457-they let [you]92-pocket come up to [London]3-london alone ! ”[118-baumgartner] remarked [Dr. Baumgartner]118-baumgartner when [he]118-baumgartner got a chance . “ But it was n't [their]2457-they fault that [I]92-pocket — — ”[92-pocket] [Pocket]92-pocket stopped at a glance from [[his]92-pocket host]711-his host , and plunged into profuse particulars exonerating [[his]92-pocket house - master]180-his house - master , but was cut short again . Evidently [the niece]754-the niece was not to know where [he]92-pocket had spent the night . “ [I]241-the doctor suppose there are [a number of young men at [[your]92-pocket — establishment]2459-your — establishment]2458-a number of young men at your — establishment ? ”[241-the doctor] said [the doctor]241-the doctor , exchanging a glance with [Miss Platts]123-miss platts . “ There are over [four hundred boys]2460-four hundred boys , ”[92-pocket] replied [Pocket]92-pocket , a little puzzled . “ And how many [keepers]2461-keepers do [they]2460-four hundred boys require ? ”[92-pocket] A grin apologised for the word . “ There must be over thirty [masters]2462-masters , ”[92-pocket] returned [Pocket]92-pocket more pointedly than before . [He]92-pocket was not going to stand chaff about [[his]92-pocket public school]756-his public school from [a mad German doctor]757-a mad german doctor . “ And [they]2460-four hundred boys arm [you]92-pocket for the battle of life with Latin and Greek , eh ? ”[757-a mad german doctor] “ Not necessarily ; there 's [a Modern Side]2463-a modern side . [You]181-the boy can learn German if [you]181-the boy like ! ”[92-pocket] said [Pocket]92-pocket , not without contempt . “ Do [you]181-the boy ? ”[92-pocket] “ [I]181-the boy do n't like , ”[181-the boy] said [the boy]181-the boy gratuitously . “ Then [we]2464-we must stick to [your]181-the boy excellent King 's English . ”[181-the boy] [Pocket]92-pocket turned a trifle sulky . [He]92-pocket felt [he]92-pocket had not scored in [this little passage]759-this little passage . Then [he]92-pocket reflected upon the essential and extraordinary kindness which had brought [him]92-pocket to a decent breakfast - table that morning . That made [him]92-pocket ashamed ; nor could [he]92-pocket have afforded to be too independent just yet , even had [he]92-pocket been so disposed in [his]92-pocket heart . [His]92-pocket asthma was a beast that always growled in the background ; [he]92-pocket never knew when it would spring upon [him]92-pocket with a roar . Breakfast pacified [the brute]368-the brute ; hot coffee always did ; but the effects soon wore off , and [the boy]181-the boy was oppressed again , yet deadly weary , long before it was time for [him]181-the boy to go to [Welbeck Street]4-welbeck street . “ Is there really nothing [you]92-pocket can take ? ”[118-baumgartner] asked [Dr. Baumgartner]118-baumgartner , standing over [him]181-the boy in [the drawing - room]329-the drawing - room , where [Pocket]92-pocket sat hunched up in the big easy - chair . “ Nothing now , [I]92-pocket 'm afraid , unless [I]92-pocket could get some of those cigarettes . Is the stuff in [your]92-pocket bag ? ”[92-pocket] It was , and [the boy]181-the boy took it with much the same results as overnight . [It]765-it tasted sweeter and acted quicker ; that was the only difference . The skin seemed to tighten on [his]92-pocket face . [His]92-pocket fingers tingled at the ends It was not at all an unpleasant sensation , especially as the labour in [his]92-pocket breast came to an end as if by magic . The faintly foreign accents of [Dr. Baumgartner]118-baumgartner sounded unduly distant in [his]118-baumgartner last words from the open door . It was scarcely shut before the morning 's troubles ceased deliciously in the cosy chair . Yet they seemed to begin again directly , and this was a horrid crop ! Of course [he]92-pocket was back in [Hyde Park]23-hyde park ; but the sky must have rained red paint in [his]92-pocket absence , or else the earth was red - hot and the sky reflected it . No ! the grass was too wet for that . It might have been wet with blood . Everything was as red as beet - root , as wet and red and [one]289-one 's body weltering in it like the slain ! Reddest of all was [the old photographer]767-the old photographer , who turned into [Mr. Spearman]94-mr. spearman in cap and gown , who turned into [various members of [the Upton family]769-the upton family]768-various members of the upton family , one making more inconsequent remarks than the other , touching wildly on photography and the flitting soul , and between [them]770-them working the mad race up to such a pace and pitch that [Pocket]92-pocket woke with a dreadful start to find [Dr. Baumgartner]118-baumgartner standing over [him]92-pocket once more in the perfectly pallid flesh . “ [I]92-pocket 've had a beast of a dream ! ”[92-pocket] said [Pocket]92-pocket , waking thoroughly . “ [I]92-pocket 'm in a cold perspiration , and [I]92-pocket thought it was cold blood ! What time is it ? ”[92-pocket] “ A quarter to six , ”[241-the doctor] said [the doctor]241-the doctor , who had invited the question by taking out [his]241-the doctor watch . “ A quarter to twelve , [you]181-the boy mean ! ”[241-the doctor] “ No — six . ”[92-pocket] And [the boy]181-the boy was shown the dial , but would not believe it until [he]181-the boy had gaped at [his]181-the boy own watch , which had stopped at half - past three . [No doubt one to retail in reverential tones]784-no doubt one to retail in reverential tones , but a most thrilling adventure none the less . [He]92-pocket only failed to see why it should affect [him]92-pocket as much as [the doctor]241-the doctor suggested . The walking in [his]92-pocket sleep , the shot that woke [him]92-pocket , the first words of [Dr. Baumgartner]118-baumgartner , [his]92-pocket first swift action , and the warm pistol in [his]92-pocket own unconscious hand : these burning memories spoke more eloquently than any words . [They]790-they would have told [their]790-they own tale at once , if only [he]92-pocket had known [the man]182-the man was dead . Why had [he]92-pocket been deceived ? It was cruel , it was infamous , to have kept the truth from [him]92-pocket for a single instant . Thus wildly did [the stricken youth]792-the stricken youth turn and rend [[his]792-the stricken youth benefactor]793-his benefactor for the very benefaction of a day 's rest in ignorance of [his]792-the stricken youth deed . [Pocket]92-pocket was reminded of the state [he]92-pocket [himself]92-pocket had been in at the time . [He]92-pocket also might have been [a dying man]795-a dying man , [he]92-pocket was assured , and could well believe on looking back . To have told [him]181-the boy later in the morning , [the doctor]241-the doctor went on to say , with an emphasis not immediately understood , could have undone nothing . [He]118-baumgartner acknowledged a grave responsibility , but rightly or wrongly [he]118-baumgartner had put [the living]798-the living before the dead . How had [he]118-baumgartner known [the man]182-the man was dead ? [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner smiled at the question . [He]118-baumgartner was not only [a doctor]392-a doctor , but [an old soldier who had fought in one at least of the bloodiest battles in European history]801-an old soldier who had fought in one at least of the bloodiest battles in european history . It was [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner who had first caught sight of [the somnambulist]803-the somnambulist , treading warily like [the blind]804-the blind , yet waving the revolver as [he]118-baumgartner went , as though any moment [he]118-baumgartner might let it off . [I]92-pocket hope not , but [I]92-pocket took the law into [my]92-pocket own hands , and [I]92-pocket [I]92-pocket am prepared to abide by the law if [you]118-baumgartner so decide this minute . ”[92-pocket] “ [I]241-the doctor have decided . ”[241-the doctor] “ Mind [you]118-baumgartner , it would mean putting [yourself]118-baumgartner unreservedly in [my]118-baumgartner hands , at any rate for the present , ”[118-baumgartner] said [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner , impressively . “ Better come to [Scotland Yard]31-scotland yard this minute than go back to [school]213-school and blab about the whole thing there ! ”[118-baumgartner] “ [I]824-the acute doctor should n't do that . ”[824-the acute doctor] “ [I]824-the acute doctor 'm not so sure , ”[824-the acute doctor] replied [the acute doctor]824-the acute doctor . “ [I]92-pocket believe [I]92-pocket know [you]118-baumgartner better than [you]118-baumgartner know [yourself]118-baumgartner ; [one]289-one learns more of [a person]2503-a person in an hour like this than in a whole humdrum lifetime . [I]92-pocket believe [you]118-baumgartner would find it very difficult not to tell [somebody]2504-somebody . ”[92-pocket] [Pocket]92-pocket admitted it with a natural outburst of [his]92-pocket leading quality . In truth no previous act or word of [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner 's had inspired such confidence as this unerring piece of insight . It seemed to [the boy]181-the boy a perfect miracle of discernment . [He]181-the boy was not old enough to know that what [he]181-the boy would have done , in [his]181-the boy weakness , [most grown - up men]826-most grown - up men and [women of [his]181-the boy temperament]827-women of his temperament would have done in [theirs]826-most grown - up men . “ Remember , ”[241-the doctor] resumed [the doctor]241-the doctor , “ [you]118-baumgartner would have the whole of to - day to account for ; it 's not as though [you]118-baumgartner would n't have some very awkward questions to answer the moment [you]118-baumgartner got back to [school]213-school . ”[241-the doctor] And again [the lad]2380-the lad marvelled at this intuition into public - school conditions on the part of [one who could have no first - hand knowledge of those insular institutions]830-one who could have no first - hand knowledge of those insular institutions . But this fresh display of understanding only confirmed [him]181-the boy in [his]181-the boy resolve . “ [I]181-the boy trust [you]241-the doctor , [sir]2286-sir , ”[181-the boy] said [he]181-the boy ; “ have n't [you]241-the doctor done enough for [me]181-the boy to make [me]181-the boy ? But [Baumgartner , as if to let well or ill alone]834-baumgartner , as if to let well or ill alone , dropped the matter with a clinching shrug ; and presently [he]834-baumgartner , as if to let well or ill alone left [[his]834-baumgartner , as if to let well or ill alone visitor]649-his visitor , less wisely , to brood on it alone . [Pocket]92-pocket was [a dab at brooding]836-a dab at brooding ! That is the worst of [your]837-your conscientious ass ; [he]92-pocket takes [his]92-pocket decision like [a man]219-a man ; [he]92-pocket means to stick to it like [a sportsman]839-a sportsman ; but [he]92-pocket can not help wondering whether [he]92-pocket has decided for the best , and what would have happened if [he]92-pocket had decided otherwise , and what [[his]92-pocket world]840-his world will say about [him]92-pocket as it is . [This one]700-this one went much further in the unique stress of [his]92-pocket extraordinary position . [He]92-pocket pictured [[his]92-pocket people]238-his people dressing for dinner at [home]224-home ; [he]92-pocket pictured [his]92-pocket form sitting down to private - work in [his]92-pocket form - [[master]844-master 's hall]845-master 's hall ; there was no end to [his]92-pocket mental pictures , for they included one of [himself]92-pocket on the scaffold in the broad - arrows of the little old waxwork at [Madame Tassaud]126-madame tassaud 's ! [He]92-pocket could not help [himself]92-pocket ; [his]92-pocket mind was crumbling with [his]92-pocket dreadful deed and its awful possibilities . Now [his]92-pocket heart bled honestly for [the poor dead man]2482-the poor dead man , now for [[his]92-pocket own mother]847-his own mother and [sister]848-sister , and now not less freely for [himself]92-pocket . [He]92-pocket had been so innocent in the whole matter ; [he]92-pocket had only been [an innocent and rather sporting fool]849-an innocent and rather sporting fool . And now one of these lives was ended by [his]92-pocket hand , and all the rest would be darkened for ever after ! It was too great a burden for [a boy]850-a boy to bear ; but [Pocket]92-pocket bore it far into the long June twilight , scarcely stirring in the big soft chair , yet never leaning back in it again . [He]92-pocket sat hunched up as though once more battling for breath , but curiously enough [his]92-pocket bodily distress had flown before that of the mind . [Pocket]92-pocket would thankfully have changed them back again , for [his]92-pocket brain was as clear as [his]92-pocket bronchial tubes , its capacity for suffering undimmed by a single physical preoccupation . Between seven and eight [the young lady of [the house]342-the house]851-the young lady of the house came in with candles and a kind of high - tea on a tray ; [she]851-the young lady of the house also brought a box of d'Auvergne Cigarettes and the latest evening paper , which [[her]851-the young lady of the house uncle]748-her uncle thought that [Mr. Upton]97-mr. upton would like to see . It was neither unimportant nor at first sight reassuring . [The dead man]810-the dead man had been identified by [the police]858-the police , who knew [him]810-the dead man of old , and were reported as hopeful of obtaining a clue through [his]810-the dead man identity . The clue was the point that stuck like a burr in the boyish brain ; [his]181-the boy idea of a clue was one leading straight to [himself]181-the boy ; it took [Dr. Baumgartner]118-baumgartner to explain the true value of the identity clause , and bid [the boy]181-the boy eat [his]181-the boy meal . “ Trust [the police]858-the police ! ”[181-the boy] said [he]181-the boy . “ [They]858-the police 're on a false scent already ; [they]858-the police may try at that end till it turns [their]858-the police hair grey ! ”[92-pocket] [Pocket]92-pocket disliked this tone ; [he]92-pocket had begun to think almost as reverentially of [[his]92-pocket victim]860-his victim as of [a dead member of [[his]92-pocket own family]862-his own family]861-a dead member of his own family .
