[Rowton Houses]32-rowton houses had been [[his]181-the boy only home]863-his only home , except when [his]181-the boy undistinguished offences got [him]181-the boy into gaol ; the surreptitious practices of [the professional mendicant]864-the professional mendicant , [his]181-the boy sole means of livelihood . So much was to be read between the few brief lines in the stop - press column of the latest evening paper . Again it required [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner to extract comfort from such items . “ At all events , ”[181-the boy] said [he]181-the boy , “ [you]2510-you can not reproach [yourself]2510-you with the destruction of a valuable life ! [The man]182-the man was evidently [the worthless creature that [he]182-the man looked]2512-the worthless creature that he looked . [You]2510-you talk about [your]2510-you undesirable aliens , but [here]2333-here in [England]27-england [you]2510-you breed undesirables enough to manure [the world]439-the world ! [[His]283-the schoolboy host]711-his host had accompanied [him]283-the schoolboy up [two pairs of stairs]868-two pairs of stairs , carrying candles , and [his]283-the schoolboy meerschaum pipe in aromatic blast . [This extraordinary man]869-this extraordinary man had shown [him]92-pocket still more extraordinary kindness ; the die was cast for [them]870-them to stand or fall together ; and there was something about [the gaunt old visionary]871-the gaunt old visionary , a confidential candour , a dry intellectual plausibility , which could not but stimulate respect for [his]283-the schoolboy ungodliest views . Whether they really were [his]283-the schoolboy views , or only a tortuous attempt at comfort , the sympathy underlying [their]870-them expression was undoubted and indubitable . But [the doctor]241-the doctor spoke as though [he]241-the doctor meant every word , and [the boy]181-the boy only longed to agree with [him]241-the doctor : [his]283-the schoolboy conscientious failure to do so declared itself in a series of incoherent expostulations to which [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner [himself]118-baumgartner gave articulate shape in order to demolish them in the next breath . “ [You]181-the boy say [his]283-the schoolboy life was as much to [him]283-the schoolboy as [yours]2516-yours to [you]181-the boy ? [I]118-baumgartner 've heard the Iron shriek without ceasing , like the wind , and [I]118-baumgartner 've felt the Blood like spray from a hot spring ! In the sudden eloquence of this strange outburst , with its poetic frenzy , its ruthless idealism , [its]880-i wild bloodthirsty nobility , [the youthful listener]881-the youthful listener lost sight of [its]880-i irrelevancy , or rather it was the irrevelant features that flared up first in [his]881-the youthful listener brain . [He]181-the boy would see a wild arm waving , wisps of smoke from a waving pipe , a core of nicotine in a curve of amber , and [the Turk]874-the turk 's face glistening in its heat like that of [the hard old man]886-the hard old man [himself]886-the hard old man . On the following morning , the ominous Friday of this disastrous week , there was a letter for [Mr. Upton]97-mr. upton on the breakfast - table down in [Leicestershire]25-leicestershire . This circumstance was not so usual as it sounds , because [Mr. Upton]97-mr. upton conducted all [his]97-mr. upton correspondence from [[his]97-mr. upton office]889-his office at [the works]890-the works . [[His]97-mr. upton youngest son]898-his youngest son , however , had furnished the more impressive address to [Dr. Bompas]99-dr. bompas , whose hurried hand it was that dealt the first blow . It so happened that a letter from [Dr. Bompas]99-dr. bompas had been expected ; this made the letter [he]99-dr. bompas wrote especially upsetting , and for the following reason . [He]99-dr. bompas had been given another address with the same result , except that from [the second house]949-the second house [he]99-dr. bompas gathered that [the young gentleman]950-the young gentleman had gone on to [some hotel]951-some hotel . [A clerk]972-a clerk was instructed to telephone to [the garage]973-the garage for [the car]974-the car to come straight to [the works]890-the works . And [the ironmaster]976-the ironmaster stood waiting at [[his]976-the ironmaster office]889-his office window in a fever of anxiety . The grimy scene on which [he]976-the ironmaster looked had a constant charm for [him]976-the ironmaster , and yet to - day it almost added to the bitterness of [his]976-the ironmaster heart . [His]978-his was the brain that had conceived those broad effects of smoke and flame , and blackened faces lit by the light of molten metal ; [his]976-the ironmaster the strong hand and the stout heart which had brought [his]976-the ironmaster conception into being . The sense of possession is the foible of many who have won all [they]986-they have ; [the ironmaster]976-the ironmaster almost looked upon the hot air dancing over the white - hot bars as [his]976-the ironmaster too . [The whole sulphurous prospect]988-the whole sulphurous prospect , once [a green pasture]989-a green pasture , had long been [his]976-the ironmaster to all intents and purposes , and no second soul would ever take [his]976-the ironmaster pride in it ; to [[his]976-the ironmaster children]990-his children it would never be more than the means of livelihood ; and how had it repaid even [him]976-the ironmaster for a life 's devotion ? With [a house of sorrow in [the next valley]992-the next valley]991-a house of sorrow in the next valley ! Now it recalled the ailing infancy of [the missing boy]999-the missing boy — bronchitis it had been in the early stages — and how [[his]999-the missing boy mother]365-his mother had taken [him]999-the missing boy to [Hastings]36-hastings three successive winters , and wrapped [him]999-the missing boy up far too much . What did [you]1034-the head master say the name was ? ”[97-mr. upton] “ [Thrush]137-thrush — [Eugene Thrush]138-thrush — quite [a remarkable man]2580-a remarkable man , and , [I]1034-the head master think , [a gentleman]2581-a gentleman , ”[1034-the head master] said [the head master]1034-the head master impressively . Further particulars , including an address in [Glasshouse Street]37-glasshouse street , were readily supplied from an advertisement in that day 's Times , in which [Mr. Thrush]137-thrush was described as [an “ inquiry agent , ”[2582-an “ inquiry agent , ” capable alike of “ delicate investigations ” and “ confidential negotiations] capable alike of “ delicate investigations ”[2582-an “ inquiry agent , ” capable alike of “ delicate investigations ” and “ confidential negotiations] and “ confidential negotiations]2582-an “ inquiry agent , ” capable alike of “ delicate investigations ” and “ confidential negotiations . ”[2582-an “ inquiry agent , ” capable alike of “ delicate investigations ” and “ confidential negotiations] That was the very man for [Mr. Upton]97-mr. upton , as [he]97-mr. upton [himself]97-mr. upton agreed . And [he]97-mr. upton departed both on speaking terms with [Mr. Spearman]94-mr. spearman , who said a final word for [his]94-mr. spearman own behaviour in the matter , and grimly at one with [the head master]1034-the head master on the importance of keeping it out of the papers . [The remarkable Mr. Thrush]137-thrush was [a duly qualified solicitor]1049-a duly qualified solicitor , who had never been [the man for that orderly and circumscribed profession]1050-the man for that orderly and circumscribed profession . The tide of events which had turned [his]137-thrush talents into their present channel , was known to but few of [[his]137-thrush many boon companions]1051-his many boon companions , and much nonsense was talked about [him]137-thrush and [his]137-thrush first career . It was not the case ( as [anybody]550-anybody might have ascertained ) that [he]137-thrush had been struck off the rolls in connection with the first great scandal in which [he]137-thrush was professionally concerned . Nor was there much more truth in the report that [he]137-thrush drank , in the ordinary interpretation of the term . It is true , however , that [Mr. Thrush]137-thrush had a tall tumbler on [his]137-thrush dressing - table , to help [him]137-thrush shave for the evening of that fateful Friday . [He]137-thrush was dressing for an early dinner before a first night . [[His]137-thrush dressing - room]1053-his dressing - room , in which [he]137-thrush also slept in Spartan simplicity , was the original powder - closet of [the panelled library out of which [it]1053-his dressing - room led]1054-the panelled library out of which it led . There was [a third room in which [[his]137-thrush man]1056-his man [Mullins]139-mullins]1055-a third room in which his man mullins prepared breakfast and spent the day . But the whole was a glorified garret , at the top of such stairs as might have sent [a nervous client]1057-a nervous client back for [an escort]1058-an escort . [Mullins]139-mullins , with the expression of [[an undertaker]1059-an undertaker 's mute]1060-an undertaker 's mute ( a calling [he]139-mullins had followed in [his]139-mullins day ) , was laying out [[his]139-mullins [master]844-master]1061-his master 's clothes as mournfully as though [[his]139-mullins master]1061-his master were in them , instead of chatting genially as [he]139-mullins shaved . “ [I]1060-an undertaker 's mute 'm sorry to have missed [your]139-mullins evidence , [Mullins]139-mullins , but if [we]2583-we go into this case it 's no use letting [the police]858-the police smell the competitive rat too soon . Inquests are not in [my]1060-an undertaker 's mute line , and [they]858-the police 'd have wondered what the devil [I]1060-an undertaker 's mute was doing [there]2306-there , especially as [you]139-mullins refrained from saying [you]139-mullins were in [my]1060-an undertaker 's mute service . ”[1060-an undertaker 's mute] “ [I]139-mullins had no call , [sir]2286-sir . ”[139-mullins] “ Quite right , [Mullins]139-mullins ! [An ideal witness]2587-an ideal witness , [I]1060-an undertaker 's mute can see [you]139-mullins were . So [you]139-mullins 'd only to describe the finding of the body ? ”[1060-an undertaker 's mute] “ That was all , [sir]2286-sir . ”[1060-an undertaker 's mute] “ And [your]139-mullins description was really largely founded on fact ? ”[1060-an undertaker 's mute] [Mullins]139-mullins stood like a funereal grenadier at [[his]139-mullins gentleman]1064-his gentleman 's shaving elbow . “ [I]139-mullins told the truth , [sir]2286-sir , and nothing but the truth , ”[139-mullins] said [he]139-mullins , with sombre dignity . “ But not the whole truth , eh , [Mullins]139-mullins ! What about the little souvenirs [you]139-mullins showed [me]139-mullins yesterday ? ”[139-mullins] “ There was no call to name [them]2590-they either , [sir]2286-sir . The cheroot - end [I]1060-an undertaker 's mute must have picked up a hundred yards away , and even the medicine - cork was n't on the actual scene of the murder . ”[1060-an undertaker 's mute] “ That 's all right , [Mullins]139-mullins . [I]139-mullins do n't see what [they]2590-they could possibly have to do with it , [myself]139-mullins ; and really , but for the fluke of [your]139-mullins being the one to find the body , and picking the first - fruits for what they 're worth , it 's the last kind of case that [I]139-mullins should dream of touching with a ten - foot pole . By the way , [I]139-mullins suppose [they]2590-they wo n't require [you]139-mullins at the adjourned inquest ? ”[139-mullins] “ [They]2590-they may not require [me]139-mullins , [sir]2286-sir , but [I]139-mullins should like to attend , if quite convenient , ”[139-mullins] replied [Mullins]139-mullins deferentially . “ [The police]858-the police were very stingy with [their]858-the police evidence to - day ; [they]858-the police 've still to produce the fatal bullet , and [I]139-mullins should like a sight of that , [sir]2286-sir . ”[139-mullins] [Mr. Thrush]137-thrush did not continue the conversation , possibly because [he]137-thrush took as little real interest as [he]137-thrush professed in the case which was being thrust upon [him]137-thrush , but more obviously owing to the necessary care in shaving the corners of a delightfuly long and mobile mouth . Indeed , the whole face emerging from the lather , as a cast from its clay , would have delighted any eye but its own . It was fat and flabby as the rest of [Eugene Thrush]138-thrush ; there was quite a collection of chins to shave ; and yet [[anybody]550-anybody but [himself]137-thrush]1066-anybody but himself must have recognised the invincible freshness of complexion , the happy penetration of every glance , as an earnest of inexhaustible possibilities beneath the burden of the flesh . Great round spectacles , through which [he]137-thrush stared like a wise fish in an aquarium , were caught precariously on a button of a nose which in itself might have prevented [the superficial observer]1067-the superficial observer from taking [him]137-thrush any more seriously than [he]137-thrush took [himself]137-thrush . [Mr. Upton]97-mr. upton , who arrived before [Thrush]137-thrush was visible , was [an essentially superficial and antipathetic observer of unfamiliar types]1068-an essentially superficial and antipathetic observer of unfamiliar types ; and being badly impressed by the forbidding staircase , [he]97-mr. upton had determined on [the landing]1069-the landing to sound [[his]97-mr. upton man]1056-his man before trusting [him]97-mr. upton . In the rank undergrowth of [his]137-thrush prejudices there was no more luxuriant weed than an innate abhorrence of [London]3-london and [all Londoners]1071-all londoners , which neither the cause of [his]137-thrush visit nor the murky mien of [Mullins]139-mullins was calculated to abate . The library of books in solid bindings , many of them legal tomes , was the first reassuring feature ; another was the large desk , made business - like with pigeon - holes and a telephone ; but [Mr. Upton]97-mr. upton was only beginning to recover confidence when [Eugene Thrush]138-thrush shook it sadly at [his]138-thrush first entry . It might have been by [his]138-thrush face , or [his]138-thrush fat , or [his]138-thrush evening clothes seen from [the motorist]1072-the motorist 's dusty tweeds , almost as much as by the misplaced joviality with which [Thrush]138-thrush exclaimed : “ [I]138-thrush 'm sorry to have kept [you]97-mr. upton waiting , [sir]2286-sir , and the worst of it is that [I]138-thrush ca n't let [you]97-mr. upton keep [me]138-thrush ! ”[138-thrush] This touched a raw nerve in [the ironmaster]976-the ironmaster , as the kind of reception [one]289-one had to come up to [London]3-london to incur . “ Then [I]138-thrush 'll clear out ! ”[138-thrush] said [he]138-thrush , and would have been as good as [his]138-thrush word but for its instantaneous effect . [Thrush]138-thrush had pulled out a gold watch after a stare of kindly consternation . “ [I]138-thrush really am rather rushed , ”[138-thrush] said [he]138-thrush ; “ but [I]138-thrush can give [you]97-mr. upton four minutes , if that 's any good to [you]97-mr. upton . ”[138-thrush] Now , at first sight , before a word was spoken , [Mr. Upton]97-mr. upton would have said four hours or four days of that boiled salmon in spectacles would have been no good to [him]97-mr. upton ; but the precise term of minutes , together with a seemlier but not less decisive manner , had already quickened [the business man]1075-the business man 's respect for another whose time was valuable . But what revenge can there be upon [a poor devil without the price of a bed on [[his]2341-the fellow indescribable person]2670-his indescribable person]2669-a poor devil without the price of a bed on his indescribable person ? [He]2341-the fellow has n't anything to bless [himself]2341-the fellow with , and [he]2341-the fellow makes it a bit too hot for somebody who has , eh ? So [you]138-thrush whittle it down . And then perhaps by sheer luck [you]138-thrush run [your]138-thrush blade into the root of the matter . ”[138-thrush] [Thrush]138-thrush gave up trying to take the other out of [himself]138-thrush , since [his]138-thrush boldest statements were allowed to pass unchallenged , unless they dealt with the one subject on [the poor man]807-the poor man 's mind . The cessation of [his]138-thrush voice , however , caused a twinge of conscience in [the bad listener]1099-the bad listener ; [he]138-thrush made a mental grab at the last phrase , and was astonished to find it germane to [his]138-thrush own thoughts . “ That 's the second time [you]138-thrush 've mentioned luck , [Mr. Thrush]137-thrush ! ”[137-thrush] “ When was the first ? ”[137-thrush] “ [You]138-thrush spoke of Friday as an unlucky day , as [God]125-god knows this one is to [me]137-thrush ! Are [you]138-thrush of a superstitious turn of mind ? ”[137-thrush] “ Not seriously . ”[137-thrush] “ [You]138-thrush do n't believe in dreams , for example ? ”[137-thrush] “ That 's another question , ”[137-thrush] said [Thrush]137-thrush , [his]137-thrush spectacles twinkling to colossal rubies as [he]137-thrush sipped [his]137-thrush Santenay . “ Why do [you]138-thrush ask ? ”[137-thrush] “ If [you]138-thrush 're [a disbeliever]2671-a disbeliever it 's no use [my]137-thrush telling [you]138-thrush . ”[137-thrush] “ Perhaps [I]137-thrush 'm neither one thing nor the other . ”[137-thrush] “ Have [you]138-thrush ever known a mystery solved through a dream ? ”[137-thrush] “ [I]137-thrush 've heard of one , ”[137-thrush] said [Thrush]137-thrush , with a significant stress upon the verb ; “ that 's the famous old murder in [the Red Barn]2672-the red barn a hundred years ago . [[The victim]2673-the victim 's mother]2674-the victim 's mother dreamed three nights running that [[her]2674-the victim 's mother missing daughter]2675-her missing daughter was buried in [the Red Barn]2672-the red barn , and there [she]2674-the victim 's mother was all the time . There may have been other cases . ”[137-thrush] “ Cases in which [a parent]2677-a parent has dreamt of [an absent child]2678-an absent child , at the very time at which something terrible has happened to [that child]2679-that child ? ”[137-thrush] “ Any amount of those . ”[570-the father] [The father]570-the father 's voice had trembled with the question . [Thrush]137-thrush put down [his]137-thrush glass as [he]137-thrush gave [his]137-thrush answer , and [his]137-thrush spectacled eyes fixed themselves in a more attentive stare . “ Do [you]97-mr. upton think they 're all coincidences ? ”[97-mr. upton] demanded [Mr. Upton]97-mr. upton hoarsely . “ Some of them may be , but certainly not all , ”[97-mr. upton] was the reply . “ That would be the greatest coincidence of the lot ! ”[97-mr. upton] “ [I]97-mr. upton hardly like to tell [you]97-mr. upton why [I]97-mr. upton ask , ”[97-mr. upton] said [Mr. Upton]97-mr. upton , much agitated ; for [he]137-thrush could be as emotional as [most irascible men]1101-most irascible men . “ [You]97-mr. upton 've been dreaming about [the boy]181-the boy ? ”[137-thrush] “ Not [I]97-mr. upton ; but [[my]97-mr. upton poor wife]2681-my poor wife has ; that was one reason why [I]97-mr. upton dare n't tell [her]2681-my poor wife [he]181-the boy had disappeared . ”[97-mr. upton] “ Why ? What was the dream ? ”[137-thrush] “ That [she]2681-my poor wife saw [him]181-the boy — and heard a shot . ”[137-thrush] “ A shot ! ”[137-thrush] [Thrush]137-thrush looked as though [he]137-thrush had heard one [himself]137-thrush , but only until [he]137-thrush had time to think . “ [She]2681-my poor wife says [she]2681-my poor wife did hear one , ”[97-mr. upton] added [Mr. Upton]97-mr. upton , “ and that [she]2681-my poor wife was n't dreaming at all . ”[97-mr. upton] “ But when was this ? ”[97-mr. upton] “ Between six and seven yesterday morning . ”[137-thrush] This time [Thrush]137-thrush did not move a muscle of [his]137-thrush face ; it only lit up like a Chinese lantern , and again [he]137-thrush was quick to quench the inner flame ; but now the coincidence was complete . [Coincidences]141-coincidences , however , had nothing to say to the A. V. M. system , neither was [Eugene Thrush]138-thrush [the man]182-the man to jump to wild conclusions on the strength of one . The tone of subsequent inquiries concerning [Mrs. Upton]132-mrs. upton 's health ( already mentioned as the great reason for keeping the affair as long as possible a secret ) sounded purely compassionate to an ear unconsciously aching for compassion . “ Then that accounts for it , ”[137-thrush] said [Thrush]137-thrush , when [he]137-thrush had heard the whole sad story . [His]139-mullins sepulchral face was alight with news — it was the transformation of [[the undertaker]1107-the undertaker 's mute]1108-the undertaker 's mute into [the wedding guest]1109-the wedding guest . What else could [he]92-pocket expect ? The trouble was that [he]92-pocket had seen [the one]1117-the one and not the other , and what [he]92-pocket had seen continued to haunt [him]92-pocket as [he]92-pocket lay awake , but quite horribly when [he]92-pocket fell back into a doze . There was nothing nebulous about [the vile place]1118-the vile place then ; it was as light and bright as [the room in which [he]92-pocket lay]1119-the room in which he lay . [The sinister figures in the panelled pens]1120-the sinister figures in the panelled pens were swathed in white , as [he]92-pocket had somewhere read that [they]1120-the sinister figures in the panelled pens always were at nights . [Their]1120-the sinister figures in the panelled pens evil faces were shrouded out of sight . But that only made [their]1120-the sinister figures in the panelled pens defiant , portly figures the more humanly inhuman and terrifying ; it was as though [they]1120-the sinister figures in the panelled pens had all risen , in [their]1120-the sinister figures in the panelled pens winding - sheets , from [[their]1120-the sinister figures in the panelled pens murderer]1121-their murderer 's graves . Better by far [their]1120-the sinister figures in the panelled pens beastly faces , that [you]1122-you knew were wax ! So [he]92-pocket reasoned with [himself]92-pocket , and screwed up [his]92-pocket courage , and laid hands on one of the shorter figures that [he]92-pocket could reach . It rocked stiffly in its place , a most palpable and reassuring waxwork . [He]92-pocket unwound the cerements from the hollow and unyielding head ; and the face was new to [him]92-pocket ; it had not been there the other afternoon . [It]1123-it was a young face like [his]92-pocket own , as ill - mounted on [high shoulders , with thickish lips ajar , and only a pair of intelligent eyes to redeem an apparent heaviness]1124-high shoulders , with thickish lips ajar , and only a pair of intelligent eyes to redeem an apparent heaviness : one and all [his]92-pocket own identical characteristics . [The boy]181-the boy shuddered till the bed shook under [him]181-the boy . But after that [he]181-the boy still lay on , facing [himself]181-the boy as [he]181-the boy had seen [himself]181-the boy , and [his]181-the boy deed as [others]1132-others must see it soon or late . Not the actual accident in [the Park]2332-the park ; but this hiding in [the heart of [London]3-london]1134-the heart of london , this skulking among [strangers]1135-strangers , this leaving [[his]181-the boy own people]495-his own people to mourn [him]181-the boy as [the dead]1137-the dead ! What would [they]495-his own people think of [him]181-the boy if [he]181-the boy went on skulking like this ? What would [they]495-his own people have done in [[his]181-the boy place]1140-his place ? Anything but lie low like that , thought [Pocket]92-pocket , and resolved forthwith to play the game as preached and practised by [[his]181-the boy brothers]189-his brothers . It was strange that [he]181-the boy should have been so dense about so plain a duty overnight ; this morning [he]181-the boy saw it as sharp as an image in perfect focus on the ground - glass screen ... To think that [a mad photographer]1142-a mad photographer should have talked [him]181-the boy into an attitude as mad as [his]181-the boy own ! This morning [he]181-the boy saw the common sense of the situation as well as its right and wrong . Nothing would happen to [him]181-the boy if [he]181-the boy gave [himself]181-the boy up , but anything might if [he]181-the boy waited till [he]181-the boy was caught . As for the consequences to [[his]181-the boy poor mother]1143-his poor mother , surely in the end suspense and uncertainty would eat deeper into the slender cord of [her]1143-his poor mother life than the shock of the truth would cut . Having made up [his]181-the boy mind , however , as to the only thing to do , [the boy]181-the boy behaved characteristically in not hastening to do it . The ordeal in front of [him]181-the boy , beginning in certain conflict with [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner , and ending in a blaze of wretched notoriety , was a severe one to face ; meanwhile [he]181-the boy lay in such peace and safety as it was only human to prolong a little . That night , for all [his]181-the boy moral innocence , [he]181-the boy might lie in [prison]484-prison ; let [him]181-the boy make the most of a good bed while [he]181-the boy had one , especially as [he]181-the boy was still mysteriously free from asthma . The last consideration took [his]181-the boy mind off the ethical dilemma for quite a little time . [He]181-the boy remembered [the doctor at [home]224-home]1146-the doctor at home telling [him]181-the boy that [he]181-the boy [himself]181-the boy had suffered from chronic asthma , but had lost it after a carriage accident in which [he]181-the boy was nearly killed . “ [My]92-pocket accident may have done the same for [me]92-pocket , ”[92-pocket] thought [Pocket]92-pocket — and was bitterly ashamed next moment to catch [himself]92-pocket thinking complacently of any aspect of [his]92-pocket deed . Its other aspects were a sufficient punishment . To get up , and raise the green linen blind , flooding with sunshine [the plain upstairs room to which [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner had conducted [[his]118-baumgartner guest]749-his guest]1148-the plain upstairs room to which baumgartner had conducted his guest , was to conjure uncomfortable visions of [the eccentric doctor]1150-the eccentric doctor , with [his]118-baumgartner ferocious meerschaum , [his]118-baumgartner bloodthirsty battle - talk , and all [his]118-baumgartner arguments in favour of the course which [Pocket]92-pocket had now determined to abandon . [The boy]181-the boy fully realised that [he]181-the boy had been given [his]181-the boy chance , and had refused it . And of all the interviews before [him]181-the boy , that with [Dr. Baumgartner]118-baumgartner was the one that [he]181-the boy most dreaded , and would have given most to escape . Could [he]181-the boy escape it ? That was an idea ; [others]1132-others came of it . If [he]181-the boy did escape , and did give [himself]181-the boy up for what [he]181-the boy had done , there was no reason why [he]181-the boy should involve [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner in that voluntary confession . Suppose [he]181-the boy hailed [the first cab]1153-the first cab [he]181-the boy saw , and drove over to [[St. John]142-st. john 's Wood]16-st. john 's wood to borrow money ( [they]1154-they could scarcely refuse [him]181-the boy that ) , and then took [the first train]1155-the first train [home]224-home to tell [[his]181-the boy father]284-his father everything in the first instance , that [father]1158-father would never hear of [his]181-the boy incriminating [a stranger who had befriended [him]181-the boy according to [his]181-the boy lights]1159-a stranger who had befriended him according to his lights . [He]181-the boy [himself]181-the boy need never say where [he]181-the boy had spent the twenty - four hours after the tragedy , even if [he]181-the boy were ever to know . And so far [he]181-the boy had no notion , thanks to the ridiculous posture prescribed by [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner in [the cab]1160-the cab ; [he]181-the boy could only suppose the motive had been to keep [him]181-the boy out of sight , the benefit to [his]181-the boy breathing a mere pretext ; and yet it was a curious result that after a day and a night [he]181-the boy should still be in total ignorance of [his]181-the boy whereabouts . [He]181-the boy opened [his]181-the boy window and looked out ; but it was a back window , and [the sunny little strip of garden below]1161-the sunny little strip of garden below was one of many in a row . Old discoloured walls divided [them]1162-them from each other and from [the gardens of a parallel block of [bigger houses]1164-bigger houses , whose slates and chimneys towered above the intervening trees]1163-the gardens of a parallel block of bigger houses , whose slates and chimneys towered above the intervening trees . [The street in front of [those houses]1166-those houses]1165-the street in front of those houses was completely hidden , but the hum of [its]1165-the street in front of those houses traffic travelled pleasantly to the ear , and there were other reassuring sights and sounds . In [one of [the contiguous gardens]1168-the contiguous gardens]1167-one of the contiguous gardens [a very small boy]1169-a very small boy was wheeling [a doll]1170-a doll 's perambulator ; on the other side , where the fine , warm gravel reminded [Pocket]92-pocket of the carroty kind at [home]224-home , [a man]219-a man was mowing [an equally trim lawn]1173-an equally trim lawn . [Pocket]92-pocket listened to the murmur of the machine , and watched the green spray playing over the revolving knives , and savoured the curiously countrified smell of cut grass ; the combined effect was a still stronger reminiscence of [[[his]92-pocket father]284-his father 's garden]1175-his father 's garden , where [his]92-pocket own old pony pulled the machine in leather shoes . Because such associations filled [his]92-pocket eyes again , there seemed no end to them . [Somebody]2504-somebody was playing the piano near some open window , and playing almost as well as [Lettice]112-lettice did , and playing one of [her]112-lettice things ! [Pocket]92-pocket could not bear to listen or look out any longer , and [he]92-pocket dressed as quietly as [he]92-pocket could . [He]92-pocket had almost resolved to slip out without a word , whatever else [he]92-pocket did , if the opportunity offered . It simply never occurred to [him]92-pocket , until [he]92-pocket made the discovery , that [anybody]550-anybody would dare to lock [him]92-pocket in [[his]92-pocket room]385-his room ! Yet [they]550-anybody had done it ; [that infernal old German doctor]1179-that infernal old german doctor had had the cheek to do it ; and the effect on [the boy]181-the boy , who so expressed the situation to [himself]181-the boy , was rather remarkable . [A wholly ineffectual tug or two]1181-a wholly ineffectual tug or two told [him]92-pocket [he]92-pocket was on the wrong side of the door for applying mere bodily strength , that either [he]92-pocket must raise an ignominious shout for freedom or else achieve it for [himself]92-pocket by way of the window . Unathletic as [he]92-pocket always had been , [he]92-pocket was sportsman enough not to hesitate an instant between the two alternatives ; and on again looking out of the window , saw [his]92-pocket way down at a glance . Immediately underneath was another window , opening on [a leaded balcony over the bow - window in [the drawing - room]329-the drawing - room]1182-a leaded balcony over the bow - window in the drawing - room . To shift [his]92-pocket bedstead with the least possible noise , to tie a sheet to it , and to slide down the sheet till [he]92-pocket had but a few feet to drop into [the balcony]1184-the balcony , was the work of a very few minutes to one as excitedly determined as [Pocket]92-pocket had become on finding [himself]92-pocket [a prisoner]1185-a prisoner . Thought [they]550-anybody would lock [him]92-pocket in , did [they]550-anybody ? [They]550-anybody would just find out [their]550-anybody mistake ! It was exactly the same mood in which [he]92-pocket had scaled the upright palings in defiance of [the policeman who said [he]92-pocket might not sleep in [the Park]2332-the park]1186-the policeman who said he might not sleep in the park . The balcony window was open , [the room]642-the room within empty . It was obviously [[Baumgartner]118-baumgartner 's bedroom]1189-baumgartner 's bedroom . There was [a camp bedstead worthy of [an old campaigner]1191-an old campaigner]1190-a camp bedstead worthy of an old campaigner , a large roll - top desk , and a waste - paper basket which argued either a voluminous correspondence or imperfect domestic service ; it would have furnished scent for no short paper - chase . Otherwise [the room]642-the room was tidy enough , and so eloquent of [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner [himself]118-baumgartner , in its uncompromising severity , that [Pocket]92-pocket breathed more freely on the landing . And in [the hall]359-the hall [he]92-pocket felt absolutely safe , for [he]92-pocket had gained [it]359-the hall without the creaking of a stair , and there on the pegs hung [his]92-pocket hat , but neither the cloak nor the weird wide - awake affected by [[his]92-pocket host]711-his host . [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner out . That was a bit of luck ; and it was just like [Pocket]92-pocket to lose a moment in taking advantage of it ; but the truth was that [he]92-pocket had made an interesting discovery . It was in [that house]1195-that house the piano was being played . [He]92-pocket heard it through the drawing - room door ; [he]92-pocket had heard it on [the balcony up above]1196-the balcony up above ; it had never stopped once , so silent had [he]92-pocket been . It was that [Phillida]124-phillida , with the large dark eyes , and [she]124-phillida was playing something that [Lettice]112-lettice sometimes played , and very nearly , though naturally not quite , as well . [Pocket]92-pocket would have said that it was [Mendelssohn]143-mendelssohn , or [Chopin]144-chopin , “ or something , ”[92-pocket] for [his]92-pocket love of music was greater than [his]92-pocket knowledge . But it was not exactly the music that detained [him]92-pocket ; [he]92-pocket was thinking more of [the musician]1197-the musician , who had shown [him]92-pocket kindness , after all . It would be only decent to thank [her]1197-the musician before [he]92-pocket went , and [the doctor]241-the doctor [himself]92-pocket through [[his]92-pocket niece]742-his niece . If [she]1197-the musician knew [he]92-pocket had been locked in , and [he]92-pocket had to tell [her]1197-the musician how [he]92-pocket had made [his]92-pocket escape and yet not a sound — well , [she]1197-the musician would not think the less of [him]92-pocket at all events , and so [they]1200-they would part for ever . Or perhaps not for ever ! The juvenile instinct for romance was not to be stifled at such a stimulating moment . [The girl]514-the girl would be sorry for [him]92-pocket when [she]514-the girl knew all ; [she]514-the girl might know enough to be sorry for [him]92-pocket as it was ; in any case it was the game to say goodbye . [The girl]514-the girl sprang from the music - stool in extraordinary excitement . [Her]514-the girl large eyes were larger than ever , as it were with fear , and yet they blazed at [the intruder]1203-the intruder . [Pocket]92-pocket could not understand it , unless [she]1197-the musician already knew the truth . “ [I]92-pocket 'm so sorry for starting [you]514-the girl , ”[92-pocket] [he]92-pocket apologised . “ [I]92-pocket just came in to say goodbye . ”[92-pocket] And [he]92-pocket held out a hand which [she]514-the girl never seemed to see . “ To say goodbye ! ”[514-the girl] [she]514-the girl gasped . “ Yes , [I]514-the girl 've got to go . [I]514-the girl 'm afraid [the doctor]241-the doctor 's out ? ”[514-the girl] “ Yes , [he]241-the doctor is . Wo n't [you]92-pocket wait ? ”[514-the girl] “ [I]514-the girl 'm afraid [I]514-the girl ca n't . ”[514-the girl] [She]514-the girl was shrinking from [him]92-pocket , shrinking round towards the door . [He]92-pocket stood aside , to let [her]514-the girl bolt if that was [her]514-the girl desire . And then [she]514-the girl in turn took [her]514-the girl stand , back to the door . “ [He]241-the doctor 'll be very sorry to miss [you]92-pocket , ”[514-the girl] [she]514-the girl said more firmly , and with a smile . “ And [I]92-pocket 'm very sorry to miss [him]241-the doctor , ”[92-pocket] said [Pocket]92-pocket , unconscientiously enough for [anybody]550-anybody . “ [He]241-the doctor 's been most awfully good to [me]92-pocket , and [I]92-pocket wish [you]514-the girl 'd tell [him]241-the doctor how grateful [I]92-pocket am . ”[92-pocket] “ [I]514-the girl 'm afraid [he]241-the doctor wo n't believe [me]514-the girl , ”[514-the girl] [the girl]514-the girl said dryly , “ if [he]241-the doctor finds [you]92-pocket gone . ”[514-the girl] “ [I]92-pocket must go — really [I]92-pocket must . [I]92-pocket shall get into an awful row as it is . Do [you]92-pocket mind giving [him]241-the doctor one other message ? ”[92-pocket] “ As many as [you]92-pocket like . ”[92-pocket] “ Well , [you]92-pocket might tell [him]241-the doctor from [me]514-the girl that [I]514-the girl 'll give [myself]514-the girl away , but [I]514-the girl 'll never give [him]241-the doctor ! [He]241-the doctor 'll know what [I]514-the girl mean . ”[514-the girl] “ Is that all ? ”[514-the girl] [She]514-the girl was keeping [him]1206-he very cleverly , putting in [her]514-the girl word always at the last moment , and again refusing to see [his]1206-he hand ; but again it was [the boy who helped to waste [his]1206-he own golden opportunity , this time through an indefensible bit of boyish braggadocio]1207-the boy who helped to waste his own golden opportunity , this time through an indefensible bit of boyish braggadocio . “ No ; [you]92-pocket may tell [the doctor]241-the doctor that if [he]241-the doctor wanted to detain [me]514-the girl [he]241-the doctor went the worst way about it by locking [me]514-the girl into [[my]514-the girl room]2694-my room ! ”[514-the girl] [She]514-the girl looked mystified at first , and then astounded . “ How did [you]1206-he get out ? ”[514-the girl] “ How do [you]1206-he suppose ? ”[514-the girl] “ [I]514-the girl never heard anything ! ”[514-the girl] “ [I]1206-he took care [you]92-pocket should n't . ”[1206-he] And [he]1206-he described the successful adventure with pardonable unction in the end . After that [he]1206-he insisted on saying goodbye . And [the young girl]1208-the young girl stood up to [him]1206-he like [a little heroine]1209-a little heroine . “ [I]1209-a little heroine 'm very sorry , but [I]1209-a little heroine ca n't let [you]1206-he go , [Mr. Upton]97-mr. upton . ”[1209-a little heroine] “ Ca n't let [me]1210-the determined girl ? ”[1210-the determined girl] “ [I]1206-he really am sorry — but [you]1208-the young girl must wait to see [[my]1206-he uncle]2695-my uncle . ”[1206-he] [He]1206-he stood aghast before [the determined girl]1210-the determined girl . [She]1208-the young girl was obviously older than [himself]1206-he , yet [she]1208-the young girl was only [a slip of [a girl]1212-a girl]1211-a slip of a girl , and if [he]1206-he forced [his]1206-he way past — but [he]1206-he was [not the fellow]1213-not the fellow to do it — and that maddened [him]1206-he , because [he]1206-he felt [she]1208-the young girl knew it . “ Oh , very well ! ”[1206-he] [he]1206-he cried , sarcastically . “ If [you]1208-the young girl wo n't let [me]1206-he out that way , [I]1206-he 'll go this ! ”[1206-he] And [he]1206-he turned towards [the tiny conservatory]1214-the tiny conservatory , which led down into [the garden]341-the garden ; but [she]1208-the young girl was on [him]1206-he , and there was no hesitation about [her]1208-the young girl ; [she]1208-the young girl held [him]1206-he firmly by the hand . “ If [you]1206-he do [I]1208-the young girl 'll blow a police - whistle ! ”[1208-the young girl] [she]1208-the young girl said . “ [We]2696-we have one — it wo n't take an instant . [You]1206-he sha n't come out the front way , and [you]1206-he 'll be stopped if [you]1206-he climb the wall ! ”[1208-the young girl] “ But why ? Over went walnut whatnots , and out came mutterings that made [him]1206-he hotter than ever for very shame . But [he]1206-he did not hate [her]514-the girl even for what [she]514-the girl made [him]1206-he say ; all [his]1206-he hatred and all [his]1206-he fear were of [the dreadful doctor whose will [she]514-the girl was obeying]1218-the dreadful doctor whose will she was obeying ; and both were at [their]1219-their highest pitch when the door burst open , and in [he]1206-he sprang to part [them]1219-their with a look . But it was a look that hurt more than word or blow ; never had [poor Pocket]92-pocket endured or imagined such a steady , silent downpour of indignation and contempt . It turned [his]1206-he hatred almost in a moment to hatred of [himself]1206-he ; [his]1206-he fear it only increased . “ Leave [us]2701-us , [Phillida]124-phillida , ”[118-baumgartner] said [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner at last . [Phillida]124-phillida was in tears , and [Pocket]92-pocket had been hanging [his]92-pocket head ; but now [he]92-pocket sprang towards [her]124-phillida . “ Forgive [me]92-pocket ! ”[92-pocket] [he]92-pocket choked , and held the door open for [her]124-phillida , and shut it after [her]124-phillida with all the gallantry [the poor lad]1220-the poor lad had left . “ So , ”[118-baumgartner] said [Dr. Baumgartner]118-baumgartner , “ [you]92-pocket not only try to play [me]118-baumgartner false , but [you]92-pocket seize the first opportunity when [my]118-baumgartner back is turned ! [He]92-pocket preferred to defend [his]92-pocket honour as best [he]92-pocket could , which was chiefly by claiming the right to change [his]92-pocket mind about what was after all [his]92-pocket own affair . But that was precisely what [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner would not allow for a moment ; it was just as much [his]92-pocket affair as accessory after the fact , and in accordance with [their]1222-their mutual and final agreement overnight . [Pocket]92-pocket could only rejoin that [he]92-pocket had never meant to give [the doctor]241-the doctor away at all . “ [I]118-baumgartner daresay not ! ”[118-baumgartner] said [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner sardonically . “ It would have been dragged out of [you]92-pocket all the same . [The doctor]241-the doctor flattered [him]92-pocket with a slight delay before replying . “ There were so many reasons , ”[241-the doctor] [he]241-the doctor said , with a sigh ; “ [you]92-pocket must n't forget that [you]92-pocket walk in [your]92-pocket sleep , for one of them . And [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner looked on as though following the same wild train of thought , as though it did not seem so wild to [him]118-baumgartner , but extremely interesting ; so that [Pocket]92-pocket was quite disappointed when [he]92-pocket shook [his]92-pocket head . “ [A stowaway with an attack of asthma]2719-a stowaway with an attack of asthma ! It was true that [he]181-the boy might have escaped already ; the nearer [he]181-the boy had been to it , the less chance was [he]181-the boy likely to be given again . So reasoned [Pocket]92-pocket from the face and voice now dominating [him]181-the boy more powerfully than ever ; but it is an interesting fact that [his]181-the boy conclusion neither cowed nor depressed [him]181-the boy as it might have done . There was actually an element of relief in [his]181-the boy discomfiture . [He]181-the boy had done [his]181-the boy best to do [his]181-the boy duty . It was not [his]181-the boy fault that responsibility had been wrested from [his]181-the boy shoulders , and an evil hour delayed . And yet there was a certain , an immediate , a creature comfort in such delay , which was all the greater because unsought by [him]181-the boy ; it was a comfort that [he]181-the boy had both ways , as the saying is , and from all points of view but that of [[his]181-the boy poor people]1232-his poor people wondering what had become of [him]181-the boy . “ If only [they]1232-his poor people knew ! ”[181-the boy] [he]181-the boy cried ; “ then [I]181-the boy should n't care . [[My]181-the boy sister]2727-my sister would keep [my]181-the boy secret ; [she]2727-my sister 'd play the game all right , [I]181-the boy promise [you]241-the doctor ! And [I]181-the boy 'd play any game [you]241-the doctor like if only [you]241-the doctor let [me]181-the boy write a line to [her]2727-my sister ! ”[181-the boy] [The doctor]241-the doctor would not hear of it at first . Eventually [he]241-the doctor said [he]241-the doctor should have to inspect the letter before it went ; and this proved the thin edge of consent . In the end it was arranged that [Pocket]92-pocket should write what [he]92-pocket liked to [[his]92-pocket sister]260-his sister only , and that [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner should read and enclose it in a covering letter , so that [everybody]1235-everybody need not know it was a letter from [the missing boy]999-the missing boy . [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner was to have it posted from [St. Martin's - le - Grand]51-st. martin's - le - grand , to destroy all trace of [a locality which [he]118-baumgartner now refused point - blank to disclose even to [the writer]1238-the writer]1237-a locality which he now refused point - blank to disclose even to the writer . [He]283-the schoolboy was not to set foot outside [the house]342-the house without [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner , nor to show [himself]283-the schoolboy for a moment at the windows back or front . [She]124-phillida has seen [you]2728-you very ill , remember , and [she]124-phillida had [[your]2728-you doctor]2399-your doctor 's orders not to let [you]2728-you out of [the house]342-the house in [his]2399-your doctor absence . ”[118-baumgartner] “ [She]124-phillida obeyed [them]2737-them like a little brick ! ”[92-pocket] muttered [Pocket]92-pocket , with a wistful heaviness . “ [She]124-phillida did what [she]124-phillida was told ; think no more about it , ”[241-the doctor] said [the doctor]241-the doctor . “ Give [me]241-the doctor [your]2728-you hand on these [your]2728-you promises , and die on [your]2728-you feet rather than break one of them ! Now [I]241-the doctor trust [you]2728-you , [my young fellow]2397-my young fellow ; [you]2728-you will play the game , as [you]2728-you call it , even as [the poor lads in these pictures]2739-the poor lads in these pictures played it at [Gravelotte]34-gravelotte , and die like [them]2739-the poor lads in these pictures rather than go back an inch . Look at this one here . No , not the one with the ridges , but here where [we]2740-we come to bayonets and the sword . See [the poor devils of [the Prussian Guard]2536-the prussian guard]2741-the poor devils of the prussian guard ! See the sheet - lightning pouring into [us]2740-we from the walls of [St. Privat]145-st. privat ! Look at [that fellow with [his]2744-his head bound up , and [this one with no head to bind]2745-this one with no head to bind . See [him]2746-our colonel hounding [us]2740-we on to hell ! And there 's a drummer drumming as though [we]2740-we could hear a single beat ! [Our]2740-we very colours were blown to ribbons , [you]2747-you see , and [we]2740-we [ourselves]2740-we to shreds ; but the shreds hung together , [[my]241-the doctor young fellow]2397-my young fellow , and so will [you]2747-you and [I]241-the doctor in [our]2740-we day of battle ! ”[241-the doctor] [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner might have known [[his]118-baumgartner boy]1244-his boy for years , so sure was [his]118-baumgartner touch upon the strings of a responsive nature , to strike the chords of a generous enthusiasm , and to wake the echoes of noble deeds . [Pocket]92-pocket attacked [his]92-pocket letter with the heart of [a soldier , hardened and yet uplifted for the fight]1245-a soldier , hardened and yet uplifted for the fight ; it was only when [he]92-pocket found [himself]92-pocket writing down vague words , which nevertheless brought [his]92-pocket innocent deed [home]224-home to [him]92-pocket as nothing had done before , that the artificial frost broke up , and real tears ran with [his]92-pocket ink . [He]92-pocket begged [Lettice]112-lettice not to think too hardly of [him]92-pocket , still less to be anxious about [him]92-pocket , or to make [anybody else]1247-anybody else ; [they]1248-they must not fret for [him]92-pocket , [he]92-pocket wrote more than once , without seeing the humour of the injunction . [He]92-pocket was better than [he]92-pocket had been for years , and in the best of hands . But something terrible had happened ; something [he]92-pocket could not help , but would bitterly repent all [his]92-pocket days , especially as it might prevent [him]92-pocket from ever seeing any of them again . It was this monstrous remark , and others to which it led , that were literally blotted with [the writer]1238-the writer 's tears . But just then [he]92-pocket saw [himself]92-pocket in all vivid sincerity as [an outcast who could never show [himself]92-pocket at [home]224-home or at [school]213-school]1250-an outcast who could never show himself at home or at school again . And it required the spell of [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner 's presence to make the prospect such as could be borne with the least degree of visible manhood . Be it remembered that [he]92-pocket was not [a man]219-a man at all , but [a boy in many ways younger than most [boys of sixteen and three quarters]1255-boys of sixteen and three quarters , albeit older in some few]1254-a boy in many ways younger than most boys of sixteen and three quarters , albeit older in some few . [He]92-pocket was old in imagination , but young in common sense . [One]289-one may be imaginative and still have a level head , but it is least likely in [[one]289-one 's teens]1258-one 's teens . The particular temperament does not need a label ; but none who know it when [they]1259-they see it , and [who see it here]1260-who see it here , will be surprised to learn that [this emotional writer]1261-this emotional writer for one was enormously relieved and lightened in spirit when [he]92-pocket had got [his]92-pocket letter off [his]92-pocket mind and hands . True to [his]118-baumgartner warning , [Dr. Baumgartner]118-baumgartner began to glance at it with a kindly gravity ; it was with something else that [he]118-baumgartner shook [his]118-baumgartner head over the second leaf . “ This is not for [me]118-baumgartner to read ! ”[118-baumgartner] said [he]118-baumgartner . “ [I]118-baumgartner 'd rather run the risk of trusting [your]241-the doctor discretion . ”[118-baumgartner] No words could have enslaved [poor Pocket]92-pocket more completely ; [he]118-baumgartner clasped the hand that proceeded to write the covering note , and then the address , all openly before [his]118-baumgartner eyes . And while [the doctor]241-the doctor was gone to [the nearest messenger office]1263-the nearest messenger office to despatch the missive to [the General Post Office]1264-the general post office , ostensibly to catch a particular post , [[his]118-baumgartner prisoner]1265-his prisoner would not have decamped for a hundred pounds , and [the doctor]241-the doctor knew it . [Phillida]124-phillida did not appear at dinner , but at supper [she]124-phillida did , and [Pocket]92-pocket was only less uncomfortable in [her]124-phillida absence , which [he]118-baumgartner felt [he]118-baumgartner had caused , than when [they]1267-they were both at table and [he]118-baumgartner unable to say another word to express [his]118-baumgartner sorrow for the unseemly scene of the forenoon . [She]124-phillida spoke to [him]118-baumgartner once or twice as though nothing of the kind had happened , but [he]118-baumgartner could scarcely look [her]124-phillida in the face . Otherwise both meals interested [him]118-baumgartner ; [they]1267-they were German in [their]1267-they order , a light supper following the substantial middle - day repast ; but it appeared that [they]1267-they both came from [an Italian restaurant]1268-an italian restaurant , and [the English boy]1269-the english boy was much taken with the pagoda - like apparatus in which the dishes arrived smoking hot in tiers . It provided a further train of speculation when [he]118-baumgartner remembered that [he]118-baumgartner had never seen [a servant]1270-a servant in [the house]342-the house , and that the steps had struck [him]118-baumgartner as dirty , and [the doctor]241-the doctor 's waste - paper basket as very full . [Pocket]92-pocket determined to make [his]92-pocket own bed next morning . [He]92-pocket had meanwhile an unpleasing suspicion that [the young girl]1208-the young girl was clearing away , for [the doctor]241-the doctor took [him]118-baumgartner back into [the drawing - room]329-the drawing - room after supper ; and later , when [they]1267-they returned for a game of billiards on the toy board , which [they]1267-they placed between [them]1267-they on the dining - table , both [Phillida]124-phillida and [the fragments]1276-the fragments had disappeared . The little billiards were a bond and a distraction . [They]1267-they brought out [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner 's simple side , and [they]1267-they emphasised [the schoolboy]283-the schoolboy 's simplicity . [Both]1278-both played a strenuous game , [the doctor]241-the doctor a most deliberate one ; [his]241-the doctor brows would knit , [his]241-the doctor mouth shut , [his]241-the doctor eyes calculate , and [his]241-the doctor hand obey , as though [his]241-the doctor cue were a surgical instrument cutting deep between life and death . It was a curious glimpse of disproportionate concentration ; even [the Turk]874-the turk 's head was only lit to be laid aside as an obstruction . [Pocket]92-pocket 's one chance was to hit hard and trust to the fortune that accrues on a small table . [Both]1278-both played to win , and [the boy]181-the boy forgot everything when [he]181-the boy actually succeeded in the last game . [They]1278-both had played very late for [him]181-the boy , and [he]181-the boy slept without stirring until [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner came to [[his]181-the boy room]385-his room about eight o'clock next morning . Now [Pocket]92-pocket had not seen a newspaper all Friday , but it was the first thing [he]92-pocket did see on the Saturday morning , for [the doctor]241-the doctor was waving one like a flag to wake [him]92-pocket . “ Trust [your]92-pocket vermin press to get hold of the wrong end of the stick ! ”[92-pocket] [he]92-pocket cried , with fierce amusement ; “ it only remains to be seen whether [they]1278-both succeed in putting [[your]92-pocket precious police]2749-your precious police on the wrong tack too . Really , it 's almost worth being at the bottom of a popular mystery to watch [the smartest men in [this country]2751-this country making fools of [themselves]2750-the smartest men in this country making fools of themselves]2750-the smartest men in this country making fools of themselves ! ”[92-pocket] “ May [I]92-pocket see ? ”[92-pocket] asked [Pocket]92-pocket ; [he]92-pocket had winced at more than one of these remarks . “ Certainly , ”[118-baumgartner] replied [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner ; “ here 's the journalistic wonder of the age , and there [you]92-pocket are in its most important column . [I]118-baumgartner brought it up for [you]92-pocket to see . ”[118-baumgartner] [The boy]181-the boy bit [his]181-the boy lips as [he]181-the boy read . [His]181-the boy deed had been promoted to leaded type and the highest rank in headlines . It appeared , in the first place , that no arrest had yet been made ; but it was confidently asserted ( by the omniscient butt of Teutonic sallies ) that [the police]858-the police , wisely guided by the hint in yesterday 's issue ( which [Pocket]92-pocket had not seen ) , were already in possession of a most important clue . In subsequent paragraphs of pregnant brevity the real homicide was informed that [his]181-the boy fatal act could only be the work of [a totally different and equally definite hand]1287-a totally different and equally definite hand . [Pocket]92-pocket gathered that there had been a certain commonplace tragedy , in [a street called [Holland Walk]52-holland walk]1288-a street called holland walk , in the previous month of March . [A licensed messenger named Charlton]1289-a licensed messenger named charlton had been found shot under circumstances so plainly indicative of suicide that [a coroner 's jury]1290-a coroner 's jury had actually returned a verdict to that effect . There appeared , however , to have been an element of doubt in the case . This [the scribe of the leaded type]1291-the scribe of the leaded type sought to remove by begging the question from beginning to end . It had not been a case of suicide at all , [he]1291-the scribe of the leaded type declared , but as wilful a murder as the one in [Hyde Park]23-hyde park , to which it bore a close and sinister resemblance . [Both victims]1292-both victims had been shot through the heart in the early hours of the morning ; both belonged to [one neighbourhood]1293-one neighbourhood , and to [the same dilapidated fringe of [the community]1295-the community]1294-the same dilapidated fringe of the community . A pothouse acquaintanceship was alleged between [them]1292-both victims ; but the suggestion was that the link lay a good deal deeper than that , and that [the two dead men]1296-the two dead men were known to [the police]858-the police , who were busy searching for [a third party of equal notoriety in connection with both murders]1298-a third party of equal notoriety in connection with both murders . “ But [we]858-the police know [he]1291-the scribe of the leaded type had nothing to do with [the second one]2752-the second one , ”[181-the boy] said [the boy]181-the boy , looking up at last . “ It was n't a murder , either ; neither was the first , according to [[the coroner]2753-the coroner 's jury]2754-the coroner 's jury , who surely ought to know . ”[181-the boy] “ [One]289-one would have thought so , ”[118-baumgartner] said [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner , with [his]118-baumgartner sardonic smile ; “ but [the yellow pressman]2756-the yellow pressman knows better still , apparently . ”[118-baumgartner] “ Do [you]92-pocket suppose there 's a word of truth in what [he]1291-the scribe of the leaded type says ? [I]92-pocket do n't mean about [Charlton]146-charlton or — or [poor Holdaway]147-poor holdaway , ”[92-pocket] said [Pocket]92-pocket , wincing over [[his]92-pocket victim]860-his victim 's name , which [he]92-pocket had just gleaned from the paper . “ But do [you]92-pocket think [the police]858-the police are really after [anybody]550-anybody ? ”[92-pocket] “ [I]118-baumgartner do n't know , ”[118-baumgartner] said [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner . “ What does it matter ? ”[118-baumgartner] “ It would matter a great deal if [they]858-the police arrested [somebody]2504-somebody for what [I]181-the boy did ! ”[181-the boy] [The boy]181-the boy was no longer looking up ; and [his]181-the boy voice trembled . “ It would alter the whole thing , ”[181-the boy] [he]181-the boy mumbled significantly . “ [I]241-the doctor do n't see it , ”[241-the doctor] returned [the doctor]241-the doctor , with grim good - nature . “ The little wonder of [the English reading world]2760-the english reading world has nearly unearthed [another mare]2761-another mare 's nest , as [two of its readers]2762-two of its readers know full well . No real harm can come of this typical farrago . Let it lead to an arrest ! There are [only two living souls who ca n't account for [their]2763-only two living souls who ca n't account for their time at that of this unfortunate affair time at that of this unfortunate affair]2763-only two living souls who ca n't account for their time at that of this unfortunate affair . ”[92-pocket] [Pocket]92-pocket realised this ; but it was put in a way that gave [him]92-pocket goose - skin under the clothes . [He]92-pocket was always seeing [his]92-pocket accident in some new light , always encountering some new possibility , or natural consequence of [his]92-pocket silence , which had not occurred to [him]92-pocket before . But [he]92-pocket was learning to keep [his]92-pocket feelings under control , to set [his]92-pocket face and [his]92-pocket teeth against the regular reactions of [his]92-pocket coward conscience and [his]92-pocket fickle will . And once again did [Dr. Baumgartner]118-baumgartner atone for an unintentional minor by striking a rousing chord on the very heart - strings of [the boy]181-the boy . “ Eight o'clock ! ”[1304-the magician] cried [the magician]1304-the magician , with a glance at [his]1304-the magician watch and an ear towards the open window . “ [The postman]2764-the postman 's knock from door to door down [every street in [town]2294-town]2765-every street in town — [house]2767-house to house from one end of [[your]181-the boy British Islands]2768-your british islands to the other ! A certain letter is without doubt being delivered at this very moment — eh , [[my]1304-the magician poor young fellow]2720-my poor young fellow ? ”[1304-the magician] [Eugene Thrush]138-thrush was a regular reader of the journal on which [Dr. Baumgartner]118-baumgartner heaped heavy satire , [its]118-baumgartner feats of compression , [its]118-baumgartner genius for headlines , and the delicious expediency of all [its]118-baumgartner views , which enabled [its]118-baumgartner editorial column to face all ways and bow where it listed , in the universal joint of popularity , were points of irresistible appeal to a catholic and convivial sense of humour . [He]138-thrush read the paper with [his]138-thrush early cup of tea , and seldom without a fat internal chuckle between the sheets . That Saturday morning , however , [Mr. Thrush]137-thrush was not only up before the paper came , but for once [he]138-thrush took [its]118-baumgartner opinion seriously on a serious matter . [It]1305-it said exactly what [he]138-thrush wished to think about the [Hyde Park]23-hyde park murder : that [the murderer]1306-the murderer would prove to be [the author of a similar crime , committed in the previous month of March]1307-the author of a similar crime , committed in the previous month of march , when [the Upton boy]1308-the upton boy must have been safe at [school]213-school . If that were so , it was manifestly absurd to connect [the lad]2380-the lad with a mystery which merely happened to synchronise with that of [his]2380-the lad own disappearance — absurd , even if [he]2380-the lad were shown to have been somewhere near the scene of the murder , somewhere about the time of its perpetration . That much , though no more , had , however , been fairly established overnight . It was a conclusion to which [Mullins]139-mullins , with the facile conviction of [[his]139-mullins class]1311-his class , had jumped on the slender evidence of the asthma cigarette alone ; but before midnight [Thrush]137-thrush [himself]137-thrush had been forced to admit its extreme probability . There was a medicine cork as well as an asthma cigarette ; the medicine cork had been found very much nearer the body ; in fact , just across [the pathway]1312-the pathway , under a shrub on the other side of the fence . It was [Mullins]139-mullins , who had made both discoveries , who also craved permission to ring up [Dr. Bompas]99-dr. bompas , late at night , to ask if there was [any particular chemist to whom [he]139-mullins sent [[his]139-mullins patients]1314-his patients with [their]1314-his patients prescriptions]1313-any particular chemist to whom he sent his patients with their prescriptions . [Dr. Bompas]99-dr. bompas was not at [home]224-home , which perhaps was just as well but [[his]99-dr. bompas man]1056-his man gave the name of Harben , in [Oxford Street]5-oxford street . [Harbens]148-harbens , rung up in [their]148-harbens turn , found that [they]148-harbens certainly had made up one of [the doctor]241-the doctor 's prescriptions on the Wednesday , for [a young Mr. Upton]97-mr. upton , and , within half an hour , had positively identified the cork found by [Mullins]139-mullins in [Hyde Park]23-hyde park . It was still sticky with the very stuff which had put [poor Pocket]92-pocket asleep . Yet [Thrush]137-thrush could not or would not conceive any actual connection between [a harmless schoolboy]1318-a harmless schoolboy and an apparently cold - blooded crime . [He]137-thrush resisted the idea on more grounds than [he]137-thrush felt disposed to urge in argument with [his]137-thrush now strangely animated factotum . It was still a wide jump to a detestable conclusion , but [he]137-thrush confined [his]137-thrush criticism to the width of the jump . The cork and the cigarette might be stepping - stones , but at least one more was wanted to justify the slightest suspicion against [the missing boy]999-the missing boy . Let it be shown that [he]137-thrush had carried firearms on the Wednesday night , and [Thrush]137-thrush undertook to join [his]137-thrush satellite on the other side ; but [his]137-thrush mental bias may be gauged from the fact that [he]137-thrush made no mention of [[the boy]181-the boy 's mother]1321-the boy 's mother 's dream . [Mullins]139-mullins found [him]137-thrush not only up , shaved and booted , but already [an enthusiastic convert to the startling theory of a sensation journalist]1322-an enthusiastic convert to the startling theory of a sensation journalist , and consequently [an irritable observer of the saturnine countenance which darkened to a tinge of distinct amusement over the leaded type]1323-an irritable observer of the saturnine countenance which darkened to a tinge of distinct amusement over the leaded type . “ So [you]139-mullins do n't think there 's much in it , [Mullins]139-mullins ? ”[139-mullins] “ [I]139-mullins should n't say there was anything at all , [sir]2286-sir . ”[139-mullins] “ Yet [I]139-mullins suppose [you]139-mullins remember the very similar occurrence in [Holland Walk]52-holland walk ? ”[139-mullins] “ Oh yes , [sir]2286-sir , but it was a case of suicide . ”[139-mullins] “ [I]139-mullins do n't agree . ”[139-mullins] “ But surely , [sir]2286-sir , [the jury]2773-the jury brought it in suicide ? ”[139-mullins] “ [[The coroner]2753-the coroner 's jury]2754-the coroner 's jury did — in spite of [the coroner]2753-the coroner — but it may come before [another jury]2777-another jury yet , [Mullins]139-mullins ! [I]137-thrush remember the case perfectly ; the medical evidence was that the shot had been fired at arm 's length . That is n't the range at which [we]2778-we usually bring [ourselves]2778-we down ! Then there was nothing to show that [the man]182-the man ever possessed a pistol , or even the price of one ; [he]182-the man was so stony it would have gone up the spout long before . The very same point crops up in the case of [this poor boy]2780-this poor boy . Who says [he]182-the man ever had a revolver in [his]182-the man life ? [[His]182-the man father]284-his father tells [me]137-thrush explicitly that [he]182-the man never had ; [I]137-thrush happened to ask the question , ”[137-thrush] added [Thrush]137-thrush , without explaining in what connection . “ Well , [sir]2286-sir , ”[139-mullins] said [Mullins]139-mullins , with respect enough in [his]139-mullins tone , “ [you]2286-sir talk about jumping to conclusions , but it strikes [me]139-mullins [the gentleman who write for the papers]2783-the gentleman who write for the papers could give [me]139-mullins some yards and a licking , [sir]2286-sir ! ”[139-mullins] This was a sprightly speech for [Mullins]139-mullins ; but it was delivered with the very faintest of deferential smiles , and [Mr. Thrush]137-thrush shook [his]137-thrush spectacles without one at all . “ [The gentlemen on this paper]2785-the gentlemen on this paper have a knack of lighting on the truth , however , ”[137-thrush] [he]137-thrush remarked ; “ it may be by fair means , or it may be by foul , but [they]2785-the gentlemen on this paper have a way of getting there before [the others]545-the others start . ”[137-thrush] [Mullins]139-mullins remarked with quiet confidence that [they]1324-they were not going to do it this time . [His]139-mullins position was , briefly , that [he]139-mullins could not bring [himself]139-mullins to believe in two separate mysteries , at one and the same time and place , with no sort of connection between them . “ That would be too much of a coincidence , ”[139-mullins] said [Mullins]139-mullins , sententiously . [Thrush]137-thrush looked at [him]139-mullins for a moment . “ But life 's one long collection of coincidences ! That 's what [I]137-thrush 'm always telling [you]139-mullins ; the mistake is to look on them as anything else . The author of “[138-thrush] Peripatetic Psychology ” deserves to have asthma all [his]118-baumgartner nights , and “[138-thrush] After this Life ” smacks of the usual Schopenhauer and [Lager]152-lager . No , [we]2822-we wo n't build on [Dr. Baumgartner]118-baumgartner , [Mullins]139-mullins ; but [we]2822-we 'll go through [the chemists of [London]3-london]2659-the chemists of london with a small tooth - comb , from here to the four - mile radius . ”[138-thrush] [Thrush]138-thrush had finished breakfast , and [Mullins]139-mullins was beginning to clear away , when a stormy step was heard upon the stairs , and in burst [Mr. Upton]97-mr. upton with a panic - stricken face . [He]97-mr. upton was colourless almost to the neck , but [he]97-mr. upton denied that [he]97-mr. upton had any news , though not without a pregnant glance at [Mullins]139-mullins , and fell to abusing [London]3-london and [the Londoners]1330-the londoners , but [City men]1331-city men above all others , till [Thrush]138-thrush and [he]97-mr. upton should be alone together . The incidental diatribe was no mere padding , either ; it was the sincere utterance of [a passionately provincial soul]1332-a passionately provincial soul . Nobody in all [London]3-london , [he]97-mr. upton declared , and apparently without excepting [Mr. Thrush]137-thrush , cared a twopenny curse what became of [[his]97-mr. upton poor boy]1333-his poor boy . In view of the fact that [the present company]1334-the present company alone knew of [his]138-thrush disappearance , and not so very many more of [the boy]181-the boy 's existence , this was an extravagantly sweeping statement . But [the distracted man]1336-the distracted man had a particular instance to bear [him]138-thrush out ; [he]138-thrush had been to see [[[his]97-mr. upton boy]1244-his boy 's friends ' father , “ a swine called [Knaggs]108-young knaggs , ”[138-thrush] that very morning at [[his]97-mr. upton house in [St. John 's Wood]16-st. john 's wood]1339-his house in st. john 's wood]1338-his boy 's friends ' father , “ a swine called knaggs , ” that very morning at his house in st. john 's wood . “ Rather early , was n't it ? ”[137-thrush] suggested [Thrush]137-thrush , whose manner was more softly sympathetic than it had been the night before . The change was slight , and yet marked . [Pocket Upton]92-pocket was able to relieve [his]92-pocket soul of one load that morning . It was twelve o'clock , and a summer 's Saturday . [School]213-school was over for the week . It was not these simple luxuries that [Pocket]92-pocket missed so sorely ; it was the whole full life of ups and downs , and no yesterdays and no to - morrows , that [he]92-pocket had lost for ever since last Saturday . The heavy midday meal came in smoking from [the Italian restaurant]1399-the italian restaurant , and [Pocket]92-pocket was [himself]92-pocket again , as [a boy]850-a boy will be ; after all , [they]1401-they knew about [him]92-pocket at [home]224-home by this time , [their]1401-they worst fears were allayed , and in the end it would all come right . [Their]1412-their eyes had met sharply ; [both young]1413-both young faces were flooded with light , and it was much the same light . There was no nonsense about it , but there was indignant horror on [his]92-pocket side , and indignant shame on [hers]124-phillida . “ [You]92-pocket really are at [school]213-school ? ”[124-phillida] [she]124-phillida whispered , not increduously , but as one seeking assurance in so many words ; and in a flash [he]92-pocket saw what [she]124-phillida had thought , what [she]124-phillida had been deliberately made to think , that [[his]92-pocket beloved school]1414-his beloved school was not [a school]908-a school at all , but [an Ayslum]1416-an ayslum ! [Park]62-park murder — Park murder — arrest ! ”[587-the other] And [Pocket]92-pocket sprang up from the table in a state that swept [his]92-pocket last thoughts clean from [his]92-pocket mind . [The girl]514-the girl said something ; [he]92-pocket did not hear what . [He]92-pocket was white and trembling , in pitiable case even to eyes that could only see skin - deep ; but [the doctor]241-the doctor 's step came beating like a drum to [him]92-pocket , and [he]92-pocket was solidly seated when [the doctor]241-the doctor entered — without any paper at all . “ It 's that murder the papers are all exploiting , ”[92-pocket] [he]92-pocket explained benignly . “ [They]2864-them were shouting out something about an arrest ; [you]2865-you would hear [them]2864-them , [I]92-pocket daresay . [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner subjected [them]1423-them both to a jealous scrutiny , and suddenly cried out upon [his]118-baumgartner own bad memory . It appeared there was a concert at [the Albert Hall]1424-the albert hall , where “ [the most popular and handsome pair in [England]27-england]2868-the most popular and handsome pair in england ”[241-the doctor] ( the inverted commas were in [the doctor]241-the doctor 's sneer ) were being welcomed on [their]1423-them return from [the ends of [the earth]1427-the earth]1426-the ends of the earth . And [Phillida]124-phillida rose submissively , with unreal thanks which could not conceal [her]124-phillida recognition of the impromptu pretext for getting rid of [her]124-phillida ; [[her]124-phillida uncle]748-her uncle called [a taxicab]360-a taxicab , and with harsh hilarity turned [her]124-phillida off [the premises]1430-the premises in the frock [she]124-phillida had been wearing all day . “ And now , ”[92-pocket] said [he]92-pocket , returning with a scowl , “ what the devil were [you]1423-them two talking about while [my]92-pocket back was turned ? ”[92-pocket] “ Yesterday , ”[92-pocket] replied [Pocket]92-pocket , more than ready for [him]92-pocket , though [his]92-pocket heart beat fast . “ What about yesterday ? ”[92-pocket] “ [Our]1423-them scuffle in [the other room]2597-the other room . ”[92-pocket] “ Is that all ? ”[92-pocket] “ No — [I]92-pocket found out something ; [she]124-phillida did n't tell [me]92-pocket . ”[92-pocket] “ What did [you]92-pocket find out ? ”[92-pocket] “ That [you]118-baumgartner let [her]124-phillida think [me]92-pocket mad ! ”[92-pocket] cried [Pocket]92-pocket , in monstrous earnest . [He]92-pocket might have laughed at [himself]92-pocket , could [he]92-pocket have seen [his]92-pocket own reproachful face . But [he]92-pocket could have killed [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner for laughing at [him]92-pocket ; it did not occur to [him]92-pocket that the laugh was partly one of pure relief . “ Why , [[my]118-baumgartner young fellow]2397-my young fellow , how else can [I]118-baumgartner account for [you]118-baumgartner ? ”[118-baumgartner] “ [You]118-baumgartner said [she]124-phillida would think [I]118-baumgartner was [a patient]2871-a patient . ”[118-baumgartner] “ Exactly ! A mental case . ”[118-baumgartner] “ [You]118-baumgartner had no business to make [me]92-pocket out mad , ”[92-pocket] persisted [Pocket]92-pocket , with dogged valour . “ Pardon [me]118-baumgartner ! [I]118-baumgartner had all the business in [the world]439-the world ; and [I]118-baumgartner beg that [you]118-baumgartner 'll continue to foster the illusion as thoroughly as [you]118-baumgartner did yesterday when [I]118-baumgartner was out . It 's no good shaking [your]118-baumgartner head at [me]118-baumgartner ; listen to reason , ”[118-baumgartner] continued [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner , with an adroit change of tone . “ And try , [[my]92-pocket good young fellow]2873-my good young fellow , do try to think of [[somebody]2504-somebody besides [yourself]118-baumgartner]2875-somebody besides yourself ; have some consideration for [[my]92-pocket niece]2876-my niece , if [you]118-baumgartner have none for [me]92-pocket . ”[92-pocket] [Pocket]92-pocket was mystified , but still more incensed ; for [he]92-pocket felt [himself]92-pocket being again put gently but clearly in the wrong . “ And [I]92-pocket should like to know , ”[92-pocket] [he]92-pocket cried , “ what good it does [her]2876-my niece to think [she]2876-my niece 's associating with [a lunatic]2697-a lunatic ? ”[92-pocket] “ [She]2876-my niece would probably prefer the idea to that of [a murderer]2878-a murderer , ”[118-baumgartner] was the suave reply . “ [I]118-baumgartner speak only of ideas ; otherwise [I]118-baumgartner should not make use of such an expression , even in jest . It was a devouring gaze of sudden and implacable animosity . The ruthless lips were shut out of sight , yet working as though the teeth were being ground behind [them]1433-them ; the crow 's footed face flushed up , and the crow 's feet were no more ; it was as though age was swallowed in that flood of speechless passion till [the whole man]1434-the whole man was no older than the fiery eyes that blazed upon [the boy]181-the boy . And yet the most menacing thing of all was the complete control with which [the doctor]241-the doctor broke this pregnant silence . “ [You]181-the boy say that . [I]241-the doctor say otherwise . [You]181-the boy had better find a book in [the other room]2597-the other room till [you]181-the boy know [your]181-the boy own mind again . ”[241-the doctor] “ [I]92-pocket know it now , unless [they]2884-they release [that man]2447-that man , ”[92-pocket] said [Pocket]92-pocket , through [his]92-pocket teeth , although they chattered . “ Give [them]2884-they a chance , and give [yourself]181-the boy one !
