But , mind [you]92-pocket , it 'll be [your]92-pocket fault if anything happens to either of [us]3168-us after this ! ”[1807-he] [He]1807-he only meant it as a last argument , though [he]1807-he did resent [her]1808-her fatal obstinacy , and all the obligations which it imposed upon [himself]1807-he . [He]1807-he stood chained in fetters of [her]1808-her forging , as it were to the stake , but [he]1807-he was prepared to stand there like [a man]219-a man , and [he]1807-he did not deserve the things [she]1808-her said to [him]1807-he in a fresh paroxysm of unreasonable wrath . [He]1807-he might be [a baby]3160-a baby , but [he]1807-he was not [a complete coward]1811-a complete coward , or simply trying to make [her]1808-her miserable , as [she]1808-her declared ; neither , on this occasion , was [he]1807-he thinking only of [himself]1807-he . But [Phillida]124-phillida seemed suddenly to realise that , for [she]124-phillida broke off with a despairing little cry , and ran sobbing up [the stairs]1812-the stairs . In days to come , when [the boy]181-the boy had schooled [himself]181-the boy not to speak of these days , nor to let [his]181-the boy mind dwell on their mystery and terror , it was as a day of dark hours and vivid moments that [he]181-the boy remembered the one which [Phillida]124-phillida and [he]181-the boy began alone together in [[[her]124-phillida uncle]748-her uncle 's house]1815-her uncle 's house . Those endless hours were either mercifully forgotten or else contracted to an endurable minimum ; but the unforgettable moments would light themselves up in [his]181-the boy memory without a detail missing . There was [their]1816-they first encounter at the dark - room door , and [Phillida]124-phillida standing all but barefoot in the ruby light , with [her]124-phillida glorious hair about [her]124-phillida shoulders , a picture that could never fade . Then there was the moment of the incriminating print , which the sun wiped out even as [Phillida]124-phillida stood with it in [her]124-phillida hands . That moment merged itself in the greater one of [his]181-the boy discovery that the revolver was fully loaded , [his]181-the boy inspiration that neither [it]1817-it nor [he]181-the boy had done the fatal mischief in [the Park]2332-the park . Then [she]124-phillida was begging [him]181-the boy to go ( [she]124-phillida who would keep [him]181-the boy the time before ! ) and [he]181-the boy entreating [her]124-phillida to come with [him]181-the boy , and neither giving way an inch , so that [they]1816-they quarrelled just when [they]1816-they should have stuck together , and [she]124-phillida ran away in tears , and [he]181-the boy stayed below in a glow of anger which dissolved [his]181-the boy fears like snow in May. That was the beginning of a black hour and more . [Phillida]124-phillida was never to be forgiven , then ; [he]181-the boy was staying [there]2306-there at [his]181-the boy peril , staying absolutely on [her]124-phillida account , and so far from giving [him]181-the boy the slightest credit for it , or a single word of encouragement , [she]124-phillida said all sorts of things and was off before [he]181-the boy could answer one of them . It was not for [Pocket]92-pocket to see the many ironies of that moment , and not for [him]181-the boy to recognise the tonic property of [his]181-the boy heroic grievance . [He]181-the boy could only see [himself]181-the boy at the foot of [those stairs]1820-those stairs , first gnashing [his]181-the boy teeth and not sorry [he]181-the boy had made [her]124-phillida cry , then sitting down with [his]181-the boy eye on the front door , revolver in hand , to await the click of [the doctor]241-the doctor 's key . Another click was to answer it ; and at the point of the cocked revolver [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner was to have made a clean breast of [his]118-baumgartner crimes , not only to [the giant - killer at the foot of the stairs]1822-the giant - killer at the foot of the stairs but to [the girl [he]118-baumgartner meant to call to witness with [her]1823-the girl he meant to call to witness with her own ears own ears]1823-the girl he meant to call to witness with her own ears . [Pocket]92-pocket saw [himself]92-pocket [a desperate character]1824-a desperate character just then , and [one not incapable of desperate action had the climax only come at once]1825-one not incapable of desperate action had the climax only come at once . But [he]181-the boy had more than an hour of it alone at [his]181-the boy post ; [he]181-the boy had a whole hot forenoon of unmitigated suspense , of sickening alarms from [tradesmen]1826-tradesmen 's carts , [boys]348-boys whistling past [the house]342-the house as though [they]348-boys were not in [a wicked world]1829-a wicked world at all , and then a piano - organ that redoubled [his]181-the boy watchfulness , and spoilt some tunes for [him]181-the boy for ever . Once [he]181-the boy did hear shambling feet on the very steps outside . Once was quite enough , though it was but an advertisement for cast - off clothing ( and false teeth ) that came fluttering through the letter - box . [Pocket]92-pocket was left in such a state that [he]181-the boy would not have backed [himself]181-the boy to hit the door from the stairs ; and [he]181-the boy put the chain on it , thinking to interview [the doctor]241-the doctor over that , in the manner of [old Miss Harbottle]96-miss harbottle . So it happened that the first significant sound was entirely lost upon [him]181-the boy , because [he]181-the boy was listening for one so much nearer at hand , until [Phillida]124-phillida ran [downstairs]2537-downstairs and almost over [him]181-the boy where [he]181-the boy sat . [He]181-the boy got up to make way stiffly , but a glance assured [him]181-the boy that the quarrel was over on [her]124-phillida side . The great eyes were fixed appealingly upon [him]181-the boy , but with a distressing look which [he]181-the boy had done nothing to provoke . Not before then was [he]181-the boy aware of another duet between [newsboys]1832-newsboys coming nearer and nearer , and shouting [each other]1375-each other down as [they]1832-newsboys came . “ [You]181-the boy hear that ? ”[124-phillida] [she]124-phillida whispered , as if not to drown a note . “ [I]124-phillida do now . ”[124-phillida] “ Do [you]124-phillida hear what it is ? ”[92-pocket] [Pocket]92-pocket listened , and caught a word [he]92-pocket was not likely to miss . “ Something fresh about the murder , ”[92-pocket] said [he]92-pocket grimly . “ No ; it 's another one , ”[124-phillida] [she]124-phillida shuddered . “ Ca n't [you]92-pocket hear ? “[124-phillida] Another awful murder ! ” Now [they]1834-they 're saying something else . ”[124-phillida] “ It is something about [the Park]2332-the park . ”[92-pocket] [Pocket]92-pocket stuck to [his]92-pocket idea . “ And something else about some “[92-pocket] well - known”—I ca n't hear what ! ”[124-phillida] “ No more can [I.]92-pocket ”[124-phillida] “ [I]124-phillida 'll open the door . ”[124-phillida] [She]124-phillida opened it on the chain as [he]92-pocket had left it . [Dr. Baumgartner]118-baumgartner had left [the house]342-the house before six o'clock in the morning ; now it was after twelve . If some tragedy had overtaken [him]118-baumgartner in [his]118-baumgartner turn , then there was an end to every terror , and for [him]118-baumgartner a better end than [he]118-baumgartner might meet with if [he]118-baumgartner lived . [The boy]181-the boy remembered [Him]118-baumgartner who desireth not the death of [a sinner]1838-a sinner , and was ashamed of [his]181-the boy own thought ; but that did not alter it . [Pocket]92-pocket may have misconceived [his]92-pocket own attitude of mind , as [[his]92-pocket elders]332-his elders and betters do daily ; [he]92-pocket may have been thinking of [his]92-pocket own skin more than [he]92-pocket knew , or wanted to know . [Phillida]124-phillida 's first words on returning were to that effect ; and yet [she]124-phillida trembled as though they were not the truth . “ Who was it , then ? ”[283-the schoolboy] [the schoolboy]283-the schoolboy asked suspiciously . “ [Sir Joseph Schelmerdine]167-sir joseph schelmerdine . ”[283-the schoolboy] “ So [he]92-pocket was [the well - known man]3172-the well - known man ! ”[92-pocket] [He]92-pocket was well known even to [the boy]181-the boy by name , but that was all . [Sir Joseph Schelmerdine]167-sir joseph schelmerdine , [Bart]168-bart . , [M.P.]169-m.p. , [the well - known proprietor of [the Money - maker]1849-the money - maker]1848-the well - known proprietor of the money - maker , had been shot dead in front of [[his]167-sir joseph schelmerdine house in [Park Lane]73-park lane]1850-his house in park lane . [The groom]1854-the groom thought it was to be taken in [the Park]2332-the park , and was [himself]1854-the groom on [his]1854-the groom way back to [the mews]1861-the mews when the riderless horse overtook [him]1854-the groom . But a hue and cry had been started , and it was believed that [the criminal]1863-the criminal was still in hiding in [the immediate neighbourhood]1864-the immediate neighbourhood , which was being subjected to a thorough search under the direction of [responsible officers from [Scotland Yard]31-scotland yard]1865-responsible officers from scotland yard . Such was the news which [the young girl]1208-the young girl had shrunk from showing to [[her]1208-the young girl companion]1867-her companion . [She]1208-the young girl had left [him]1867-her companion , indeed , to read it by [himself]1867-her companion . And the next thing [he]1867-her companion remembered was finding [her]1208-the young girl quite insensible in the big chair in [the back room]1868-the back room . The afternoon was a blank broken by no more moments such as these . It was a period of dull misery and gnawing dread ; but [the pair]1869-the pair saw each other through it , [they]1869-the pair were not divided any more . Now [they]1869-the pair listened for [his]1867-her companion step no longer , but for more newsboys crying [his]1867-her companion capture to [the world]439-the world . And in the hours that [they]1869-the pair spent thus listening , and listening , [the girl]514-the girl had much to say , that it did [her]514-the girl good to say , about this [Dr. Baumgartner]118-baumgartner as [she]514-the girl had known and almost loved [him]118-baumgartner in the past . Lovable , however , [he]118-baumgartner had never been , though more than good and kind to [her]514-the girl for all that . [He]118-baumgartner had never taken [her]514-the girl into [his]118-baumgartner life , or entered into [hers]514-the girl , in the many years [they]1869-the pair had been more or less together . All [she]514-the girl really knew of [him]118-baumgartner was from [[her]514-the girl mother , whose elder sister [he]118-baumgartner had married soon after the Franco - Prussian War , and lost soon after marriage]1872-her mother , whose elder sister he had married soon after the franco - prussian war , and lost soon after marriage . [He]118-baumgartner must have been settled in [England]27-england many years before [[Phillida]124-phillida 's mother]1873-phillida 's mother , [herself]1873-phillida 's mother [[an Englishman]1874-an englishman 's widow]1875-an englishman 's widow , came to keep house for [him]118-baumgartner . [The girl]514-the girl could not remember [[her]514-the girl father]904-her father , but [[her]514-the girl mother]523-her mother had lived to see [her]514-the girl in [her]514-the girl teens , and in [her]514-the girl lifetime [Dr. Baumgartner]118-baumgartner had seemed much as [other men]738-other men . It was only of late years that [he]118-baumgartner had withdrawn from a world in which [he]118-baumgartner was justly honoured , and buried [himself]118-baumgartner ever deeper in [his]118-baumgartner books and [his]118-baumgartner photographic experiments . [[His]118-baumgartner niece]742-his niece had never known anything of these ; [he]118-baumgartner had told [her]742-his niece nothing , and [she]742-his niece had always gone in awe of [him]118-baumgartner . But [he]118-baumgartner had sent [her]742-his niece to [school]213-school , [he]118-baumgartner was going to send [her]742-his niece to college , [he]118-baumgartner had only just given [her]742-his niece six months in [Switzerland]74-switzerland . It was during those months that all [his]118-baumgartner eccentricities had become pronounced ; that [he]118-baumgartner had given up [servants]1882-servants , and taken to doing half the work of [the house]342-the house [himself]118-baumgartner , with the casual aid of [charwomen]1884-charwomen , and saving the other half by having the meals in from [a restaurant]1885-a restaurant . [Phillida]124-phillida had no influence with [him]118-baumgartner in these or any other matters . [She]124-phillida only blamed [herself]124-phillida for not having realised the change in [him]118-baumgartner and done more to save [him]118-baumgartner from [himself]118-baumgartner . [He]118-baumgartner had done so much for [her]124-phillida , whatever madness might have overtaken [him]118-baumgartner in the end ; [her]124-phillida own kinsfolk so much less , for all [their]1886-their opulent integrity . Nothing could make [her]124-phillida forget what [he]118-baumgartner had done . [She]124-phillida never could or would desert [him]118-baumgartner ; it was no use asking [her]124-phillida again ; but [she]124-phillida took [[her]124-phillida callow champion]1887-her callow champion 's hand , and wrung it with [her]124-phillida final answer , which was unaccompanied by further prayers for [his]118-baumgartner departure . And [Pocket]92-pocket could understand [her]124-phillida now , though it was no consecutive tale that [he]92-pocket heard , but a very chaos of excuses and extenuations , regrets , suppositions , and not always revelant recollections , of which [he]92-pocket had to make what [he]92-pocket could in [his]92-pocket own mind . What [he]92-pocket made was a narrative so natural that [he]92-pocket could not believe it was the life - story of [a murderer]2878-a murderer . [His]92-pocket own convictions became preposterous in [his]92-pocket own eyes . What had [he]92-pocket been thinking about all day ? Was that the way [a murderer]2878-a murderer would behave ? Was this the way [a murderer]2878-a murderer would live , in [these surroundings]1891-these surroundings , with those books about [him]2878-a murderer , with that little billiard - table in [the next room]1892-the next room ? Had [those waxen murderers in the garish vault]1893-those waxen murderers in the garish vault lived ordinary lives as well ? [Pocket]92-pocket had only thought of [them]1893-those waxen murderers in the garish vault as committing [their]1893-those waxen murderers in the garish vault dreadful deeds , yet now [he]92-pocket could only think of [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner as living this ordinary life . The mood passed , but it would recur as sure as [Phillida]124-phillida thought of something else to be said for [Dr. Baumgartner]118-baumgartner ; it was the creature of [her]124-phillida feeling for [him]118-baumgartner , and of [the schoolboy]283-the schoolboy 's feeling for [her]124-phillida . If [he]118-baumgartner could have convicted [himself]118-baumgartner of the fatal affair in [the Park]2332-the park , and so cleared [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner of all blood - guiltiness whatsoever , in that or any other case , [he]118-baumgartner would have done it for [Phillida]124-phillida 's sake that afternoon . But with every hour of [the doctor]241-the doctor 's absence suspicions multiplied . [Phillida]124-phillida [herself]124-phillida was a prey to [them]1897-them . [She]124-phillida was almost as ready to recall symptoms of incipient insanity as instances of personal kindness ; if [one]289-one lost [one]289-one 's reason , [she]124-phillida broke a long silence to contend , there could be no question of regret and wrong . [She]124-phillida was not so sure about crime and punishment . [Pocket]92-pocket , of course , said there could be no question of that either ; but in [his]92-pocket heart [he]92-pocket wondered how much method [they]1900-they must prove to hang [a madman]1901-a madman . The evening meal had been taken in , but that was all . [The girl]514-the girl and [boy]2572-boy had no thought of sitting down to it ; [she]124-phillida had made tea not long before ; and strong excitement is its own meat and drink . [They]1900-they were sitting silently together in [the room]642-the room at the back . The scented summer dusk was deepening every minute . Suddenly there was a sound of small branches breaking in [the garden]341-the garden . [Pocket]92-pocket peeped out , standing back from the window at [her]124-phillida entreaty . The laburnum by the wall was shaking violently , pouring its golden rain into [both gardens]1906-both gardens , and the bush beneath it looked alive ; [a tall figure]1907-a tall figure rose out of it , and came creeping towards [the little conservatory]1728-the little conservatory , bent double , and brushing the soil from [his]1907-a tall figure clothes as [he]1907-a tall figure advanced with long and stealthy strides . [It]1907-a tall figure was [Dr. Baumgartner]118-baumgartner , in a cap pulled down over [his]118-baumgartner eyes , and the old alpaca jacket . [He]118-baumgartner had a newspaper parcel under [his]118-baumgartner arm . [The boy]181-the boy and [girl]1384-girl were in the dark angle between the window and the door ; but it was only comparative darkness , and [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner might have seen [them]1900-they ; [they]1900-they were clasping hands as [they]1900-they shrank away from [him]118-baumgartner with one accord . But [he]118-baumgartner did not seem to see [them]1900-they at all . [He]118-baumgartner stretched [himself]118-baumgartner , as though [he]118-baumgartner found it a relief to stand upright , and more mould trickled from [his]118-baumgartner garments in the act ; [he]118-baumgartner took off the alpaca jacket , and shook it as [one]289-one shakes a handkerchief . There could have been nothing in the pockets , certainly no weapon , and if [he]118-baumgartner had a hip - pocket there was none in that , for [his]118-baumgartner gaunt figure stood out plainly enough in the middle of [the room]642-the room . There was still the newspaper parcel ; [he]118-baumgartner had put it down on one of the walnut - tables . [He]118-baumgartner now removed the paper ; it fell at [Pocket]92-pocket 's feet , a newspaper and nothing more ; and nothing had come out of it but the stereoscopic camera , that [either watcher]1913-either watcher could detect . And [he]118-baumgartner passed through [the room]642-the room without taking the least notice of either of [them]1900-they , whether [he]118-baumgartner saw [them]1900-they or not ; and [they]1900-they heard [him]118-baumgartner go [upstairs]351-upstairs , and shut the door , and then [his]118-baumgartner footsteps overhead . “ [I]92-pocket 'll go up and tackle [him]118-baumgartner at once , ”[92-pocket] said [Pocket]92-pocket , through [his]92-pocket set teeth ; but [Phillida]124-phillida would not hear of it . “ No ! [I]92-pocket must go first and see if there 's nothing [I]92-pocket can get [him]118-baumgartner ; [he]118-baumgartner may n't have had anything all day . [The doctor]241-the doctor was coming down in a hurry , as though [he]241-the doctor had indeed forgotten something . But [he]241-the doctor passed [the open drawing - room]1917-the open drawing - room door ; [they]1918-they saw [him]241-the doctor pass , jingling a bunch of keys , and never so much as glancing in on the way . It was the dark - room door [he]241-the doctor opened . Now [he]241-the doctor would find out everything ! [They]1918-they heard a match struck , and saw the faint light turn into a strong deep crimson glow . The door shut . [The children]1919-the children stood listening in the dark . Running water , and the chink of glass ; the tapping of a stoppered bottle ; the opening of the dark slide ; these stages [the younger photographer]1920-the younger photographer followed as though [he]1920-the younger photographer were again looking on . Then there was a long period without a sound . “ [He]241-the doctor 's developing now ! ”[92-pocket] whispered [Pocket]92-pocket , close to the folding - doors . [He]92-pocket caught the sound of laboured breathing on the other side . “ There it is — there it is — there it is ! ”[241-the doctor] cried [the doctor]241-the doctor 's voice in mingled ecstasy and mad excitement . A deep sigh announced the blackening of the plate at the conclusion of the first process . A tap ran for a moment ; interminable minutes ensued . “ It 's gone ! It 's gone again ! ”[1922-the wild voice] cried [the wild voice]1922-the wild voice , with a sob ; “ it 's gone , gone , gone like all the rest ! ”[1922-the wild voice] [One listener]1923-one listener waited for the passionate smashing of the negative as before ; but that did not happen again ; and then [he]1923-one listener wondered if it was being put straight into the rack with [the others]545-the others , if the damage to the locker had been discovered at last . [He]1923-one listener never knew . The door opened . The red glow showed for a moment in [the passage]639-the passage , then went out . The door shut behind [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner , and again [he]241-the doctor passed [the drawing - room]329-the drawing - room , [a bent figure]1927-a bent figure , without looking in . And the flagging step on the stairs bore no resemblance to the one which had come hurrying down not many minutes before . “ [I]124-phillida must go to [him]241-the doctor ! ”[124-phillida] said [Phillida]124-phillida in broken undertones , and [her]124-phillida grief communicated itself to [the other young sympathetic soul]1928-the other young sympathetic soul , for all the base fears [he]241-the doctor had to fight alone . Personal safety , little as [she]124-phillida might think of it , was the essence of [her]124-phillida position as opposed to [his]241-the doctor ; and [he]241-the doctor was of the type that thinks of everything . [She]124-phillida left [him]241-the doctor listening breathless in the dark . Does it make it any better if [a man]219-a man has [an accomplice]3184-an accomplice in [his]219-a man crimes ? If [he]219-a man 's guilty at all , it makes it all the worse . ”[1930-i] [The boy]181-the boy and [girl]1384-girl sat long and late in the open window at the back of [the house]342-the house . [The room]642-the room would have been in darkness but for a flood of moonlight pouring over [them]1935-they . The only light in [the house]342-the house was in [the room above]1937-the room above , and [they]1935-they only saw its glimmer on [the garden]341-the garden when a casual cloud hid the moon ; but once [Pocket]92-pocket had crept out into [the garden]341-the garden to steal a look at the lighted window itself ; and what [he]92-pocket saw was the shadow of a huge bent head smoking a huge bent pipe , and dense clouds of shadow floating up the wall and over the ceiling . It seemed hours since [they]1935-they had heard footstep or other sound [upstairs]351-upstairs or anywhere . There had been a brisk interval — and then an end — of more or less distant hansom - bells and motor - horns . There was no longer even a certain minute intermittent trembling of trifles on the walnut - tables , to which [Pocket]92-pocket had become subconsciously accustomed in [that house]1195-that house , so that [he]92-pocket noticed its absence more than the thing itself . It was as though [the whole town]1942-the whole town was at rest , and [the tunnels under [the town]1944-the town]1943-the tunnels under the town , and every single soul above or below ground , but those two white faces in the moonlight , and perhaps [one other overhead]1945-one other overhead . [Pocket]92-pocket wondered ; it was so long since a single sound had come down to [their]1935-they ears . [He]92-pocket wanted to steal out and look up again . [Phillida]124-phillida was against it ; perhaps [she]124-phillida was wondering too . [Pocket]92-pocket , as usual , saw what [he]92-pocket did see so very vividly , in [his]92-pocket mind 's eye , that [he]92-pocket shivered and was asked if [he]92-pocket felt cold . The whispered debate that followed was the longest conversation [they]1935-they had that night . The window was not shut as a result of it , but [Pocket]92-pocket fetched [his]92-pocket overcoat on tiptoe , and it just went over both [their]1935-they shoulders , when the chairs were drawn as near together as [they]1935-they would go . [The ragged little garden]1946-the ragged little garden was brimming over with moonlight from wall to wall . The unkempt grass looked pale and ghostly , like the skin of some monstrous wolf . The moon rolled high in the sky and clouds flew above and below the moon , varying in pace as well . Yet it was a still night , and [Pocket]92-pocket did not think that [he]92-pocket had broken the stillness , until the door burst open behind [them]1935-they , and [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner stood there , holding [his]118-baumgartner lamp aloft . The wick was turned too high , the flame ran up the chimney in the draught , and for an instant a demoniac face flared up behind it . Then the chimney cracked , and fell in a tinkling shower , and [the doctor]241-the doctor was seen whirling a naked tongue of fire about [his]241-the doctor head . [The boy]181-the boy drew back as the lamp flew through the open window , within an inch of [his]181-the boy nose , and crashed upon the path outside . [The trio]1949-the trio stood without a word in the moonbeams ; but [the doctor]241-the doctor was breathing hard through [his]241-the doctor teeth , like [a man]219-a man wrestling with [himself]241-the doctor ; and at last [he]241-the doctor laughed sardonically as though [he]241-the doctor had won . “ A lamp like that 's a dangerous thing , ”[241-the doctor] said [he]241-the doctor , with a kind of forced solemnity and a shake of the head ; “ [you]181-the boy never know what may happen when a lamp does that ! [I]241-the doctor 'm glad the window was open ; it did n't go very near [[my]241-the doctor young fellow]2397-my young fellow , [I]241-the doctor hope ? ”[241-the doctor] And [he]241-the doctor took [Pocket]92-pocket playfully by the ear , but pinched it so hard that [the boy]181-the boy could have screamed with pain . “ It would have served [you]181-the boy right , ”[241-the doctor] continued [the doctor]241-the doctor , before [Pocket]92-pocket could find [his]92-pocket tongue , “ for sitting up so late , and keeping [a young lady]3186-a young lady from [her]3186-a young lady bed to bear [you]181-the boy company . Come , [Phillida]124-phillida ! [I]241-the doctor shall have another word with [you]181-the boy , [young fellow]3101-young fellow . ”[241-the doctor] The two words to [the girl]514-the girl were in a different key from all the rest . [They]1955-they were tolerant , conciliatory , tenderly persuasive . The rest was suavely sinister ; it made [her]514-the girl hesitate ; but [Pocket]92-pocket had the presence of mind to bid [her]514-the girl a cheery good - night , and [she]514-the girl went , closely followed by [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner . [He]181-the boy looked wildly about [him]118-baumgartner , and an idea came . [He]181-the boy opened the front door wide , and then stole back through [the conservatory]1957-the conservatory into the moonlight . [He]181-the boy tore to the end of [it]341-the garden , and cowered in the shadow of the far wall . [The doctor]241-the doctor came running into [the moonlit room]1960-the moonlit room , but not for a minute ; it looked as though [he]241-the doctor had run out first into [the road]636-the road . [He]181-the boy seemed to see nothing to bring [him]181-the boy out that way , for [he]181-the boy closed that window and put out the gas . [The trembling watcher]1965-the trembling watcher heard the front door shut soon after , and saw another light in [[Baumgartner]118-baumgartner 's room]1966-baumgartner 's room the minute after that , and the blind drawn down . But on the blind there lagged a cloud - capped shadow till [the doctor]241-the doctor 's pipe was well in blast . There were no more shadows after that . The moon moved round to the right , and set behind [the next house]1968-the next house . The sky grew pale , and the lighted blind paler still , until [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner drew it up before putting out [his]118-baumgartner light . [Pocket]92-pocket was now too stiff to stir ; but it was not necessary ; [the doctor]241-the doctor had scarcely looked out . There was a twitter of sparrows all down [the road]636-the road , [garden]1971-garden answering to [garden]1971-garden . The sun came up behind [Pocket]92-pocket 's wall , behind [the taller houses further back]1973-the taller houses further back . [This passage]1980-this passage was closed by a gate , and the gate was locked , but [Pocket]92-pocket threw [himself]92-pocket over it almost in [his]92-pocket stride and darted over into [the open road]1981-the open road . Just then [it]1981-the open road was [a perfectly empty road]1982-a perfectly empty road , but for [a gaunt black figure stalking away in the distance]1983-a gaunt black figure stalking away in the distance . [Pocket]92-pocket promptly raced to that corner , and got another glimpse of [[his]92-pocket leader]725-his leader before [he]92-pocket vanished round the next . So the spasmodic chase continued over a zigzag course ; but at every turn the distance between [them]1988-them was a little less . [Neither]1989-neither looked round , and once [the boy]181-the boy 's feet were actually on [the man]182-the man 's shadow ; for half [the streets]627-the streets were raked with level sunlight , but the other half were ladders of dusk with rungs of light at the gaps between [the houses]1993-the houses . All were dustier , dirtier , and emptier than is ever the case by night or day , because this was neither one nor the other , though the sun was up to make the most of dust , dirt , and emptiness . It was before even the cleansing hour of [the scavenger and the water - cart]1994-the scavenger and the water - cart . A dead cat was sprawling horribly in one deserted reach of wood - paving . And [a motor - car]1995-a motor - car at full speed in a thoroughfare calling [itself]1995-a motor - car [King 's Road]75-king 's road , which [Pocket]92-pocket was about to cross , had at all events the excuse of a visible mile of asphalt to itself . There might have been [a second man]2169-a second man lying on that seat , or crouching on the flags between the seat and the parapet , but [he]2169-a second man would have been invisible from the beat . Not another creature was in sight anywhere . Yet [the policeman]408-the policeman swore that [he]135-tony had not proceeded a dozen yards up [Cheyne Row]79-cheyne row before the shot was fired . [He]135-tony had turned round actually in time to see the puff of smoke dispersing over the parapet . It was all [he]135-tony saw . [He]135-tony had found [the deceased]2110-the deceased lying in a heap , nearer the seat than the parapet , but between the two . [Not another soul]2172-not another soul did [he]135-tony see , or had [he]135-tony seen . And [he]135-tony had not neglected to look over the parapet into [the river]3067-the river , and along the foreshore in both directions , without discovering sign or trace of [human being]2174-human being . Such was the story which [Phillida]124-phillida found so hard to credit that [she]124-phillida proceeded to [the spot]2175-the spot in order to go over the ground for [her]124-phillida own satisfaction . This did not make it easier to understand . It had come on to rain heavily while [she]124-phillida was in [the shop]2176-the shop ; [the shining Embankment]2177-the shining embankment was again practically deserted , and [she]124-phillida was able to carry out [her]124-phillida experiment without exciting observation . [She]124-phillida took a dozen steps up [Cheyne Row]79-cheyne row , pretended [she]124-phillida heard the shot , turned sharp round , and quite realised that from where [she]124-phillida was the body could not have been seen , hidden as it must have been by the seat , which itself was almost hidden by [the long and narrow island of [enclosed garden]2179-enclosed garden]2178-the long and narrow island of enclosed garden . But [a running man]2180-a running man could have been seen through [the garden]341-the garden , even if [he]2180-a running man stooped as [he]2180-a running man ran , and [the murderer]1306-the murderer must have run like the wind to get away as [he]1306-the murderer had done . The gates through [the garden]341-the garden , back and front of the statue , had not been opened for the day when the murder took place , so [Phillida]124-phillida in [her]124-phillida turn made a half - circuit of [the island]2184-the island to get to the spot where the body had been found , but without taking [her]124-phillida eyes off [the spot]2175-the spot until [she]124-phillida reached [it]2175-the spot . No ! It was as [she]124-phillida had thought all along ; by nothing short of a miracle could [the assassin]2186-the assassin have escaped observation if [the policeman]408-the policeman had eyes in [his]408-the policeman head and had acted as [he]408-the policeman swore [he]408-the policeman had done . [He]408-the policeman might have dashed into [the garden]341-the garden , when [the policeman]408-the policeman was at [his]408-the policeman furthest point distant , if the gates had been open as they were now ; but they had been locked , and [he]408-the policeman could not have scaled them unobserved . Neither would it have been possible to take a header into [the river]3067-the river with the foreshore as described by [the same witness]2191-the same witness . Yet [the murderer]1306-the murderer had either done one of these things , or the flags of [the Embankment]473-the embankment had opened and swallowed [him]1306-the murderer . [The girl]514-the girl stood on the very spot where [the murdered man]1842-the murdered man must have fallen , and in [her]514-the girl utter perplexity it was no longer the tragedy but the problem which engrossed [her]514-the girl mind . What had happened , had happened ; but how could it have happened ? [She]514-the girl raised [her]514-the girl umbrella and peered through the rain at a red pile of many - windowed flats ; had [that Argus of the hundred eyes]2196-that argus of the hundred eyes been sleeping without one of them open at the time ? [Her]514-the girl own eyes fell as far as the black statue in [the narrow garden]2040-the narrow garden , standing out hi the rain , like the greenery about [its]2196-that argus of the hundred eyes granite base , as though the blackened bronze were polished marble . How lifelike [the colossal scholar in [his]2198-the colossal scholar in his homely garb homely garb]2198-the colossal scholar in his homely garb ! [He]2198-the colossal scholar in his homely garb knew — [he]2198-the colossal scholar in his homely garb knew — those grim old eyes had seen it all , and still [they]2202-they stared and smiled as much as to say : “ [You]124-phillida are looking the wrong way ! Look where [I]2202-they am looking ; that way lies the truth [you]124-phillida are [poor fool enough to want to know]3235-poor fool enough to want to know ! ”[2202-they] And [Phillida]124-phillida turned [her]124-phillida back towards the shiny statue , and looked over the wet parapet , almost expecting to see something , but never dreaming of what [she]124-phillida actually saw . The tide , which must have been coming in that early morning , was now going out , and between [the Embankment masonry]2203-the embankment masonry and [the river]3067-the river there was again a draggled ribbon of shelving foreshore , black as on [some volcanic coast]2205-some volcanic coast ; and between [land and water]2206-land and water , at a point that would necessarily have been submerged for the last eight or nine hours , a small object was being laid more bare by every receding wavelet . It was black and square , perhaps the size of two large cigar - boxes side by side ; and it had one long , thin , reddish tentacle , finishing in a bulb that moved about gently in the rain - pocked water . [Phillida]124-phillida felt the parapet strike cold and wet through [her]124-phillida rain - coat sleeves as [she]124-phillida leant far over to make doubly sure what [she]124-phillida object was ; but indeed [she]124-phillida had not a moment 's doubt but that it was the missing camera of [the murdered man]1842-the murdered man . And the name of [Mullins]139-mullins reminded [him]97-mr. upton that [his]97-mr. upton curiosity on a very different point had not been gratified . “ Why on earth did [you]97-mr. upton have [Mullins]139-mullins run in ? ”[138-thrush] [he]138-thrush inquired , with characteristic absence of finesse . “ [I]138-thrush 'm not very proud of it , ”[138-thrush] replied [Thrush]138-thrush . “ It did n't come off , [you]97-mr. upton see . ”[138-thrush] “ But whatever could the object have been ? ”[976-the ironmaster] “ [I]138-thrush must have a damn - it if [I]138-thrush 'm to tell [you]97-mr. upton that , ”[138-thrush] said [Thrush]138-thrush ; and [the ironmaster]976-the ironmaster concluded that [he]976-the ironmaster meant a final drink , from the action which [he]976-the ironmaster suited to the oath . “ It was one way that occurred to [me]976-the ironmaster of putting salt on [the lad]2380-the lad . ”[976-the ironmaster] “ [Tony]135-tony ? ”[976-the ironmaster] “ Yes . ”[976-the ironmaster] “ [You]97-mr. upton puzzle [me]976-the ironmaster more and more . ”[976-the ironmaster] “ Well , [you]97-mr. upton see , [I]976-the ironmaster gathered that [he]135-tony was [a particularly honourable boy , of fine sensibilities]3322-a particularly honourable boy , of fine sensibilities , and yet [Mullins]139-mullins thought [he]139-mullins had shot [this man]2647-this man by accident and was lying low . But it takes time even for a Eugene Thrush to consume all but three large whiskies and sodas ; and the afternoon was already far advanced . The camera had been placed upon a folded newspaper , for the better preservation of the hotel table - cloth . Its apertures were still choked with mud ; beads of slime kept breaking out along the joints . And [Phillida]124-phillida was still explaining to [Pocket]92-pocket how the thing had come into [her]124-phillida possession . “ The rain was the greatest piece of luck , though another big slice was an iron gangway to the foreshore about a hundred yards up - stream . [I]124-phillida tried to shut it , but the wood must have swollen in the water . Yet the more it has swollen , the better it ought to keep out the light , ought n't it ? ”[124-phillida] “ [I]181-the boy 'm afraid there is n't a dog 's chance , ”[181-the boy] [he]181-the boy murmured , as [he]181-the boy handled the camera again . Yet it was not of the folding - bellows variety , but was one of the earlier and stronger models in box form , and it had come through its ordeal wonderfully on the whole . Nothing was absolutely broken ; but the swollen slide jammed obstinately , until in trying to shut it by main force , [Pocket]92-pocket lost [his]92-pocket grip of the slimy apparatus , and sent it flying to the floor , all but the slide which came out bodily in [his]92-pocket hand . “ That settles it , ”[124-phillida] remarked [Phillida]124-phillida , resignedly . The exposed plate stared [them]2223-them in the face , a sickly yellow in the broad daylight . It was cracked across the middle , but almost dry and otherwise uninjured . “ [I]92-pocket am sorry ! ”[92-pocket] exclaimed [Pocket]92-pocket , as [they]2223-them stood over the blank sheet of glass and gelatine ; it was like looking at a slate from which some infinitely precious message had been expunged unread . “ [I]92-pocket 'm not sure that [you]3335-you were n't right after all ; what 's water - tight must be more or less light - tight , when [you]3335-you come to think of it . The other side ought n't to bulge like that ! ”[92-pocket] [He]92-pocket picked the broken plate out of the side that was already open , and weighed the slide in [his]92-pocket hand ; it was not heavy enough to contain another plate , [he]92-pocket declared with expert conviction ; yet the side which had not been opened was a slightly bulging but distinctly noticeable convexity . [I]92-pocket used the underlined word advisedly ; [some]287-some would substitute “[92-pocket] monomania , ” but [I]92-pocket protest [I]92-pocket am as sane as [they]287-some are , fail as [I]92-pocket may to demonstrate that fact among so many others to be dealt with in the very limited time at [my]92-pocket disposal . This was the part [they]2231-they read together , now in silence , now one and now [the other]587-the other whispering a few sentences aloud:—. “ What [I]587-the other have called [my]587-the other life 's ambition demands but little explanation here . [I]587-the other have never made any secret of it , but , on the contrary , [I]587-the other have given full and frank expression to [my]587-the other theories in places where they are still accessible to [the curious]3340-the curious . [I]587-the other refer to [my]587-the other signed articles on spirit photography in Light Human Nature , The Occult Review and other periodicals , but particularly to the paper entitled “[587-the other] The Flight of [the Soul]2233-the soul , ” in The Nineteenth Century and After for January of last year . The latter article contains [my]587-the other last published word on the matter which has so long engrossed [my]587-the other mind . It took [me]587-the other some months to prepare and to write , and its reception did much to drive [me]587-the other to the extreme measures [I]587-the other have since employed . Treated to a modicum of serious criticism by the scientific press , but more generally received with ignorant and intolerant derision , which is [the Englishman]3341-the englishman 's attitude towards whatsoever is without [his]3341-the englishman own contracted ken , [my]587-the other article , the work of months , was dismissed and forgotten in a few days . [I]587-the other had essayed the stupendous feat of awaking [the British nation]3342-the british nation to a new idea , and [the British nation]3342-the british nation had responded with a characteristic snore of unfathomable indifference . [My]587-the other name has not appeared in its vermin press from that day to this ; it was not mentioned in the paragraph about [the psychic photographer]3344-the psychic photographer which went the rounds about a year ago . Yet [I]587-the other was [that photographer]3345-that photographer . [I]587-the other am [the serious and accredited inquirer to whom [the London hospitals]3347-the london hospitals refused admittance to [[their]3347-the london hospitals pauper deathbeds]3348-their pauper deathbeds]3346-the serious and accredited inquirer to whom the london hospitals refused admittance to their pauper deathbeds , thronged though those notoriously are by the raw material of [the British medical profession]3349-the british medical profession . Begin at the bottom of the British medical ladder , and [you]3350-your are afforded the earliest and most frequent opportunities of studying ( if not accelerating ) the phenomena of human dissolution ; but against [the foreign scientist]3351-the foreign scientist the door is closed , without reference either to the quality of [his]3351-the foreign scientist credentials or the purity of [his]3351-the foreign scientist aims . [I]587-the other can conceive no purer and no loftier aim than [mine]587-the other . It is as high above that of [[your]3350-your ordinary physician]3352-your ordinary physician as [heaven]3353-heaven [itself]3353-heaven is high above [this earth]3354-this earth . [[Your]3350-your physician]3355-your physician wrestles with death to lengthen life , whereas [I]587-the other would sacrifice a million lives to prove that there is no such thing as death ; that this human life of [ours]3356-ours , by which [we]3356-ours set such childish store , is but a fleeting phase of the permanent life of the spirit . One shrinks from setting down so trite a truism ; it is the common ground of all religion , but [I]587-the other have reached it from the opposite pole . Religion is to [me]587-the other the unworthy triumph of instinct over knowledge , a lazy substitution of invention for discovery . Religion invites [us]3356-ours to take [her]3357-her postulates on trust ; but a material age is deserving of material proofs , and it is these proofs [I]587-the other have striven to supply . Surely it is a higher aim , and not a lower , to appeal to the senses that can not deceive , rather than to the imagination which must and does ? But [I]587-the other am trenching after all upon ground which [I]587-the other [myself]587-the other have covered before to - day ; it is [my]587-the other function to - night to relate a personal narrative rather than to reiterate personal views . Suffice it that to [me]587-the other , for many years , the only path to [the Invisible]87-the invisible has been the path of so - called spiritualism ; the only lamp that illumined that path , so that [all who saw]3358-all who saw might follow it for [themselves]3358-all who saw , the lamp of spirit photography . It is a path with a bad name , a path infested with [quacks and charlatans]3359-quacks and charlatans , and by [false guides who rival [the religious fanatics]3361-the religious fanatics in the impudence of [their]3361-the religious fanatics appeal to [man]2426-man 's credulity]3360-false guides who rival the religious fanatics in the impudence of their appeal to man 's credulity . Even those who bear the lamp [I]587-the other hold aloft are too often [jugglers and rogues , to whose wiles , unfortunately , the simple science of photography]3363-jugglers and rogues , to whose wiles , unfortunately , the simple science of photography lends itself all too readily . Nothing is easier than the production of impossible pictures by a little manipulation of film or plate ; if [the spiritual apparition]3364-the spiritual apparition is not to be enticed within range of the lens , nothing easier than to fabricate an approximate effect . And what [spiritualist]3365-spiritualist has yet succeeded in summoning [spirits]3366-spirits at will ? It is the crux of the whole problem of spiritualism , to establish any sort or form of communication with [disembodied spirits]3367-disembodied spirits at the single will of [the embodied]3368-the embodied ; hence the periodical exposure of the paid medium , the smug scorn of [the unbeliever]3369-the unbeliever , and the discouragement of genuine exploration beyond the environment of the flesh . There is one moment , and only one , at which [a man]219-a man may be sure that [he]219-a man stands , for however brief a particle of time , in the presence of [a disembodied soul]3371-a disembodied soul . It is the moment at which soul and body part company in what [men]478-men call death . [The human watcher]3373-the human watcher sees merely the collapse of the human envelope ; but many a phenomenon invisible to the human eye has been detected and depicted by that of the camera , as [everybody knows who has the slightest acquaintance with the branch of physics known as “[587-the other] fluorescence . ” The invisible spirit of man]3374-everybody knows who has the slightest acquaintance with the branch of physics known as “ fluorescence . ” the invisible spirit of man surely falls within this category . To the crystal eye of science it is not so much invisible as elusive and intractable . Once it has fled [this earth]3354-this earth , the sovereign opportunity is gone ; but photography may often intercept the actual flight of the soul . ”[587-the other] “ [I]587-the other say no more than “[587-the other] often ” because there are special difficulties into which [I]587-the other need not enter here ; but they would disappear , or at least be minimised , if the practice received the encouragement [it]3376-it deserves , instead of the forbidding ban of [a sentimental generation]3377-a sentimental generation . [Charlton]146-charlton , [the licensed messenger]3390-the licensed messenger , had less to live for than [any man [I]587-the other ever knew]3391-any man i ever knew ; in the course of [our]3392-our brief acquaintance [he]146-charlton frequently told [me]587-the other how [he]146-charlton wished [he]146-charlton was dead . [I]587-the other came across [him]146-charlton in [Kensington]72-kensington , outside [a house to which an unseemly fracas had attracted [my]587-the other attention as [I]587-the other passed]3393-a house to which an unseemly fracas had attracted my attention as i passed . [Charlton]146-charlton had just been ejected for being drunk and insolent , and refusing to leave without an extra sixpence . [I]587-the other befriended [him]146-charlton . [He]146-charlton was indeed saturated with alcohol and honeycombed with disease ; repulsive in appearance , and cantankerous in character , [his]146-charlton earnings were so slender that [he]146-charlton was pitifully clad , and without a night 's lodging oftener than not . [He]146-charlton had [not a friend in [the world]439-the world]3394-not a friend in the world , and was suffering from an incurable malady of which the end was certain agony . [I]587-the other resolved to put [him]146-charlton out of [his]146-charlton misery , and at the same time to try to photograph the escape of [his]146-charlton soul . A favourable opportunity did not present itself for some time , during which [Charlton]146-charlton subsisted largely on [my]587-the other bounty ; at last one morning [I]587-the other found [him]146-charlton asleep on a bench in [Holland Walk]52-holland walk , and [not another being in sight]3396-not another being in sight , and [I]587-the other shot [him]146-charlton with a cheap pistol which [I]587-the other had purchased second - hand for the purpose , and which [I]587-the other left beside [him]146-charlton on the seat . Yet the weapon it was that cast a doubt upon the authenticity of the suicide , despite [my]587-the other final precaution of stuffing a number of cartridges into [the dead man]810-the dead man 's pocket ; [pot - house associates]3398-pot - house associates came forward to declare that [he]146-charlton could never have possessed either the revolver or its price without [their]3398-pot - house associates knowledge . Hence [the coroner]2753-the coroner 's repudiation of the verdict at the inquest . Yet it is to be feared that the fate of such as [poor Charlton]146-charlton excites but little public interest in its explanation , and that [the police themselves]3400-the police themselves never took more than an academic interest in the case . ”[587-the other] “ To [me]587-the other it was a bitter disappointment on other grounds . [I]587-the other had lost very few seconds between pulling the revolver trigger and pressing the bulb of [my]587-the other pneumatic shutter ; but [one]289-one had to get back into position for this , and the fact remains that [I]587-the other was too late . The result may be found among [my]587-the other negatives . It is dreadfully good of [the dead man]810-the dead man , if not a unique photograph of actual death ; but it lacks the least trace of the super - normal . The flight of the soul had been too quick for [me]587-the other ; it would be too quick again unless [I]587-the other hit upon some new method . [I]587-the other had not only failed to leave convincing evidence of suicide , but the fatal pause between pistol - shot and snap - shot was due entirely to [my]587-the other elaborate attempt in that direction . It was not worth making again . The next case should be a more honest breach of the Sixth Commandment ; the shot to be fired , and the photograph taken , at the same range and all but at the same instant . There would be no further point in leaving the weapon behind , so [I]587-the other was free to choose the one best suited to [my]587-the other purpose , and to adapt it at [my]587-the other leisure to [my]587-the other peculiar needs . Eventually [I]587-the other evolved the ingenious engine which , no doubt , has already explained itself better than [I]587-the other could possibly explain it ; if not , [the discoverer of the camera]3403-the discoverer of the camera need not hesitate to experiment with the pistol , as it will not be loaded when found . ”[587-the other] There was a brief discussion here . [The children]1919-the children could not understand about the pistol ; but only one of [them]1919-the children cared what had become of it . For [Phillida]124-phillida it was enough to know that [the writer of this shameless rigmarole]2235-the writer of this shameless rigmarole , with its pompous periods and its callous gusto , must long ago have lost [his]2235-the writer of this shameless rigmarole reason . [She]124-phillida had no doubt whatever about that , and already it had brought a new light into [her]124-phillida eyes . [She]124-phillida would pause to discuss nothing else . [I]124-phillida had everything in readiness for another attempt to liberate and photograph [a human soul]3404-a human soul in consecutive fractions of a second . No ; the dawn and [the drunkard]3411-the drunkard were still [my]124-phillida best chance . [I]124-phillida knew [him]3405-the right man by sight as [a pot - house loafer of [the Charlton circle]3414-the charlton circle]3413-a pot - house loafer of the charlton circle , but it was quite by chance that [I]124-phillida followed [his]3405-the right man uncertain footsteps through [the Park]2332-the park , and saw [him]3405-the right man go deliberately to bed in the drenching dew . [His]3405-the right man face filled in [his]3405-the right man tale ; it was another farrago of privation and excess . This was the type that caused [me]124-phillida no compunction : having aimed and focussed at the same time , as [my]124-phillida invention provides , [I]124-phillida despatched [the poor devil]3416-the poor devil as [he]3405-the right man lay on [his]3405-the right man side , with [his]3405-the right man hat over [his]3405-the right man eyes , and exposed [my]124-phillida plate as [he]3405-the right man rolled over on [his]3405-the right man face . It may be reckoned an offensive detail , but the click of [my]124-phillida instantaneous shutter coincided with the last clutter in [his]3405-the right man throat . ”[124-phillida] “ [I]124-phillida need hardly say that [I]124-phillida had looked about [me]124-phillida pretty thoroughly before firing , and [my]124-phillida first act after taking the photograph was to make another wary survey of the scene . It had the advantage that [one]289-one could see a considerable distance in three directions , and in none of these , neither right nor left along [the path]600-the path , nor yet straight ahead across the grass on the edge of which [[my]124-phillida victim]3419-my victim lay , was [a living creature to be seen]3420-a living creature to be seen . This was very reassuring , as [I]124-phillida felt that [I]124-phillida could see a good deal farther than the report of [my]124-phillida small automatic pistol was likely to be heard ; for it is a remarkable feature of most shooting cases , especially where a pistol has been used , and in the open air , how seldom it is that [a witness]3421-a witness can be found [who has actually heard the fatal shot]3422-who has actually heard the fatal shot . In the fourth quarter , where there was a bank of shrubbery behind [some iron palings]3423-some iron palings , [I]124-phillida looked last , for [I]124-phillida was standing with [my]124-phillida back that way . How shall [I]124-phillida describe [my]124-phillida sensations on turning round ? There was [a young lad]3424-a young lad within a few feet of [me]124-phillida , on the other side of the palings ; and [this young lad]3425-this young lad was flourishing a revolver in [his]3425-this young lad right hand ! ”[124-phillida] “ At first [I]2237-i made certain [he]3425-this young lad had seen everything ; but [his]3425-this young lad blank and frank bewilderment was more reassuring at a second glance , and at a third [I]2237-i guessed what had happened to [him]3425-this young lad . [His]3425-this young lad crumpled clothes were dank with dew . [His]3425-this young lad eyes were puddles of utter stupefaction . [He]3425-this young lad had been sleeping in [the Park]2332-the park , and walking in [his]3425-this young lad sleep , and in all probability it was [my]2237-i shot which had brought [him]3425-this young lad to [himself]3425-this young lad ; of this , however , [I]2237-i was less sure , and in [my]2237-i doubt [I]2237-i was disastrously inspired to accuse [him]3425-this young lad of having fired the shot [himself]3425-this young lad . Already [I]2237-i regretted that [I]2237-i had gone so far , and yet already [I]2237-i saw [myself]2237-i committed to a course of action as rash as it was now inevitable . [They]2237-i were not uncomplimentary to [Pocket]92-pocket personally , but they betrayed a profound disdain for [the typically British institution of which Pocket]2238-the typically british institution of which pocket was too readily accepted as [a representative product]2239-a representative product . [His]92-pocket general ignorance and credulity received a grim tribute ; they were the very qualities [the doctor]241-the doctor would have demanded in a chosen dupe . Yet [he]92-pocket appeared to have enjoyed [the youth]209-the youth 's society , [his]92-pocket transparent honesty , [his]92-pocket capacity for enthusiastic interest , whether in the delights of photography or in the horrors of war . There was a brief but terrible account of the murder of [Sir Joseph Schelmerdine]167-sir joseph schelmerdine outside [[his]167-sir joseph schelmerdine own house in [Park Lane]73-park lane]2252-his own house in park lane . [Baumgartner]118-baumgartner described the incident with a callous relish , as perhaps the most exciting in [his]118-baumgartner long career ; [he]118-baumgartner was going on to explain [his]118-baumgartner subsequent return , in propria persona , and yet by stealth , when [he]118-baumgartner paused in the middle of a sentence which was never finished . And [his]118-baumgartner statement concluded as follows , in less careful language and a more flowing hand : — “ [I]118-baumgartner thought [the fool]3463-the fool had cleared out long ago . The day 's excitement must have driven [him]3463-the fool clean out of [my]118-baumgartner head . [I]118-baumgartner never thought of [him]3463-the fool when [I]118-baumgartner got back , never till [I]118-baumgartner saw the damage to the darkroom window and missed [his]3463-the fool clothes . [I]118-baumgartner did n't waste two thoughts upon [him]3463-the fool then . [I]118-baumgartner had [my]118-baumgartner negative to develop . A magnificent negative it was , too , yet another absolute failure from the practical point of view , perhaps from the same reason as its predecessors . [South African mines]3464-south african mines may produce gold and diamonds ( licit and illicit ! ) but their yield in souls is probably the poorest to the square mile anywhere on [earth]2430-earth . [Schelmerdine]167-sir joseph schelmerdine never had one in [his]167-sir joseph schelmerdine gross carcass . So there was an end of [him]3463-the fool , and a good riddance to [rotten clay]174-rotten clay . [I]118-baumgartner have not thought of [him]3463-the fool again all night . [I]118-baumgartner have thought of nothing but this perhaps passionately dispassionate statement that [I]118-baumgartner have made up [my]118-baumgartner mind to leave behind [me]118-baumgartner . Only sometimes have [I]118-baumgartner paused to light [my]118-baumgartner pipe . [I]118-baumgartner had made such a pause , perhaps half an hour ago , when in the terrible stillness of the night [I]118-baumgartner heard a footstep in [the hall]359-the hall . [My]118-baumgartner nerves were somewhat on edge with all this writing ; it might be [my]118-baumgartner imagination . [I]118-baumgartner know what to expect in enlightened [England]27-england : either a death unfit for a dog , or existence worse than death in [a criminal lunatic asylum]3478-a criminal lunatic asylum . [I]118-baumgartner prefer [my]118-baumgartner own peculiar quietus ; it has stood on [my]118-baumgartner table all night long , ready and pointed at [my]118-baumgartner heart ; a hand upon the door , a step behind [me]118-baumgartner , and [I]118-baumgartner should have rolled over dead at [their]3479-they feet . So it will be if even now [they]3479-they are waiting for [me]118-baumgartner outside ; but , if not , [I]118-baumgartner know where to go , where already it is broad daylight , where [the wide open space]3480-the wide open space will quicken and enhance every ray , and [the broad river]3481-the broad river multiply the sun by a million facets of living fire . It is not the light that will fail [me]118-baumgartner , there ; and as [I]118-baumgartner have served [others]1132-others , so also will [I]118-baumgartner serve [myself]118-baumgartner , and it may be with better fortune than [they]3479-they have brought [me]118-baumgartner . Who knows ? It would be in keeping with the poetic ironies of this existence . At all events , unless waylaid at once , [I]118-baumgartner am giving it a chance . [I]118-baumgartner shall place the camera on [the parapet of [the Embankment]473-the embankment]3483-the parapet of the embankment . [I]118-baumgartner have fitted the shutter with a specially long pneumatic tube , and the bulb will do its double work as usual when [my]118-baumgartner fingers relax . [I]118-baumgartner have long had it all in [my]118-baumgartner mind . [I]118-baumgartner have written full instructions on the envelope which [I]118-baumgartner shall stick by the flap to the open slide ; if [we]3485-we are found by [a reasonably intelligent person]3486-a reasonably intelligent person , the slide will be shut , and the camera handed over bodily to [the police]858-the police . [They]858-the police , [I]118-baumgartner think , may be trusted to honour [one]289-one 's last instructions , if only out of curiosity ; [their]858-the police eyes will be the first to read what [I]118-baumgartner fear [they]858-the police will describe as [my]118-baumgartner “[118-baumgartner] full confession . ” Well , it is “[118-baumgartner] full , ” and the substantive must be left to [them]858-the police . So long as the document does not fall into one little pair of gentle hands , [I]118-baumgartner shall lie easy in whatever ignominious grave [they]858-the police lay [me]118-baumgartner . That is why [I]118-baumgartner hide it where [I]118-baumgartner do : since , if it fell first into those hands , it would never see the light at all . ”[118-baumgartner] There was a little more , but [Phillida]124-phillida suddenly snatched the MS . away , and wept over the end , bitterly , and yet not altogether in bitterness , while [Pocket]92-pocket picked up the camera and set it back in its place on the muddy newspaper . [Phillida]124-phillida folded up the packet , and after a moment 's hesitation went away with it , jingling keys in [her]124-phillida other hand . On [her]124-phillida return [she]124-phillida stood petrified on the threshold . [Pocket]92-pocket was seated at the table , the red bulb of the pneumatic shutter between [his]92-pocket finger and thumb ; [he]92-pocket pressed the bulb , and there was a loud metallic snap inside the camera ; [he]92-pocket released the pressure , and the shutter snapped like a shutter and nothing else . [Phillida]124-phillida came forward with a cry . [Pocket]92-pocket had taken the top off the camera ; it was like a box without the lid , and on the one side there was nothing between the lens and the grooved carrier for the slide , but on the other there was an automatic pistol , fixed down with wires , as a wild beast might be lashed , and its muzzle pointing through the orifice intended for the second lens of the stereoscopic camera . [Pocket]92-pocket pressed again , and again the mild clash of the shutter was preceded by the vicious one that would have been an explosion if there had been another cartridge in the pistol . “ And [we]3489-we never guessed it ! ”[92-pocket] said [he]92-pocket . “ That 's why [he]92-pocket went in for this sort of double camera , and rigged it up to take both kinds of shot in quick succession . It 's the cleverest thing [I]92-pocket ever heard of in [my]92-pocket life . ”[92-pocket] [He]92-pocket spoke as if it were only clever ! [Phillida]124-phillida stared at it and [him]92-pocket without a word . “ The cleverest part is the way [you]92-pocket aim . [I]124-phillida do believe [he]92-pocket relied altogether on that spot about the middle of the focussing screen . [I]124-phillida 've been trying it against the window , and where that spot comes the pistol 's pointing every time . It 's a fixed focus , about ten to fifteen feet , [I]124-phillida fancy , and the spot is n't quite in the middle of the screen , but just enough to the left to allow . [I]124-phillida do n't quite see how the one bulb works everything , but these springs and things are a bit confusing . [We]3489-we sha n't understand everything till [we]3489-we take it to pieces . ”[124-phillida] “ [You]92-pocket mean [the police]858-the police wo n't ! ”[124-phillida] said [Phillida]124-phillida , bitterly . “ [The police]858-the police ! Did n't [you]92-pocket hear what [he]2418-my father said about [a man]219-a man 's secrets dying with [him]2418-my father ? ”[124-phillida] “ [He]2418-my father 's so kind ! [He]2418-my father says that ; [he]2418-my father said it again to [me]2259-her ; but this is the mystery of the day . It 'll be the talk for months , if not years . And as yet only [you]92-pocket and [I]2259-her , in all [the world]439-the world , have found it out ! ”[2259-her] [She]2259-her looked at [him]92-pocket so wistfully , so sweetly and sadly and confidentially , that [he]92-pocket would have been either more or less than [human boy]2260-human boy if [he]92-pocket had failed to see [her]2259-her heart 's desire , and how it was still in [his]92-pocket power to save [her]2259-her the supreme humiliation and distress of sharing [their]2261-their secret with [the world]439-the world . [He]92-pocket made up [his]92-pocket mind on the spot ; and yet it was a mind that looked both ways at every turn of affairs , and even then [he]92-pocket saw what [he]92-pocket was going to lose . [Fred]115-fred and [Horace]113-horace would not sit nearly so spellbound as [they]2263-they might have done , would probably back [their]2263-they penetration of the mystery against [his]92-pocket ! There would be no boasting about it in front of [the hall fire at [school]213-school]2264-the hall fire at school , no breathing it even to [Smith minor]175-smith minor out for a walk ; no adventure to recount all [his]92-pocket days ; and [Pocket]92-pocket was [one to whom the salt of an adventure would always be its subsequent recital]2266-one to whom the salt of an adventure would always be its subsequent recital . But [he]92-pocket could “ play the game ”[92-pocket] as well as [Horace]113-horace [himself]92-pocket , when [he]92-pocket happened to have no doubt as to the game to play . And now [he]92-pocket had none whatever . “ [Phillida]124-phillida , if [you]124-phillida wish it , [I]92-pocket 'll never breathe a syllable of all this to [a single soul on earth]3497-a single soul on earth , [I]92-pocket do n't care who [they]3497-a single soul on earth are , or what [they]3497-a single soul on earth do to [me]92-pocket ! ”[92-pocket] [He]92-pocket wanted [them]2267-i to put [him]92-pocket on the rack that moment . “ Oh , [Tony]135-tony , do [you]135-tony mean it ? ”[2267-i] [Her]2268-her eyes had filled . “ Of course [I]2267-i mean it ! [I]2267-i 'll swear it more solemnly than [I]2267-i 've ever sworn anything in [my]2267-i life so far . ”[2267-i] “ No , no ! [Your]135-tony word 's enough . Do n't [I]2268-her know what that 's worth , after this terrible week ? ”[2268-her] And [she]2268-her cried again at its hideous memories , so that [Pocket]92-pocket turned away and put the camera together again , and wrapped it up in [her]2268-her waterproof , so that [he]92-pocket might not see [her]2268-her tears . “ [I]92-pocket 'll never breathe a single word to [a single soul]3326-a single soul , ”[92-pocket] [he]92-pocket vowed , “ except [yourself]2268-her . ”[92-pocket] [She]2268-her caught at that through [her]2268-her tears . [He]92-pocket could talk to [her]2268-her about it , always , as much as ever [he]92-pocket liked ; it would be a bond between [them]2269-they all [their]2269-they lives . And not until [she]2268-her said it , to be just to [Pocket]92-pocket , did [he]92-pocket think of a reward or look beyond those days . But what were [they]2269-they to do with a stereoscopic camera containing an automatic pistol ? It was not to be burnt in a grate like a sheaf of MS . [They]2269-they thought about it for some time with anxious faces ; for it was getting on towards evening now , though the sun was out again , and it was lighter than the early afternoon ; but [Mr. Upton]97-mr. upton might be back any minute . [It]2270-it was [Phillida]124-phillida who at last said [she]2268-her knew . [She]2268-her would not tell [him]92-pocket what [she]2268-her meant to do ; but [she]2268-her put on [her]2268-her waterproof again , little as it was wanted now , and the camera under it as before ; and together [they]2269-they sallied forth into [the noisy and crowded Strand]2271-the noisy and crowded strand . [Pocket]92-pocket did not know where [he]92-pocket was , and [Phillida]124-phillida would not tell [him]92-pocket where [she]2268-her was going , neither could [he]92-pocket question [her]2268-her in that alarming throng . [He]92-pocket felt a frightful sense of guilt and danger , not so much to [himself]92-pocket as to [her]2268-her , with that lethal weapon concealed about [her]2268-her ; [every man who looked at them]2272-every man who looked at them was [a detective]2596-a detective in [his]92-pocket eyes , and past [the policemen at the corners [he]92-pocket wanted to run]2274-the policemen at the corners he wanted to run . But [they]2269-they gained [the middle of [Waterloo Bridge]89-waterloo bridge]2275-the middle of waterloo bridge undetected and ensconced [themselves]2269-they in a recess without creating a sensation . “ Now , then , ”[124-phillida] said [Phillida]124-phillida , “ will [you]92-pocket focus [Westminster Bridge]90-westminster bridge and [the Houses of Parliament]3499-the houses of parliament , or shall [I]124-phillida ? ”[124-phillida] There [they]2269-they were before [them]2269-they against the sunset , [the long lithe bridge]2276-the long lithe bridge , [the stately towers]2277-the stately towers . But [Pocket]92-pocket could not see [Phillida]124-phillida 's drift until [she]124-phillida aimed [herself]124-phillida , and , aiming , let the square black box slip clean through [her]124-phillida fingers into the depths of [the river]3067-the river from which [she]124-phillida had only retrieved it a couple of hours before , as a body is committed to [the deep]2279-the deep . [She]124-phillida bewailed [her]124-phillida stupidity ; [he]92-pocket had the wit to echo [her]124-phillida then , and in a loud voice , that [any eye - witness]2280-any eye - witness or [passer - by]2281-passer - by might be struck with the genuine severity of [their]2269-they loss . But there had been [no eye - witness who thought it worth while]2282-no eye - witness who thought it worth while to rally [them]2269-they on the occurrence , and [the busy townsfolk hastening past]2283-the busy townsfolk hastening past were all too much engrossed in [their]2283-the busy townsfolk hastening past own affairs to take any interest in those of [the boy]181-the boy and girl who seemed [themselves]2283-the busy townsfolk hastening past in something of a hurry to get back to [the Strand]91-the strand . And in [the Strand]91-the strand the first thing [they]2269-they saw was a yellow poster bearing but four words in enormous black letters : — CHELSEA INQUEST CAMERA CLUE ! [Phillida]124-phillida slipped [her]124-phillida hand within [Pocket]92-pocket 's arm . [Pocket]92-pocket was man enough to press it to [his]92-pocket side .
